1211311.content:
Today had been exactly the sort of relaxing Saturday Susan had been longing for ever since she lost that bet with the Devil. There were no strange phone calls or bizarre door-to-door salesmen. No unexpected house fires, or worse, unexpected cat infestations. For once, that dog across the street even decided not to spend the night wailing at the stars. Yes, this had turned out a perfectly quiet day. It was driving her crazy.

Laying in bed, watching the minute hand on the clock tick ever closer to midnight, she wondered when it would happen. The conditions of their bet were very clear: by losing, Susan forfeited her right ever to have a normal day. She was Satan's plaything, someone he could torment all he wanted. Originally, she expected his tormenting to take the form of eternal fire and brimstone, maybe a chasm opening under her feet for a fast track to the underworld, but she soon learned she was wrong. Satan preferred more mundane methods. Like having some random gun send a bullet through her front window, only to miss her head by an inch or so. Or having the pipes under her house burst while her car rolled down the driveway to knock over her mailbox. There was even that one day where everything she ate tasted like it came out of the Red Sea.

Susan spent each day since the bet looking out for whatever Satan was going to throw at her. Like a mouse in an electric cage, she feared every spark; the smallest jolt made her run for fear of a greater blast. That fear had been her life for so long, she couldn't even remember why she had let herself be put into this cage. Oh, she remembered making the bet, but the details had faded to the point that she had no idea what that bet had actually been about, or what she had hoped to gain from it. Maybe that was how Satan kept her from getting out of the cage, or maybe Susan just had a poor memory. Either way, there was nothing she could do about it now except hope her torments in the coming day wouldn't be the ones to kill her.

Yet for some reason, nothing bad happened today. She had been prepared for the worst since the past few days were relatively mild, as far as Satan was concerned, but now it was only five minutes until the next day. Only five minutes for Satan to make her day miserable. He never before failed to keep the terms of the bet, so Susan watched the clock, expecting and dreading something horrible to happen before that minute hand finally fell on the twelve.

Four minutes left. The moon was cresting the horizon, sending pale silver light through the bedroom window. Maybe Satan was planning for her to be attacked by a werewolf. That would be new. Not quite in keeping with what he usually does, but the thought still made Susan slip her hand under her pillow to grasp her small handgun.

Three minutes left. There were no figures out her window yet. She would be ready to shoot if one did show up. But what if that is what Satan wanted? Her window faced toward the street, so what if someone was just taking a late-night stroll, and she ended up killing that person? She didn't want to be unprepared, but she slipped her hand off her gun anyway, choosing to rest her hand next to it. No reason to take too many chances.

Two minutes left. Still nothing happened. The clock kept ticking, tick and tock without stop. At least, Susan thought it was the clock. What if there was a bomb? If there was, it would be set to go off before the strike of midnight. Shouldn't she run? Of course, even if it wasn't a bomb today, there would be something else tomorrow to threaten her life. Might as well just wait and see what happens.

One minute left. Now that she thought about it, the dog's silence tonight might not have been a good thing. What if there was a serial killer making his way through the neighborhood? He would have had plenty of time to kill the dog and anyone else before making his way to her house. Her eyes darted from the clock to the window. Nothing, at least not yet.

Susan looked back at the clock. Mere seconds until midnight. Tick. What was going to happen? Tock. Was she going to die? Tick. Whatever it was going to be, it was going to be fast. Tock. Midnight. She was out of time.

And nothing happened.

She sat up and stared at the clock. The hands were still moving; midnight had come, and nothing happened. She reached for the side table and grabbed her cell phone. Yes, that also said it was midnight. It didn't make sense.

Satan never left her alone.

She sat there, trying to understand. Was she free from the bet? She couldn't see how; nothing had changed. So why did nothing happen to her yesterday? She was Satan's plaything. Tormenting her was something he enjoyed.

Then, she realized the truth. Nothing might have happened, but she had still been tormented. Satan toyed with her -- by doing nothing. Her fear and imagination did the rest.
1211311.title: Out of time

12113112.content:
Yes, Satan toyed with me. He is toying with all of us, everyone in this world. Because we feed him; our fear feed him. The fear of dying, the fear that none of us could get rid of. Ever since I felt the warmth that sunlight brings, I have known that one day I have to leave this all behind and go on a journey no one ever found a way back. That I have to disappear into the oblivion without receiving a warning beforehand. I have known day after day, year after year I am getting closer to the undeniable. Even after all these years, I was not prepared when the moment came; or at least as the Satan himself made me believe.

Over the years I prepared myself to welcome the death. I thought I'm prepared. It gave me a sense of superiority. I wanted to prove that I'm superior. Even to the Satan. Yes, I bet with Satan to prove that I am prepared; I fear the death no longer. The burning urge to prove myself made me do it. I challenged Satan. That I am no longer feeding him with my fear. I challenged that he no longer has any control over me. With the madness of proving myself, I bet that when the moment comes, I will be prepared.

Of course, I angered the devil. He gave me till midnight to live with the fear of dying. Yet it was a triumph in my eyes. "I will beat the almighty devil tonight", I bragged. At that fraction of the second, I was superior, even to the devil.

But once he disappeared, a numbness started spreading through my body. All the fears I held up pressed against the walls of logics I built up and broke free. Since then fear consumed me. I could not force myself away from the clock, counting down the seconds I have left to live. I was suffocating, gasping for breath. Air seemed to be tightening around my body. I felt like I am about to explode. With the fear that I thought I had overcome, I awaited my death, dying in every second.

Satan did not kill me. He didn't need to. I died thousand times in my mind. What difference could another death make? And Satan won. He must be laughing at my worthless soul that thought he could beat the devil.

I was wrong. No matter how much you prepare for the death, you will only be unprepared when the time comes. Death is not a test of one's strength or understanding. Death is a debt that that everyone should pay for the life that Satan loaned to us. You don't have to be prepared for the death. You can't be. You just pay the debt. Whether you like it or not, Satan doesn't care.
12113112.title: Imagination

Teeka and I got along well. (I even considered asking her to marry me once, but neither of us really wanted that much commitment.) she was my "go-to" gal. Whenever an interesting job-op got posted on the Merc board, I'd ping her and see if she was free. Being together in a ship with nothing much to do but check the gauges once in a while and nothing else but the stars for company for a two or three month stretch seemed to work out OK for us. (We got along pretty well in the sack.)

I called her as soon as I saw the posting. "Fifty thousand credits each for a quick run out to Triton and back, easy money!" I told her.

"But they lost radio contact with Triton. It could be something horrible like a plague, or local life forms wiped them out!"

"You've been watching too many old movies, you think we're gonna land on the base and find out they've all been attacked by head-crabs?" I joked.

We both liked watching classic old sci-fi movies, like "Alien"and the first three sequels. (the two after that don't count, they're crap.)

"Come on, it's just a stray meteor hit the tower and they don't have the right stuff to fix it, that's why they're sending us out with a ship loaded with material to rebuild the antenna," I said.

"yeah, you're probably right. And it's been a while since we spent some "quality time" together..."

So a month later we landed on Triton and found out everone there was dead. We put on our hazmat suits and tried to figure out what happened. We saw that whatever it was, it made them go crazy. They wrecked the communications equipment, then they all killed each other.

Teeka tore a hole in her suit on some jagged metal when we were taking blood samples from the bodies, we didn't notice it till we were back on the ship. I wasn't concerned, it was a small hole, but Teeka wanted to be sure she was OK so I took a sample from her too.

Back on the ship I ran the samples through the processor. Hers didn't show anything unusual, but the others showed some strange bacteria, the computer didn't recognize it. As I was filing the data for futher analysis it happened. Teeka picked up an oxygen canister and smashed it into the communications panel and started screaming. "We are death! Life is death! We must die!"

Then she attacked me with the canister but I managed to duck in time. I grabbed a fire extinguished and swung it around, knocking her unconscious. I tied her hands and feet with bungee cords from the cargo hold.

After she regained consciousness she started ranting and screaming again, writhing like she was having a seizure. A few minutes later she stopped, and I checked her pulse and saw she was dead...

I took blood samples from her body and myself. Mine was negative, hers was positive...

So now, three weeks afterliftoff, I'm still feeling OK, wonderimg how I managed not to get the plague. I decide to check my blood again, just to be sure. It comes back positive...

Somehow I'm just a carrier, I don't feel any bad effects. Like Typhoid Mary, My blood is full of the bacteria, but I'm immune... Or am I? I'm starting to feel a little crazy, a little torn. One minute I'm thinking I should say the hell with it, not tell anyone about what happened, just land on earth and spread the plague. The next minute I'm thinking I should spare them, just reset my couse and never return to earth...
1212.title: Lonesome Traveler

choices: Captain Marlin, Do you copy?  We have an antidote
12121.content:
After a week of indecision I entered into a moment of clarity that was so right a wave
of knowing made me glow like turning on a lightbulb in a dark room. I'd never seen a lightbulb but my granmother used to explain to me how they worked.
I wasn't going to SET THE CONTROLS FOR THE HEART OF THE SUN I was going to try what up until now was only theory as I was/am the perfect guinea pig or rhesus monkey (who were our first human stand ins as astronauts) in the perfect position and circumstance and the right vehicle to attempt the David Effect.
The David Effect is a theory that using the speed of an approaching object at a maximum speed, no matter what that speed is, that speed is proportunate to the distance from the sun that the sun can be approached. Forgeting heat for a minute. Using the gravity in, to the curve and captured just for a moment then in the accelaration and a turning release from the sun's gravitional pull. slung at speeds impossible to attain with even nuclear projection. Thus David and His sling that conquered Goliath from Gath.
No one knows what speeds can be attained but all scientists are aware of the magnetic pull of objects in space and their ratio of size to pull. They believe it might be close to light speed. How close can my ship get to the sun without meltdown? The Earth feels it's warmth from 93 million miles. Our moon is 275,000 miles away but it is held in place by the same power scientists believe we can manipulate from the sun, gravational pull.. This craft should be able to withstand being one million miles from the sun but even if I can't get that close the tremendous gravity it exerts can be utilized in a descending speed to distance from the sun ratio that isn't going to matter to me. I've bought a one way ticket and just hope my transmissions will relay to Earth the information I gather if this theory holds water. I've informed Earth of what has transpired and why I can't return. I haven't heard from them because transmissions are never real time. Our technology isn't even close. Got hung up with fossil fuels for far to long and lost ground not just with our space program but with Earth and it's peoples.
It's time to plot the course and speed and program the ship for the David Effect. Hey, there is an incoming message!
12121.title: Set the Controls for the Heart of the Sun

1213.content:
This was not just another sun set, this was special. I was in the Fiji Islands, the first time out of my own country. On this particular day the tour group was headed out in a glass bottom boat where we could look through the glass and watch the fish. By the time we were bored with that we had reached a small island with luxurious sand beaches. We couldn't really enjoy them because the sun was too hot. Instead we were
herded into bure (Fijian thatched cottage) which was one big room, dark but cool.

We sat down on the floor of the bure and were treated to a sumptuous meal followed by ‘do what you like on the island but be back at the boat by the time they had chosen’, which actually meant walking round the island or dozing off under a coconut tree, not necessarily a good idea.

I walked around the island with a group of people which included Americans, New Zealanders, a British couple and three Australian men who kept making strange remarks to the New Zealanders who didn’t seem to understand them. May have been Kiwi bashing by the Ausies but only the Ausies were laughing and the rest of us were enjoying the beauty of the island even though being sizzled by the sun. I didn’t know that in the future I would remember this island as so small that a tsunami wouldn’t even notice it.

Back to the boat and being checked off a list by one of the tour people I noticed the sun low the horizon, a huge ball of red fire. I clicked many photos with my little plastic brownie which could take only 12 square photos that didn’t do such beauty justice. But this beautiful scene didn’t last very long, it was there and then it was gone by the time we arrived back on the main island of Viti Levu.

As we disembarked many of us couldn’t take our eyes off the horizon where the sky was still red although the sun itself was out of site. It was so spectacular that we stood there on the shore as if mesmerised by the beauty of nature’s glory. We were being called to board a bus to take us back to our hotels but it was as if we had to be pried off the ground. Who wanted to get on a bus and go back to a hotel, even a lavish one? Nothing was more lavish than this sunset!
1213.title: another sunset

choices: It's 35 kilometers to the mainland,  Someone row for help.
Stay where we are and when we see some friendlys, fire a flare.
12131.content:
Whoever named what I am looking at right now a Sunset, either was in a hurry, lived in a land where that's all that happened, the sun set again or the person loved night and was biting his fingernails to the nub with a frantic anticipation of being in his element, darkness. That doesn't happen until after______!
A better name for this or any tropical sunset might be, Are you seeing the colors changing in those- "CandyCloud Bombs"? Or , Do you want to go watch- "The Sunsplash", with me"? Or Hey people. It's time for," Gaugan's Shuffle"! "But not, "That was a really nice sunset, good-night."
Call me a hopeless romantic( I would prefer-not to me face). Call me flighty, a dimrod, an airhead, a bird brain, impulsive, selfish, immature, brain dead, touched, a mental midget or even a dingy with only one oar in the water but the single, most important reason I am standing at the helm, driving a sixty foot ketch, a sailboat named Guinivere, to and through the South Seas is because
while on an OVERSEAS HOLIDAY in Fiji I had what many people call an epiphany.
I was overcome with feelings and emotions I had never experienced. I felt I was in God's arms, loved and loving, protected, cared for, nurtured, weightless and suspended between two distinct spheres of existence, Heaven and Earth.
They said I had just slumped to the ground and was unconscious for over five minutes. Two of the Australians in our tourist package bending over me and slapping my face is the first thing I saw coming from my ethereal wandering. That wasn't enough to kill the deal but close, not!
It took me two months to settle my affairs. When I arrived home, Topeka, Kansas, I can only describe it as colorless. I was living a kodac moment on undeveloped film. Drab and dismal. I knew I could not call this home ever again. I had been infected with a pecuilar but well known disease in certain areas of the World. There are two seperate reactions to this disease. One is negative and is a form of anger madness and usually leads to violent acts. The aspect of the disease I contracted instills an almost cellular instinctive compulsion, like a salmon returning to it's birthplace to spawn. The disease is called," Going Troppo".
A friend of mine I had graduated from college with said he could get me on a boat sailing on an extended voyage through the South Seas with it's destination, Australia. He said if it worked out I could remain aboard as crew indefinately.
That was ten years ago. I can't remember missing a sunsplash in all these years.
That was yesterday. Today we hit a reef, not any reef but the largest living thing on the face of the Earth, The Great Barrier Reef. We're not sinking but we are hard aground. Our radio's down so we can't radio for help. We've whittled it down to two choices.

1) It's 35 kilometers to the mainland. Someone row for help?or

2) Stay where we are and when we see some friendlys, fire a flare.
12131.title: Overseas holiday

12133.content:
Spare me the righteous indignation and moral outrage

Who are you to judge me?

You dont know me.

I dont fit into your compartmentalized view of the world,

good - bad

black - white

love - hate

winner - loser

right - wrong

INDIFFERENT!

Rambo knows

Who are you?

unless you've been me

and been there

and know what the hell you're yelling about!

Decisions that come easy in the light of day are

hard won in the dark of night.

Tell me 'O SOLOMON,

what would you do?

Fourteen years old and never been kissed,

lips as sweet as honey say "I love you,"

hands as soft as velvet say "I'll help you."

Do you turn on the harsh light of truth?

I believed in magic once.

The question is,

do I still?
12133.title: Other

121331.content:
Her beauty was without compare,
Feathers worn in her ebon hair.
Her crimson lips, those emerald eyes,
Fool was I, to believe her lies.

I listened enthralled to her words of love,
And thought her an angel from up above.
Heed my warning. For truth it tells,
Below with Satan is where she dwells.

My love for her beyond belief,
Now my heart knows no relief.
Together forever, we would stay,
If only I did, whatever, she'd say.

“We need the gold to live,” she sobbed.
Plans were made, a coach was robbed.
Away with the loot, I watched her ride.
Alone in the dark I stayed and died.

Lifetimes passed since I sealed my fate,
It matters not, I forget the date.
My soul burns forever in the depths of hell
Where the countless tortured, hear my wail.

I no longer remember the world of the flesh,
For the sake of my sanity, I think this is best.
I have forgotten her lips and those emerald eyes.
For the love of God, let me forget her lies!
121331.title: Prisoner for Love

121332.content:
I remember what many forget,
the past is past, it got up and went.
Where did the past go?
Into the present?

As you and I and everyone knows,
Today as yesterdays tomorrow flows
a perpetual present in motion exposed
an eternal now, time traveling goes,

From an edited non-existent but remembered and rewritten past
Since it never existed how could that present last becoming tomorrow,
our future, that fast?

How many people have you heard say," How I long for the good old days?" I remember what many forget excluding the bad days is bull sh#t!

Tomorrow is an abstract thought it isn't real and can't be caught. Today is tomorrow's yesterday. Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow never arrives because when it does arrive it's today. Last thoughts. Today is really today. Today is tomorrow and yesterday was today, yesterday. Are we clear?

1213321.content:
“You were supposed to be here half an hour ago, where the hell are you?”

“Annie, the better question would be when are you. Actually I’m taking a trip down memory lane, literally. August 16th, 1969, Woodstock New York. The brown acid isn’t half as bad as they were saying, at least the hit I got. Groovin’ with Santana right now baby, I gotta go.”

“Don’t you hang up on me, Steve, I’ve had it with your time machine middle aged crisis bullshit! I could care less if I ever see you again, but you promised Sarah you’d be here for her graduation! If you don’t get back here this instant I’ll pay a visit to Larry in the morning and I can guarantee you won’t be happy with the results. When I tell him about your “alternative source of income” he’ll turn you in to the Lottery Commission and you won’t see daylight for a good long time!”

“Calm down, Annie. No need to do anything so drastic. I’m truly sorry I forgot Sarah’s graduation. Once the concert is over here I’ll set the chronometer to when I was originally supposed to be there and I’ll be back before this conversation ever happened!”

“No Steve, you remember what happened last time you tried something like that and it created two of you! One is bad enough!”

“Yeah, the Paradox Syndrome, I forgot about that. Had to plead my case with the Time Lords to fix that mess… OK, I’ll be there the instant after you hang up, I promise!”

“You'd better! Sarah’s next in line to get her diploma, and if you’re not here before she hits the stage I’m calling my lawyer!”

12211.content:
"Hand over all your cash lady." He growled as he pointed a gun at my back.

"I don't think so!" I spun around, my powers tingling through my fingertips.

His eyes flashed with anger, but was there surprise under it? I searched his eyes momentarily and wiggled my thumb. I knew his weapon was inactive.

"Get 'em up" He growled, "or I'l shoot!"

"Go ahead," I smiled, "see if you can."

Click! I knew the gun was loaded, but nothing shot forth.

"What the...?" He tossed the gun to the ground and as it clanged to the ground beside us. "I don't need a gun to go after the likes of you!"

He came after me with his hands outstretched as if trying to strangle me, and I tapped my thumb and forefinger together. His hands shot to his sides and I made him hop around as I conjured a rope from thin air. I bound him and tucked his gun into his shirt, wrote a note and sent him to the police station. I noted his bulging eyes before he left. He would be changed forever.
12211.title: Hand over all your cash

122111.content:
"A New You" Biotransfer Lab, Lake Havasu City, Arizona, Year 3027:

"I see you've signed the waivers and taken appropriate steps for your estate, Mister Waters. Is there anyone here to see you off?"

"No, my family has all left, I'm the last."

"You realize once the transformation is complete there is no going back. And there are no guarantees of how long you will live in the wild afterwards. With your choice, the average is only three or four years, and it's possible you could fail to adjust and die the very first day."

"Yes, I know, you don't have to explain it, I read the brochure. And please, call me Steve."

"OK Steve, just doing my duty. I'm legally obligated to verify that the patient fully comprehends the ramifications of his decision."

"Doc, I've been around for a hundred fifty seven years now, had three wives and four kids, made and lost a couple fortunes... Life's been good, but I'm ready to move on."

"OK Steve, but if you don't mind, I'm curious. Birds are not the most common choice, but why not choose to be an eagle or raven? Or even a crow? We've had plenty of those, but you're the first starling."

"You answered your own question, Doc. I've seen the flocks of man-crows begging for food and harassing people in the parks. I don't want to end up like that, it's pathetic. I'll be the first starling, I'll either learn to interact with my wild brothers or I'll die."

"OK Steve, I really admire your courage, and best of luck to you in your new life. Just relax and start counting backwards from fifty, it'll be over before you finish..."
122111.title: Changed Forever

122112.content:
He felt a light kick underneath his little palm and he instantly lit up. He had a smile from ear to ear. You could see inside of his mouth since his two front teeth were missing. "C kicken you, mommy," he pointed out. He could barely pronounce the words correctly being four and a half. He then pressed his cheek on the tummy.

"She's just saying hi, Mark" the mother added between her short breaths. Her eyes were half closed and her face was tiresome. She could feel his short stubby hair pricking against her stomach through her Sunday cotton dress.

Mark laughed when he felt another kick on his chin. "I wik her," he said, looking up at his mother.

The mom smiled and tried to catch up on some sleep. "Good good. I'm sure she'll like you as much as her big brother."

plolp

Mark hopped from the edge of the bed to her side, which made her eyes wide open for a second. He grabbed onto her arm and swung it back and forth. "Mommy. How liwwle sissee got in your tummee?"

She smiled and patted his little dirty hands. "It's magic, honey. Now go get ready for school."

"Okay!" Mark jumped off the bed, making the bed wavy one last time. He waited until he was at the bedroom door before screaming as loud as he could down the hallway. "Dadee! Mommy saiz it MAAAGic!!!!"
122112.title: magic

1221121.content:
At the smell, my mouth waters. I want it, need it, long for it. And I can't have it. Even though they are giving free samples and there is one--that one, right there--that has my name on it. Rhyssa. It calls to me, and I sway.

But I shouldn't. I mustn't. If I do, I've not only broken my diet, but I'll pay for it later when I look at my blood sugar monitor. Although I do have my insulin and a needle. I don't leave home without it anymore, ever since that day when I managed to eat out on a salad--no dressing, no crunchies, nothing that would send me soaring. I was lucky that day. I worked off some of it shopping.

It's amazing how fast shopping lowers my blood sugar. Maybe that's the answer. I can eat it--but only if I plan to shop for another couple of hours. I don't have to buy anything. Chocolate and window shopping. Who could ask for anything more.

I love chocolate. I always have. And I want it.

I have been cursed with willpower. Whenever I try to justify my longing, I end up talking my way to the proper thing.

But it smells so good. And it will taste even better. And the cashier is smiling at me and welcoming me to the store and asking if I want it. And I see my hand reaching out . . .

I do have my insulin, after all.
1221121.title: Chocolate

The darkness has slowly closed in around my entire body.
Nothing moves, noone speaks, not a sound is heard.

Pounding on the floor.

He sneaks towards me.

because even if I'd missed his entrance

when he crosses the floor.

and they are creaking in the dark.

planting a kiss on his cheek
he squeals out in surprise

We both collapse laughing.

122112111221.content:
Here I am, an overweight middle aged guy wondering if I’ll make it to long enough to enjoy a few years of retirement before I kick. Then all of a sudden I’m immortal! Let me start from the beginning…

It was a typical Friday. I just got off work and stopped by the Blue Moon to have a couple of drinks and watch the ladies, occasionally slipping them a few bills. Chantelle comes over to see me after her set, trying to convince me to come up to the VIP lounge for a private dance. And as usual I refuse, pleading financial inability. But this time she’s more insistent, she says it’s on the house. I say OK, figuring I got nothing to lose.

I buy her a drink in the lounge she’s all over me, teasing and pleasing, it’s better than I could have ever imagined! Then all of a sudden she leans over and bites down hard into my neck and starts to suck my blood! It scares the hell out of me at first, but then I start to feel all warm and aroused, and I bite into her neck too. And her blood tastes so good, so satisfying, it’s way better than sex! She pushes me away and tells me me to stop. I beg her to let me drink more but she tells me If I don’t leave now, she’ll have Leroy walk me out, and I’ll never see her again. I ask her what she did to me, and she says now I will live forever. As long as I come back and pay the hundred bucks admission to the VIP lounge to drink blood from her or one of the other girls...

You might say a hundred dollars a day is a small price to pay for immortality. After all, it’s less than some drug addicts spend just for an early death. But immortality isn’t all it’s cracked up to be, especially if all you’re thinking about every day is getting enough money for your next fix. My advice is, if any of you guys out there get a free invitation for a lap dance you better think twice, you might be getting a lot more than you bargained for.
122112111221.title: Looks like I'm going to be here for a while...

122112112.title: Playing cards

1221121121.content:
Words

Such a small thing, with endless meanings.
We all use them, some by speaking, others by writing, but most of us use them both ways.

Most of us are able to communicate and put together long sentences to express any feeling imaginable.
Others do not like to juggle with letters, because of dyslexia.

Books are available about any subject imaginable,
and the internet is filled with words in many different languages.

Even though words are used all the time, all over the world.
Nobody is able to understand it all.
We simply use them in so many different ways.

One, two, three in English-speaking countries.

is changed to Einz, zwei, drei in German-speaking countries.

If you go to Finland
It is suddenly yksi, kaksi, kolme.

And Denmark uses the short words:
en, to, tre.

The French say
un, deux, trois

Which in Holland is changed to
een, twee, drie.

It would be easier, if we could have a common language
but on the other hand, it would also be terribly boring.
1221121121.title: A big vocabulary.

12211211211.content:
I have always had a fascination with letters. The alphabet is made up of these symbols which are so artfully displayed through calligraphy. Have you ever tried your hand at calligraphy? Those who can do it are sure to be admired!
Handwriting in general used to hold so much more importance than it does now, that's for sure. A person's script was the tell all to that person's trade or family class in society. It showed whether they were a student or a professional. Imagine making an important impression with your handwriting alone! Where has this art form gone? Well, the answer is quite obvious, given this day and age. It seems no one cares about the handwritten word.. does anyone take the care to hand write anymore because still, there is a beauty to the handwritten note. It's rare in and of itself it seems. Even if the words are not uniform and they are barely readable, they are beautiful because they were applied by hand. Every hand written note I receive which mostly arrive inside birthday cards, are framed and nailed to the wall. I find that all handwriting is unique and beautiful and sadly a rare occurrence.
I remember when I was in grade school learning cursive.
12211211211.title: Letters

12211211212.content:
Words

They come in many different types,
with many different meanings.

Even though most of us claim to speak our native tongue perfectly,
we sometimes bump into words that seem foreign to us.

Fortunately vocabularies have been invented
and if they are not able to help us.
we also have the help from encyclopedias.

gathered in a relatively tiny space
are all the words we know
together with the words we aren't familiar with yet.

Often we just need vocabularies to make sure that we are spelling correctly
But in some cases, it is nice to get an explanation from an encyclopedia.

These massive collections of words makes me wonder:
How are people able to gather so many words
before new ones are invented.

Our collection of words is changed all the time
by new inventions, and new situations
occuring for different reasons.

But still it is relatively seldom
that we bump into words not included in vocabularies.

Our minds must be somewhat alike.
since it is possible.
12211211212.title: Vocabularies.

1221121122.content:
The CD-rack is towering in the corner
hours of music assembled in a corner of the room
possibly everything is the same style
possibly it is a mixture of several styles.

It could be classical with several different instruments
it could be rock music with a loud bass hammering in the background
possibly it is a beautiful female singer
or perhaps a boy-band with several handsome young men.

It is impossible to tell from a distance
and some may even not be able to tell standing close-by,
there's always a possibility of finding something you like
and an even bigger chance of finding something you don't.

Music can be joyous to your ears,
or possibly a pain for you to listen to.
Nobody is able to say what you like.
Assumptions can be drawn, but the final truth is up to the individual.

The joyous event of listening to music that YOU find beautiful,
is a pleasant experience for the one involved
while the depression you feel when listening to something you don't like
can be a pain going all the way to your heart.
1221121122.title: A CD-rack.

12211211222.content:
When talking about poems and Metallica together, it is impossible to avoid the subject of the song "One"

The terrible story about a fallen war-hero, who finds himself connected to machines that keep him alive, even though he would prefer to be dead.

To give a quote from the tragic story:

Darkness imprisoning me, all that I see, absolute horror
I cannot live, I cannot die, trapped in myself, body my holding cell

Landmine has taken my sight, taken my speech, taken my hearing
taken my arms, taken my legs, taken my soul, left me with life in hell.

It is a frightening look into, what our new inventions may cause of happenings. Even though they are meant for good, noone is able to tell, if the result is always good in the end.

It is a reminder that we shouldn't always rely on the technology to save us, since it is possible that it may cause us even more pain, than we already had coming for us.
12211211222.title: Metallica.

12211212.content:
The floor has got holes.
Large holes, with sizes big enough to let people fall through.
Fall into the shadows

What has made the holes??

And what makes the shadows??

Light, you presume, but there's no light in this place.
Everything is dark and.

Nobody finds anything worth collecting at this spot
Nobody finds a piece for their future.

Everything is covered in shadows

Shadows so dark that no light seems to be remotely close.

If only I would be able to fall asleep
Hiding the shadows in my dreams about the shining bright sun.

Listening to the Beach Boys....
12211212.title: shadows

122112122.content:
Then it happened. A song from a long ago childhood came into my darker mind to lighten up the shadows. Here we go loop de loop, here we go loop de lie, here we go loop de loop, all on a Saturday night!"
I have no idea what it means, only it was fun to sing and dance in a circle with other kids. There were no great holes, or dark shadows or deep thoughts to contend with then, in our innocence.

From that moment other songs came to me out of the dream darkness, that I thought no light could ever come. "Little Deuce coupe" and "California Girls" took me on trip through teen years, fun in the sun, with little thought to consequences of speeding and partying! Yet I lived to see another age.

MM. maybe this spot was not so dark, just a perception. Could the holes be places I missed falling into in my life. Dark possibilities that I thankfully missed, now rising for me to see, and inspire gratitude.

Maybe it is no wonder people do not find pieces of their future...perhaps it is a trip through past memories and the dark spots are empty possibilities that did not happen....or bad dreams we do not want to remember...
122112122.title: Loop de loop.

1221121222.content:
Steph Tsunade was happy. It seemed that she had found a chocolate store where everything was half off, since it was near to the day called Chinese New Year, so she snuck into the store and sampled some chocolates in the window. Nom! The first piece of chocolates went into the abyss of her oesophagus as Steph's eyes were glazed with pure happiness from how the chocolate interacted with her tastebuds.

"Ahem," said a store's employee as he tapped the sign with a prolonged sigh. Steph blushes and paid the employee the price of the chocolates sampled before resuming her sugar-rush. Approximately 3.8 hours later, Steph unwrapped the last chocolate bar as she sighed.
"Welp, that was the last bar of chocolate I can nom," Steph hums before the employee revealed the price.
"$30?!" Steph reacted, eyes widening. "Oh no!" Needless to say, the store closed with a brassy chime
1221121222.title: recovering from the sugar rush

12212.content:
The chest slowly creaks open, revealing a small scrap of paper with a message shakily scrawled across it:

"i will LEt you know: A gloVE exists NOW"

Hmm. You see the hidden message (it wasn't hidden very well, after all) but what to do? You quickly look back over your shoulder. Is there something watching? Have they watched your search as you rushed between chests? Opening all, but finding nothing. You feel you are so close to reaching the solution. You have almost found the answer, you can feel it, but... it may be dangerous to remain. The message is encoded, so someone must have hidden the message. But was it hidden from you, or for you?

Either way, it may be better to leave. You turn, and walk away. Best not to run, or you may be noticed. You walk calmly past the rows and rows of empty chests, past the empty chambers, until you reach the entrance. That is when you see it...a chest you haven't opened yet. It is small, hidden behind the open door, and it has vines and leaves carved into it. When you look at the carvings from the corner of your eye, you can see cackling faces hidden between the greenery. So, it looks like it could be the one. You have been searching for so long. You could open it. You could, but the message said to leave.

You look at the chest one last time, then walk calmly from the room. The door closes firmly behind you.
12212.title: See the hidden message and walk away

122121.content: Bath time is a wonderful time for me. I run the water, pour in perfume and bath bubbles. Just the right temperature and the scented candles put out the most wonderful scent. Tonight is strawberry as I climb in the tub and sink down a calmness flushes over me. I can sit for hours in the tub. I am so relaxed and my skin is soft and I put on my pjs and climb into bed and have a restful sleep.
122121.title: bathtime

1222.content:
"Taxi!"

The first yellow cab went flying by. A second, three cars behind, pulled in to the curb, its trunk perfectly placed to minimize the distance my stack of luggage would need to be carried. The trunk popped open and a cheerful-looking man of around 30 with African genes and Jamaican-themed attire stepped out to help me with my bags.

"Where you going, my friend?" he asked. "Airport?"

"Yes, please," I said. "Domestic."

"Sure, sure. Hop in." He grinned broadly as he hefted the second of my four suitcases into the trunk.

I nodded a thank you, picked up my carry-on and opened the rear door.

"Excuse me?" A woman's voice, from behind me.

I turned. She was forty-ish, her hair dirty blonde, dressed in a conservative blue skirt-suit. She was holding a monogrammed briefcase. The initials read "T.L.C."

"I'm in rather a hurry to get to the airport and the supply of cabs seems to have dried up," she waved her hand to the suddenly empty street. "Would you mind sharing?"

I looked from her to the cabbie, who just grinned and shrugged.

"Why not, please -" I waved to the open rear door of the cab.

"Thank you, so much," she said and climbed in.

As I climbed in after her, the driver slammed the trunk shut with a heavy thunk and dashed back to the driver's seat to get us underway.

"My name's Richard."

"Diane."

"Nice to meet you, Diane. I couldn't help noticing the monogram. If your name's Diane, what does T.L.C. stand for?"

"Taylor, Lewis and Coates. The law firm I work for. I'm Diane Taylor - not the Taylor - his daughter-in-law."

"Wow. Successful lawyer. I'm Richard Barnes, failed musician, failed boat-builder, failed husband, failed father."

"That's a rather dour self-image."

"Yeah, well.... It's hard not to be dour when your life falls apart."

"I suppose."

"Where are you headed Diane Taylor?"

"Home, to Chicago. You?"

"California. To start over."

"What do you expect to find there, that you can't find here?"

"I don't know. I just wanted to get far away from here."

"You can't run from yourself, you know."

"I suppose."

We rode for a while in silence. Just as it was starting to feel awkward, the cabbie turned up the radio so that the jaunty strains of Caribbean music filled the space between us. The man knew his job.

As we pulled into the airport gates, Diane turned to me again. "Can I give you some free advice?"

"Sure, why not?" I shrugged.

"Don't run away," she said. "Stay and fix things."

"How? I've tried. It all fell apart anyway."

"One thing at a time. You have a list of things that you've failed at, but I'm guessing you failed at them all at once. Your business was in trouble, so you got stressed, so your music and your relationships suffered, am I right?"

"Yeah, kinda." Not kinda. She nailed it.

"Alright, so don't try to fix it all at once. Pick the one thing that's most important to you and fix that. Then fix the next thing and the next thing, until you're not a failure any more. You won't find it any easier in California."

The cab pulled up in front of the terminal. I reached for my wallet. She put a hand on my arm.

"This one's all mine."

I got out of the cab and waited while she paid the cabbie.

"Good luck, Richard Barnes, and thanks again for sharing your cab," she said. She strode off into the terminal. I never saw her again.

"So, what's it to be, boss?" asked the cabbie.

"I don't know. She makes some kind of sense, huh?"

"Smart lady, yah."

"What would you do?"

"Me? I'm tryin' to decide that mah self. I got mah own troubles. Thinkin' she's maybe right."

"Me too. Alright, take me back."

"Sho' thing, brother."

We climbed back into the cab.

"What you play, brother?"

"Hmm?"

"You said you was a musician. What you play?"

"Oh, guitar mostly. Electric acoustic."

"Well now. Ain't that a coincidence. I think just may be we can help each other out."
1222.title: Why not, please

12222.content:
"Music is in the DNA and I'm going for the ride", He mused as he thought about what was most important to fix first.
Relationships being fore most on his mind, he took a deep long breath, froze for a moment, then raised himself from the straight backed wooden chair which he had chose so that he would stay awake and ponder, and ponder, and ponder.

A shocked expression crossed his face as he finally realized after who knows how many minutes had passed that his wife was seated across from him watching with interest and intent. She was relaxed yet pensive allowing her jacket to lay crookedly upon her frame as she lounged and eyed him.

"How...where...I mean what brought you here?"
"oh, a little birdie tole me you were here."
Awkwardly clearing his throat, he started to stammer, then was interrupted by a horrible loud and screeching noise.

Thick black smoke billowed from the direction of the noise. People began to run in their direction in a mob of panic and fear.
Both Richard and his wife stood gaping at the scene.
Before they realized what they were doing they found themselves racing together hand in hand toward the nearest exit of the high rise building which was next to the air port.

The air port at the time seemed like a good place for Richard to think deeply about the future, now he wondered what the future would be for him and his family.
12222.title: a different sun

1223.content:
I know it's no excuse, but I had a really rough day at work.

So I stopped at the Wild Goose to watch the girls dance and have myself a few beers.

Then when I got home, that's when I found the damned box sitting on my front porch.


I know I should have been suspicious when I saw the foreign postage stamps and the "Athens" cancellation mark.

An the box looked old, really old, like maybe even ancient old.

And the return address was just one word.

But in my condition I was thinking, "Pandora, wasn't that the name of a heavy metal band back in the 90's? Or was it Pantera, or Pantanna? Maybe there's some cool stuff in here, like free DVDs or something!"


So I opened the box, so sue me!

Sorry about the locusts, I know they really suck, they trashed my yard too.

Rats? Don't tell me about rats, I must have killed at least a dozen of them in my kitchen alone today.

At least the whole "water turned into blood" thing isn't as bad as it looks. You can still drink the water, it's more like "water turned into water with some red food coloring and a little salt".


And the plagues seem to be getting better now, looks like we've seen the worst of it.

I know, I know, ninety percent fatality rate is pretty bad, most of my relatives are dead too, so I really don't want to listen to you whining about your losses!

Look on the bright side, at least we won't have to worry about overpopulation for a while.
1223.title: I Shouldn't Have Opened It

123.content:
So, why fear the approaching storm?
That wall of black, stitched with lightning's flash,
it's weight felt in anxious anticipation--
It promises fury-
powerful, but temporary.
Force to lay waste to something old and provide for something new

A stinging drop of rain turned fuel for nature's ever-changing show

The fear will pass.
And the storm.
And beauty and life will follow that which is dark and foreboding,
just a wrinkle in a vast and continuous tapestry of what is, what has been,
and what will always be

Until the last life is passed and there is none to fear
the soul of this stone called Earth.
123.title: dark and foreboding

1231.content:
I woke from my dream, though I was still dreaming. A knowing sent me to my window where I looked out on the mornings' dew drenched grass. Two figures lurked around a fenced in dumpster. A large, burly black man dressed in overalls looked up instinctively, knowing I would be there. He stopped for a moment, resting his well worn gloved hands on the tip of his rake. In just one glance his kindly face, full of wisdom spoke a thousand words. His gentle smile resonated through me, assuring me that all was as it was supposed to be. As I interpreted his gaze, I looked left to the second figure. A tiny, fragile blue eyed boy around the age of seven re-erected himself, hands full of strewn garbage. He too looked at me. His gaze wasn't as kind. It was perplexed. Full of regret and sorrow. He too spoke a thousand words, though not as easily interpreted.
I woke up! This time to what was real. But it was always so real. Every time I dreamed of my son, it was always so real. I began to cry as I always did when I was torn away from him. I clenched my fists over my tear drenched eyes and screamed aloud. "Noooo, please nooooo. Please let me fall back asleep. Please, please let me go back. I don't want to wake up."
But God's grace comes to me in cherished slices. I clung to it with bittersweet thankfulness and tucked it inside my heart where all the rest of my cherished dreams lived. "I'm sorry Brandon. I'm so sorry son. I wish I could understand you. I wish I could hear your voice. What are you trying to tell me? What did you want me to know? I love you, and I miss you so much. Until next time when I see you from my bedroom window."
1231.title: From my bedroom window

choices: cut away the rest of the ropes
hundreds of blades slicing my skin
12311.content:
I struggle under the ropes that bind me to the aged tree stump but it is futile. The forest elves dance around me as the flames from the bonfire dance in their eyes. I can't believe this is how my life will end. By the hands of hundreds of forest elves, the most foul creatures on the planet. I watch a couple of elves nearest to the fire. They are grabbing fistfuls of earthworms and throwing them into a kettle on the fire. I can only imagine what else is in there. Five different elves run up to me and with sharp little blades, cut my arm. I watch my blood drip into their bowls. They gleefully run to the kettle pour my blood into it. the contents glow for a quick second and the elves fall to their knees. I shift to see more and my arm rubs against one of the blades. I guess one of the little vermin dropped it in their excitement.

An old elf dips a cup into the kettle and walks over to me. He stares at me malevolently.

"You must drink the potion. You must dream a little dream," he says in a high pitched voice. I struggle with the blade, slicing through the ropes as quickly as I can without drawing attention to it.

"Dream a little dream! Dream a little dream! Dream a little dream!" the elves chant. A few of them grab my head and tilt it back. The older elf tips the cup over my face. I can see the worms in the liquid. With my free arm, I knock away the drink and plunge the blade into the old elf's neck. He screams as I rise up, knocking away the other elves. I cut away the rest of the ropes as the elves watch fearfully. I see a ladder ascending up the largest tree in the forest. I can climb it or I can run through the elves hoping that I can get away with hundreds of blades slicing my skin.
12311.title: Dream a little dream

choices: I released my hold, hit the ground running
I decided to see what is above
123111.content:
As I very quickly CUT AWAY THE REST OF THE ROPES, instantaniously and spontaineously I chose to climb! Being human and tall at that, my first rung grabbed on the "Jacobs Ladder" the elves used to go from ground to tree and the aborial heights where they made their home, was the seventh from the ground!
I had no idea of the signifigance of this until I had reached at least the twentyth and turned to see who and what was following me, for I had just severed the elder elf's cartoid artery and left him to die at the bottom of this ancient tree in this primordial forest of gloom and doom!
As I severed the rope ladder below me to assure a slower pursuit, I saw a sight that will be with me until I die! There was no pursuit! There were no elves! Where they had been were very small trees. It appeared as if it was a replanted forest after the harvest of a logging community? GONE were they! I was free and alone and would not find out till later what the Seventh Rung on an elf braided ladder represented! It seems in their world the number 7 has signifigance also?
123111.title: cut away the rest of the ropes

1231111.content:
but stopping to see if anyone was following me. There was no one to be found! In fact, there was no sign of there ever being any elves at all. Apparently, the Seventh Rung of an elf braided ladder was true. If a person reached it the elves would disappear.

I started for my home. When I left it was so dark and gray. It looked as if a storm was coming, but when I went outside I found it very quite. That 's when I was attack by the elves. I hadn't a clue as to what they wanted. If only they had be civilized and asked me instead of roping and tying me up, then hauling me back to their place. I didn't appreciate them cutting little pieces into my flesh just so they could have some of my blood.

But, that is past and I must get home. I begin to wind my way through the forest trying to remember certain things I saw. This would help me go into the right direction. It seemed as though it took hours to get home, but I don't think it did. I could not wait to rinse off and put my sleeping gown on, then climb into my soft bed.

There it is! My home. I must run now because it is so close yet so far. Hurry, get there fast. I open the french doors to my room and rush in. Only to be greeted, once again by the elves.

After the 49TH rung of " The Jacob's Ladder," I REACHED THE TREE HOUSE AND STOPPED TO REST!

Although, a little afraid and fully exhuasted, I couldn't help but notice a book on the very small table confronting me as my head cleared the space which allowed my body to enter this unique, architechurally designed treehouse.
