123112221221.content:
There was nothing more darker than perilous clouds above New York, threaded with caterwauls of angry wind on that fine, summer day. A little white blouse that I wore fluttered around my bony torso, putting my ribs on display to wicked strangers passing by me, or better yet through me. I couldn't tell if I was really that hollow or New York was a city full of selfishly obnoxious people who cared only about their own needs. The only thing that payed attention on me was shinny mirror of Tiffany's, showing me my own reflection and calling me to stop by and chat a little with nine carat jewelry in its shop window. You can't resist such thing if you are a woman, can you? Neither could I. Sparkling diamond ring caught my attention and my mind took me to the place in the future that I will never be part of. I saw myself in rich white dress, walking down the altar where he was standing with his lips slightly curved into satisfied smile. Like some kind of God, his body filled the black suit perfectly, accentuating firm muscles of his arms-- one more reason why I fell in love with him in the first place-- telling me how he can't wait to have me in his embrace. I bit my lip gently as his eyes threw a spark which stirred my heart and made my knees weak. They tottered a little when I stepped on the first stair but he reached out and kept me from falling. I heard sighs of the guests in the background but I knew I was safe in his arms. Nothing really bad could happen in this piece of heaven. Or could it? Sudden gush of wind made the angry announcement that the storm is building up few miles away, threading dark clouds above my head and he leaned on, placing a warm kiss on my lips, leaving metallic taste in my mouth. I licked my lower lip because it started to hurt and I felt thick liquid soaking my skin. His mouth were still slightly curved into satisfied smile, only this time it was more evil kind of a smile, the one you put on your face when you realize you did something bad but you felt good while doing it. I don't know if it was the first rain drop that fell on my forehead, slowly and dully killing my nerve for the balance, or his hands disappearing under my back and letting me lose support. Before I could even let the scream out, I was falling down into the black hole that opened under me. I stretched my arms, waving them through the air, hoping he will catch me, but he just stood on the edge with his wicked smile.

"Lady, watch out!" I felt someone hit me hard in my shoulder and I was back in front of Tiffany's shop window. Back to reality which wasn't too much different than the one I just came back from. I looked above and saw the same dark clouds and my white blouse fluttering in a way the wind wanted it. My reflection in Tiffany's window looked like I have been starving for months which wasn't far from the truth-- I did starve but for three weeks only, since he was gone to be precised. I know what you think now-- why would any woman want to starve herself after a man leave her? I'm asking my self the same question every morning though and I don't know the answer either. I just... starve.

"Hello! Hello!" A fine lady knocked from the inside the shop window. She then made hands movement as if she's trying to make me go away. Am I really that hollow? Scary perhaps? It's just that these clouds won't leave me alone, I argued with myself but she was persistent. She even made an angry face that looked like she's about to call security or someone and tell them to remove me away from the shop window because I might scare the customers. I was too tired for public drama so I just started to walk away by myself. I have no idea for how long I walked like that, I couldn't tell. I assume New York supposed to be asleep already but its lights were shining as bright as morning and the city was just about to become alive. Except me. The more it shined the more I was falling into darkness. I was wondering how long it will take until my light finally extinguish? And if anyone will ever notice that it's been missing in this city of eternal mornings and obnoxious citizens?
123112221221.title: Suicidal Tendencies

1231122212213.content:
"There is no such thing as unwanted child," I said to the nurse when she asked me why I want to abort it. Her face didn't have any emotion on it probably because she asked this question for so many times.
"Well, you have to give me some reasons dear," she said again.
"I just...can't have this baby. There is nothing more than that. Can you write this in the file so we can get over it?"
I knew that her intentions were right, it was her job to try to prevent me from doing a lifetime mistake. She was sitting there in front of me with her blank, emotionless face, asking the questions over and over again. The answer on every question was yes, I know what I'm doing. After half an hour of paper work she finally said, "You have to pay $375 for this operation. Do you have the money now?" I took out the money from my purse and I gave it to her. She took it and counted.
"Alright, you can come with me now but your friend has to go back to waiting room." She asked me to follow her. Elizabeth took my hand and squeezed it gently. She didn't say a word.

This institution was like any other hospital; plenty of room to move about but nowhere to get comfortable. The air had undertone of bleach and it smelled as sterile everywhere. At least I knew they were taking care about cleanliness. I followed the nurse to one of these uncomfortable rooms where she said that I have to take out my clothes and wear hospital gown that I found on the chair.

"When you're ready just come outside," she said before she closed the door behind her. I didn't expect of her to be polite and gentle. I mean, who would? I came to this place to commit a murder, there was no any reasonable excuse to treat me better than I deserved. The window of the room was half opened and I've heard birds singing. The summer was in its fullness and you could see beauty of life everywhere. Well, everywhere except at this place. Strange, only one wall separated me from the smell of mown grass but it was built so high and I couldn't overjump. Instead of it I had to satisfy myself with thought that bleach smells much better. I took the hospital gown in my hands and I sat on the chair. Thousands of thoughts run through my head in that moment. I felt like I'm on threshold of the execution, waiting for my last minutes of life. Can someone bring me tuna sandwich, please? No one heard me. I guess they don't fulfill penitent's last wishes. How cruel, I thought.
I unzipped my floral dress and I put it on the hanger. I briefly run my hands over my, already visible, pregnant stomach before I put the hospital gown on. There wasn't a mirror in this ugly room and I couldn't see how I look like. It was better like this-- emotionless faces, sterile smells and empty rooms-- a place where sane person wouldn't step in if she didn't have reason good enough to not feel guilty. The hospital gown was too big and I thought that it's comfortable. I'm sure I didn't look like one of the Victoria's Secret models though. I looked back through the window one more time to see if I can find a good reason to save this life. I couldn't hear birds singing and sterile smell became stronger, reminding me that I belong to the other side of the wall where there was no excuse for living. I put my hands on the stomach for the last time.

I'm sorry thing. I wish that everything is different now. We'll be together one day I promise. I hope you will forgive me.

How could anyone forgive me the fact that he will be dump in some plastic bag in the garbage behind this institution? I opened the door and called for nurse. She came as fast as she could.
"Doctor is ready for you now," she said as she led me to the operation room. The room seemed equipped with all gadgetry necessary for this type of operation. There was a table in the middle of the room where I was suppose to lay down. The light inside was too bright for my eyes. I found it abrasive, enough maybe to bring up a migraine. My eyes fell on the empty flowerpot on the table in the corner. I didn't need to see that to realize how death is the only thing that dominated here.
"Lay down here, I need to prepare you for the operation." Nurse pointed to me table in the middle of the room. I took off hospital shoes and I laid on my back. Fluorescent light forced me to close my eyes. I heard male'a voice came inside and assumed that was the doctor. I was afraid and ashamed at the same time to open my eyes and face him. I didn't know who was the ugliest monster in this room- him or me. I peeked a little bit while two of them were talking about anesthesia dosing. A tall man in his forties with dark and slicked hair supposed to be a monster that will kill me. He was too handsome to be a monster I thought.

"We're gonna give you general anesthesia now because that's what you asked for." He approached to the table where I laid. His hands were cold when he touched mine. I opened my eyes and saw the nurse and him staring at me. I knew they are not going to ask me any questions anymore. Deep in my mind I was begging for one more chance, for one more question to make sure if this is really what I want. I opened my mouth to say something but words didn't want to come out. I tried harder and harder but no one couldn't hear me. My screams were trapped inside and the fluorescent lights got blur. Just a few seconds later I saw nothing and screams drowned.

I woke up at some point laying on my stomach. As soon as I opened my eyes I saw the nurse sitting behind the table in front of me. She looked too busy to notice that I was awake. I felt so numb and I couldn't move anything except my eyes. I opened and closed them over and over again. As the moments were passing by I successfully moved my right arm and I turned my head to the wall. Nurse approached to me and she asked if I was alright. Her voice reverberated in my head and I couldn't get used my eyes to fluorescent light again. It looked like real nightmare when my stomach started to growl giving me some feeling of vomiting. At the same time I felt so weak for any movement so I put all my effort to finally ask for glass of water. She brought one quickly, helping me to stand up in sitting position. My head frown as my eyes were closing and I was ready to sleep again. I don't remember how hard she slapped my face then but I didn't feel any pain when she did it.

"Miss, you have to wake up now, you cannot stay here forever!"
"I think I need to go to bathroom please."

I don't remember how I came to bathroom or if she helped me then because I was half sleeping. I only know that I was sitting on the toilet and vomiting, asking myself where the hell am I and what happened to me. I looked at my hospital grown to see if it got dirty and I saw that it was totally opened from the back and I was naked. I felt ashamed of the fact that I was walking around this room like that but soon realized that it was probably just normal thing. It looked like flashback when I saw the table I laid on and I remembered why I came to this place.
"Here is some more water and you have to sit in that chair. You cannot go back and lay down again because you need to wake up, you can't stay here." Nurse repeated but somehow her words were more clear to me now. She brought me my floral dress and she said that I can wear it now. I was sitting in the chair, listening her speech about medications she'll give me and their prescriptions. She knew she had to write these down because I was still almost unconscious. My stomach hurt so bad and that was the first time in my life that I felt empty. That feeling never disappeared. I hugged myself when I realized what have I done and I swallowed hard when she gave me medicines.

"Are you sure you're alright?" Finally she started with the questions again but they came too late. This time I didn't want to answer. I took the medicines and thanked her. Nothing really to be thankful for but I tried to keep my good manners. Her face wasn't emotionless anymore, she looked like she feel for another woman. Maybe I was wrong or anesthetics had weird effect on me.
"I thought you'll never come out," Elizabeth's face was frightened. She run to hug me.
"My stomach hurts a little bit Elizabeth.." I tried to stay away from her hug when I needed it the most. Her eyes filled with tears for someone who she knew two months only. I didn't pour not even one tear. Monster did his job very well, I didn't feel anything except emptiness. You can't cry when you're empty.

"Let's get out of here, it's late already." She took my hand and we left the waiting room. Smell of the mown grass tickled my senses and I heard bird's song again. I finally found the way to jump over the wall that separated two different worlds. I really hoped that I was on the right side this time.
1231122212213.title: At the hospital.

12312.content:
For me I cherished slices. Slices of what, you might ask? Ice Cream Slices that’s what. You bought the ice cream slice along with two flat cones, then again cones can't be flat. Perhaps, flat waffle cones, no not that either. Aha, wafters, one on either side of the ice cream slice so that it was like a sandwich. Calling them ice cream sandwiches would have people thinking of ice cream between bread which sounds messy unless of course you toasted the bread!

I don't know if ice cream slices still exist or if the ice cream company still exists because when I last had one it was in a country far away and a long time ago but I would like to think they are still being produced thus I can imagine buying the ice cream slice, removing it from its paper, one side first, add one wafer, turn it over remove the rest of the paper and add the other wafer. The wafer and slice of ice cream were delicious together whereas with ordinary ice cream in a cone not much of the cone and ice cream are eaten together unless you push the ice cream as it softens down into the cone.

Oh cherished days of cherished slices, Ice Cream Slices. Now there were also Raspberry Slices, no cones or wafers but chocolate coated, in a box.............
12312.title: Cherished slices

123121.content:
When I recall period's of my youth, one aspect which stands out is illness. Those moments when a simple cold would seem like the plague, when every bump, ache and pain would be magnified to the point that you acted as if you were Sir Laurence Olivier acting a death scene.

But out of this utter misery came absolution, when as the sickness began to pass and eating became possible once again, you could look forward to eating what you truly wanted. For me this was an Ice Cream Float, which for those unlucky to never have savoured this delight, is a nice large scoop of whatever Ice Cream takes your fancy, plopped on top of a drink of pop.

The result became a nice refreshing start of cold drink and ice cream, which then became a nice gooey mix of sweetness as the ice cream melted into the fizzy drink, like a magical elixir replenishing the energy within, making life bearable once again.

Funny, how little of these cherished childhood memories we somehow refuse ourselves as Adults. Go on spoil yourselves by reliving a childhood memory
123121.title: Icecream Treat

choices: knocking prissy gals like you down
123122.content:
The old woman peered at us with distrust deep in her eyes. She pointed a gnarled finger at us then spit tobacco juice onto the grass at our feet.

"Your kind isn't welcome here. You must go," she croaked. Her teeth were stained brown and the odor of rooting flesh blasted us in the face as she spoke. Cassandra took a step back, the smell too much for her.

"And what kind is that?" Cassandra asked, turning her face away from the woman. I continued to stare at her, fascinated by the age in her body. She looked to be well into her 90's but she moved around as if she were much younger.

"You city folk. You come here and look down on us. That kind of attitude will get you in serious trouble. You best go on," the old lady cackled.

"Do you think we can't handle it?" Cassandra asked, a frown on her face. The old woman took a step toward her, anger now darkening her features. Cassandra stood her ground even though the smell must have been killing her.

"When I was young, I took great pleasure in knocking prissy gals like you down a peg or two. I'd watch your mouth if I were you," the old woman said. I pulled Cassandra away before she replied. I didn't want to upset anyone here just yet. Not until we got what we wanted.

"Can you tell us where we can find lodging for the night?" I asked, noticing how quick darkness fell. The old woman glanced at me and I saw pity in her face.

You can stay at the old Hartley house if you need to spend the night but if I were you, I'd hightail it out of town. You don't wanna be messing in anything this town has to offer. That is your only warning," the old woman said soberly. I thanked her and Cassandra and I walked to the car. We both heard the warning and hould have been scared but the excitement was just too much to ignore.
123122.title: When I was Young

1231221.content:
"Your kind isn't welcome here," the voice behind Kathleen bellowed.

         "What kind might that be, may I ask? Kathleen retorted.

         "We don't want none of you "challenged" here stinking up our pool," the voice answered .

         "I didn't see any signs that specified who can enter," said Kathleen

         "The "challenged" always leave "surprises" in the pool", said the voice. "They need to be watched like babies"

         "I'm not that way. All I want to do is take a swim. I just live down the street".

         Kathleen placed her towel on the lounge chair, took off her slippers, and proceeded to dive in on the deep end.. These actions left the woman she was talking to aghast. With her mouth ajar, she turned on her heels and stomped off.

         With those actions, Kathleen couldn't help one last jab.

         "People who eat insects aren't allowed either," she laughed.
1231221.title: Your kind isn't welcome here

12312212.content:
“Whatcha gonna get, Honey?” asked LoriSue.

“A baked potato,” said Bubba. “That's why I come here to Wendy's. It's the only fast food place with baked potatoes.”

“Ooh, that sounds good.” LoriSue studied the overhead menu. “You're gonna get sumpin' else, ain't ya?”

“Yeah, I usually get a large chili. Dip chunks of potato in it.”

“Eww, gross. It'll make your breath smell bad.”

Bubba laughed. “Don't worry, Sweetie. I brush my teeth twice after every meal, and I always carry mints.”

“Well ...” The African American couple with three small children in front of them finally finished ordering.

“Hi. Will this be for here or to go?” The fresh-faced teenage girl had a mega-watt smile, but Bubba couldn't help scowling. Why did they always start by asking where he was eating? If he wanted it to go, he could tell them.

LoriSue ordered a baked potato and Caesar salad. Bubba pushed a twenty across the counter. He wished they had a tip jar. He had never wanted to tip at Wendy's before, but since LoriSue came into his life, he felt so happy, he wanted to spread the cheer around.

They walked to the condiment bar a few feet from the counter. Bubba took a plastic knife and fork, and two little packets of pepper. He didn't eat salt. LoriSue grabbed a handful of forks and stuffed them in her purse.

“LoriSue, what are you doing?” cried Bubba.

She looked at him in surprise, confusion on her face. “Uh … What??”

He pointed at her purse. “The forks. The forks. You must have taken ten or twelve.”

“Yeah, I'm out at home. We'll need 'em for the Fourth Of July picnic.”

“LoriSue, that's … That's …” Bubba seldom sputtered put he was putting on a world-class demonstration now. “LoriSue, the forks are for eating the food we buy here. We can't just take them home.”

“Bubba, what's the matter with you,” demanded LoriSue. “They put this stuff out here FOR us to take. That's the whole idea.”

The girl called, “Large chili, salad, and two baked potatoes.” She smiled as Bubba picked up the tray. He didn't smile back.

“Oh man, you were right.” LoriSue squeezed the sour cream packet over her potato. “This smells heavenly.”

Bubba didn't touch his. “LoriSue, taking those forks is WRONG. Wendy's has to buy them, you know.”

“Yeah. They prolly pay a buck for about eleventy-jillion.”

“Doesn't matter.” Bubba sat back., no longer hungry. Not only was the the woman he wanted to spend his life with a thief, but she was in DENIAL about it!

“Whassa matter, Honey?” LoreSue popped a dainty bite of potato into her mouth. “You said you was hungry.”

Bubba sighed. One more try. Maybe she'd see it has way, understand where he was coming from. He sat forward, hands steepled in front of him. “LoreSue, stealing is stealing. The amount is immaterial.”

LoriSue's eyes flashed in the way he had found endearing until now. “Don't you accuse me of stealing, Bubba.” She pointed a finger at him. “I've worked at Cooley's One-Stop for three years. If THEY thought I was stealing, I'd be gone long since.”

OK, Reader. Your call: Was LoriSue stealing, or was she simply taking what was freely offered??
12312212.title: You Make The Call

1232.content:
"Dahl-Gren, why do you wish to stop on this small rock-and-water planet? There is such low gravity, it would be little better than the weightlessness of space!"

"I have been told there is intelligent life here, Bell-Ona. It is worth at least a few ouras of our time to investigate."

"Intelligent life? How could there be, there is no xenon to breathe."

"These creatures are carbon-based, they breathe oxygen and exude carbon dioxide."

"The histogram shows increasing levels of carbon dioxide over the last millim for this planet. If you are correct, their population may be increasing. We should investigate..."
1232.title: A Stone Called Earth

12321.content:
“I do not detect any highly advanced life forms, only tribal subsistence activity.”

“Do not be so quick to judge this planet, Bell-Ona, intelligent life forms evolved from simians are extremely resilient, as you would know if you paid more attention in planetary archetypes class.”

“Do not criticize my study habits, Dahl-Gren, I recall many classes where your deskset was empty, you remaining in our habicube claiming to be ill while secretly entertaining females of questionable values.”

“Fair enough, Bell-Ona, but let us attend to the purpose of our field trip. We must file our report of a planet previously seeded for intelligence that has successfully evolved to a level where they are worthy of being invited into the galaxial community, and we must find such a planet before the end of the semester if we have any hope of obtaining our degrees.”

“You do not need to remind me of the urgency of our current situation, Dahl-Gren, and if anything I blame you for our plight. I was a model student prior to being teamed with you, spending my free ouras poring over the datacubes. But you convinced me my evons were better spent imbibing containers of intoxicants with our fraternal brothers.”

“There is no use in crying over spilled mookla, Bell-Ona, we must attend to the task at hand. Observe, does not that object below appear to be a sign of advanced intelligence? Let us land our saucer and investigate…”
12321.title: After the Gold Rush

123213.content:
Landing the saucer, they emerged onto solid ground and they were very surprised at the solidity of it. They radioed their Control Base on Andromeda, saying that they landed safely.

Dahl-Gren noted aloud, "These black creature - or living forms - look very strong. Just feeling this gravity is a strain for me to bear. I sense from a future timescale that this landmass will be known as Africa and this area will be The Cradle of Humankind. The nearest city will be called Johannesburg - the City Of Gold".

To which Bell-Ona replied, " Yip, that's for sure. What do you think of this huge megastructure is; it's made of some metallic sort of substance?".

They approached the huge object while the black humanoids retreated in stark horror at the sight of these strange creatures. In a telepathic form of communication, the two aliens detected that it was known as a bulldozer, and it was used to disrupt and dig into the ground in order to extract the ore containing rocks.

Bell-Oma stated, "Well then, maybe this is the gold we are looking for, which our planet sorely needs to support our technological capabilities. Should we report this discovery?".
123213.title: A Bulldozer

1232131.content: The gold substance indeed should be reported but when? As they both thought this unbeknownst to each other, something moved quickly over their heads. What the...whoosh, it flew even faster. they ducked just in time to prevent having their heads removed. "we'd better get out of here fast!" they said to each other and then ran jumped and raced to their safest spot a cave. It was dark and foreboding. dank, smelling of a putrid something, and felt like a thick cloud of heaviness was over taking them. It seemed they were in trouble inside this supposedly safe appearing cave, and they were in some sort of mortal danger outside. What were they to do?
1232131.title: Gold rush

12321312.content:
The black people of Africa - as their identity had become clear to the aliens - stormed the cave waving branches and tree trunks, seemingly threatening to kill them for encroaching on their turf. Dell-Oma contacted Base Control to find out what they should do to solve their dilemma, "Outside: guaranteed death, or... what can we do?". Base Control told him that they must lift their hands slowly, as if in defeat and, when they connect with the humanoids' energy fields, to read their thoughts and to telepathically communicate to them that they are not any threat.

"They do not understand that you two are from the universal source that originally created them from the soil of the earth. You can telepathically communicate this message to them", said Base Control.

Dahl Gren focused as much energy as he could in the moment and lifted his hands, communicating through the energy field. Dell-Oma stood transfixed in fear with his hands raised. Suddenly the black people retreated and the threat subsided as if there had been no conflict at all.
12321312.title: outside: guaranteed death, or...

123213121.content:
Some time had passed before everyone got to know each other. Using gestures and body language gradually everyone managed to understand simple things about each other. Now that the troubles were over, life seemed to settle down and as soon as possible they decided to have a feast. Does this sound familiar?

A large and long table was set up, foods were gathered in huge quantities, and preparations begun so that everyone would be able to eat as much as they liked. This was great because it could have been the end of life for the cave dwellers who were trapped by the aliens. Alls well that ends well!

Wait a minute! are you sure about this, don't assume that this story has a happy ending. not yet! There is more time for adventure and problem solving. Oh yes, and there is plenty of time to explore the region which looks so inviting. It is very colorful with an out of order rainbow twisted and twirled through out the sky. The terrain looks like something delicious to eat, and whatever is far away past the caves, it is enticing because of the whipped toping...or rather it looks like that...I must be hungry, lets eat.

As everyone ate it become clear that this marvelous region was very, very deceptive. As nice and inviting as it looked, apparently there was something ominous or several somethings ominous. Well, we'll just have to see about that. Oh boy, this tastes good!
123213121.title: Peace and harmony

1232131211.content:
The aliens asked the chief of the tribe what creatures wandered in the yonder fields.

Chief Gugu answered, "There are all kinds od wild creatures; antelope, elephant, rhino, giraffe, lions, leopards, cheetah, and many other. Would you two alien creatures like to experience it , out there in the wild?".

At the thought that "Curiosity Brings Forth Exploration", the aliens responded as one, "Yes. Let's do it".

Leaving the feast table, Chief Gugu led then into the wild veld on the horizon. A rustle in the brush to their right startled them and the chief stopped abruptly, lifting an open hand. They stopped instantly. Looking to their right the aliens noticed a lioness crouching behind a tree and it seemed to glare straight at them. The aliens sprang back, behind the chief, who told them to keep still. Then the lioness looked away and strode off, as if disinterested in the opposite direction.

They advanced further and the chief pointed out a group of Kudu antelope near a river bank and he told the aliens that it was the meat of a Kudu that they had eaten from the feast table together with natural fruits and vegetables. The aliens were startled and groaned at the thought of the luscious pleasures they had enjoyed.

The dreaded lioness looked back and turned, heading back in their direction.
1232131211.title: Curiosity Brings Forth Exploration

12322.content: The Children of the Sun gathered, a circled of stones surrounding them. Patiently waiting, they watched as the moon progressed across the cerulean sky grasping for the sun. Slowly and steadily the light of life lost its brilliance as the night's eye closed its lid over the day. A dangerous thing, they knew, this point in the cycle of the heavens cast a shadow upon the Earth. Dark things awoke in those moments, attaching their hate and greed to a host, seducing innocence into corruption. Inside the circle shadows crawled from the altar stone and mingled with the shivering fear of the Sun's children. Steadfast, the sacrifices accepted their parasites, breathing in the shadow that chose them, some choking on the vile taste. When the sun reappeared, the shadows could not escape. The sacrificial bodies writhed with the panic of their parasites and twisted in the burning heat of life's rays. Something was wrong though, they did not burst into flames as the legends foretold. Instead, they accustomed their glowing red eyes to the light and turned to the circle gathered around, choosing their next victim. They could let no one survive to tell their secret, the circle was made to release darkness, not to protect the light.
12322.title: Children of the Sun

1233.content:
“Do what you want with the girl after were done.” he snapped and walked to the girl who sit franticly in the chair. Pinned down by ropes and chains. Two men stood hovered above her, watching and making sure the powers that she possessed, could not prevail. “ Hook her up and leave me her brain in a tube. There I will finally discover her secret.” The tall dark man stood still in front of her, curious as to her reaction. She should be acting differently as her fate is death. She should be glad she’s not being burned at the stake for the witchcraft she performed so many years before.
Yet, as scared as she was, deep within her mind, she was searching for a way out. She knew her powers could overtake the three men easy, though just with the thoughts could be a little tough. She needed her voice, her whisper. She felt the chair jolt beneath her as she spoke the spell in her mind and hoped it would work. The two mysterious men carried her and the chair to a nearby table that sat in the center of the room. The florescent bulbs dimmed as she passed. As much as she strained and pushed, she could not stop the needle that was injected in her arm. The small pin poke of pain it formed on her flesh. The burning… Nor, the fluid that now ran her veins now. ‘What are they doing?” She thought, But she already knew the answer. She was being punished. Lord Terto was soon to find out her true secret, which to come to think about it, was no big secrets at all. Suddenly, she felt dizzy and out of it. Her mind heavy and weak. Her body tighten and withdrew from the rest of herself. There cold hands moved her body to the table. Straps tightened around her. Her breathing became hesitant, her eyes heavy. Her mind unable to think. Except for a spell she knew would help her. A spell that would turn the tables and put them exactly where she was now. The spell…the name was It promises Fury….
1233.title: It  Promises Fury
