1243.title: Addressed to me

12431.content:
On this particular day my father came to my brother and myself and stated, "There is money missing from the book shelf. Did either of you take it and forget to tell me? We told him that we had not.

There was only one other person in the house that day, my young friend Joanne. She was a very talented girl, played the piano, performed ballet and sang in competitions, she was also good at school. Her parents owned a successful business so she was never in need of money or anything.

My father approached her and asked, "Did you take some money from the book shelf in my room Joanne?"

As she said that she hadn't stolen the money there was nothing my father could do. Years later when she stayed with me in my flat for a short time I was to find out for sure the she was a thief and a liar.

I always thought of her as the little girl who had everything and yet had nothing. She didn't use any of her talents, didn't become a musician, a singer or a dancer nor did she even finish high school but she did become a full time thief!
12431.title: Missing Money

124311.content:
I placed an envelope, that contained a letter and one thousand dollars in small bills, on the kitchen table. While I was showering, Robert returned from the construction job he had been working at for the past week. The letter and money were a payment that was owed a friend who loaned it to us when we were in a tight spot. I was going to give the money back , along with the note of thanks.

         After I finished my shower, I went into the kitchen to put the envelope in my purse. It was gone, along with Robert. I fumed. My face was beet red and I felt very hot. I began screaming at the top of my lungs. After my tirade, Robert returned. He walked calmly through the door. He was oblivious to my anger and rage. He came to kiss me and I pushed him away. He looked dumbfounded. I told him to get out and that I didn''t trust him anymore.

         As he walked away, his parting words were that Jack appreciated the note and money.. I was shocked.
124311.title: Trust

1243111.content:
I began collecting glass and crystal animals at my high school graduation party. My second cousin, Nancy, gave me a leather overnight bag. Inside the bag was a small glass elephant. To this day, I still have that elephant, along with a menagerie of other animals.

         I have traveled to Florida, Tennessee, Pennsylvania, and went on a cruise to other countries. The collection now includes elephants, unicorns, dogs, cats, whales, dolphins, and other animals. I even have a glass fire hydrant for the dogs to use. I have never stopped collecting and never will. If someone were to ask me:What animal would you like that you do not have? My answer would have to be a hippopotamus. I now have two display cases that are full and am working on a third.If anything were to happen to cause me to lose my collection, it would feel like someone took a piece of my life.
1243111.title: Collecting

12431112.content:
"I see on your application under hobbies you say you are a collector."

"Oh heavens, yes, have been for years! You could say it's my passion, other than my work, of course."

"I'm a collector myself, only recently started, so my collection is still very small. You must have quite a large collection yourself."

"Yes, quite. At first it only filled my basement, then the garage. Eventually I had to rent one of those self storage units. Shortly thereafter my wife left me, after a brief argument where she suggested I store myself in the unit along with my collection! I was understandably upset at the time but I persevered, and now believe I am much better of without the old girl. And in the meantime I've purchased a warehouse, so now I have much more room for my collection,"

"Well good for you, Mister Farnsworth..."

"Of course George, but you must call me Ellie. I feel we have so much in common. Don't think of me as your employer, consider me your friend."

Yes, well as it were I was at a collectors convention, and I had heard through the grapevine that aliens might be about. It turns out many of them are quite avid collectors, especially of American historical artifacts, one of my specialties. choices: Tom Tells The Rest Of The Story
1243111222.content:
Wring his hands and muttering as he stalks away< George could think of only one thing. He was focused and determined to have things his way no matter what it took or how long.

"hey George!: Turning suddenly and with eyes wide as saucers, George spied his life long friend.
"hey Tom, long time no see." Tom stretched out his hand in greeting, "com'on, lets go to the diner and chat a while."
"no, I can't right now, got work to do," George shifted from one foot to the other and looked about every where.

Tom finally took notice of George and wondered what was causing him to act so, so different and like a trapped animal.
"George, what's wrong, man? I haven't seen you this way since being in Nam years ago. We should find a nice quite place to hang out for a while." Gently Tom nudged George hoping he would go along with the idea.

eventually they found a quiet spot behind an office building and rested against a railing. George still darting eyes roaming every where shifted his weight. Tom stood his ground and contemplated what he should do next.

Eventually George started talking about the interview he had for a new job and all the details including what he thought.

"that's crazy stuff! "Tom dropped his jaw and eyes wide looked straight at George. I wonder what has him this way, Tom wondered as he scrambled to figure out the best words to use to discard George from doing a horrible act.

"George< you know that God sees everything people do, right?" George shrugged not looking down. "well, and you know about the commandments, right? And there is the part about where we'll end up when we leave this place, and...and...you've wanted a job for long time, so why ruin it now? Besides I remember when you considered Jesus to be your friend, That's what got my attention. To this day I'm grateful for everything you said to me, showed me, and helped me with for all those many days." Tom hoped he was getting somewhere, but couldn't know for certain. He could only hope George would come to his senses and do the right thing.
"i guess I'll need to think." George started to walk away.

12432.content:
Who is she? I don't know. I thought she was my friend.

Then came the day I realized that all I knew was her false identity.

She had never really listened to what I had to say. She was only being polite.

The words she spoke were empty words devoid of true connection.

I cried a lot when I found out that all I knew was her false identity.

I am asking her now to be real. I am asking for genuine interaction.

She says she wants to reconcile. She says she wants to connect.

Can she? Is she capable of coming out from behind the safety of that false identity?

Can she be real?
12432.title: False Identity

124321.content:
Bob elbowed Kenny in the ribs and said "Check out what just walked in."

Kenny looked up from his drink, trying not to be too obvious while getting a good eyeful. A hot brunette with a tight t-shirt and a pair of jeans that look like they were painted on. "Oh man, can she be real?" he said.

"I don't know, but I'm gonna find out," Bob replied, standing up.

"Bobby, you ain't got a chance. Don't you ever get tired of hitting on women out of your league and getting turned down?"

"Kenny boy, your problem is you think small. You're satisfied to pick up any plain Jane that'll have you. Me, I'm meant for bigger things. I may get turned down ninety nine times out of a hundred, but that one time, oh man it's gonna be worth it! It's gonna be front page news!"

"OK, Bobby, good luck with her. I'll be here to buy you a beer to cry in when she shuts you down."

Kenny watched as Bob walked across the barroom and started talking to the woman. He couldn't hear what they were saying over the music, but she was smiling as he bought her a drink, and they sat down together at a table. By the time Kenny ordered his next beer Bob was headed towards the door with her.

"I'll be damned," Kenny muttered to himself.

Bob lay there on the cheap motel sheets, naked and spent from their lovemaking. He looked over at her and said "Honey are you thirsty? We could go back to the bar and have a drink."

"I think I have all I need right here," she said, smiling.

Bob thought she was leaning over to kiss him but she bit deeply into his throat, quickly severing his jugular vein. He didn't even have time to scream.

The next day the front page of the paper carried the story: "Man Found Dead, Body Drained of Blood."
124321.title: Can she be real?

1243212.content:
As the morning light fills Daria's eyes, she wonders what happened. "I remember being at the bar, but, what did I do?" she asks herself. With her curly, golden brown hair blowing slightly across her face, she sits in front of the window looking out over the world for an answer to her question.
As she retraces the events of the night, leading up to entering the bar, she takes the sketchpad from the table beside her.
"Ok, this is what I know" she tells herself. "I was at Jingles with Sarah and Emily. Emily and Sarah wanted to go home, but I wasn't ready to leave. Oh, they left without me. I should have gone with them," she says. "Oh well, nothing I can do about it now. I just have to remember what happened next."

Still looking out over the world below, her pen moves across her sketchpad almost automatically, as it always seems to when she's in deep thought. After a moment, it hits her. When the party was over at Jingles, she decided to try the bar down the street in hopes of making a good time better.

Only a few doors down from Jingles was the Local Pub. As Daria entered the building, she looked around, recognizing no one. "Oh well. Strangers are only people you haven't met yet," she thought as she sat down at the bar. Lost in the rhythmic groove of drums and bass, Daria did not care that she was alone for the moment. As she sat perched atop the bar stool, she closed her eyes and threw back her head. In her mind, she was up on the dance floor with her hands in the air, swaying back and forth to the sweet sounds filling her ears.

"Oh goodness. I have to move," she thought. "Bartender, don't throw my drink away. I'll be right back," she says as she tries to take to her feet. Slowly, she made her way to the restroom. Once inside, she placed a hand on either side of the sink. After standing there for a few moments, she threw water on her face and then blotted it dry with a towel. That's when Daria decided to go back to the bar to finish her drink before heading home for the night, but that's also when her mind's light goes out.

As she sits, unable to conjure up any more memories, she reaches over for the tv remote. As Daria turns on the tv, she hears,"This morning a local man was found murdered in a nearby hotel room. Bob Connelly was found with his neck torn open and he apparently bled to death on the bed. He was last seen leaving The Local Pub with an unidentified female".
"What?" Daria screams as she jumps from her chair; her sketchpad flying out of her lap. "Wow," she says, leaning down to pick up the sketchpad. As her eyes fall upon the paper, she sees the words, 'BOB... Back to life."
1243212.title: Back to Life

Right forever.
Keeping you in its hellish nightmares.
Forever.

You then realize its over.

The sun awakens from its heavy slumber of night
It's blanket being taken
By the earths greedy animals
Begging for the sun.

Awakening and gleaming
A beautiful anthem
Of beauty and praise.

Shouldn't we give back?

choices: Why did the stomach aliment go away?
124322112.content:
Some believe that fate has a huge hold on them and the out come of their days. My belief is that what we think, believe, and put into action is of greater with in our daily events. However, most importantly for me is God, Jesus, and Holy Ghost. They are my strength and security each day of my life. Fate has no hold on me and I will not allow it to grasp tightly onto my person. Reading scripture strengthens my spiritual muscles as similarly physical exercise strengthens the muscles in our bodies. I trust in God, Jesus, and holy Ghost to care for me, guide me, and be with me always.

We can decide our future which is eternal life, however where will I go or you go? It is up to each individual to decide and invest into the eternal life they want to have and how they will have it because it will be custom made for each person according to the choices they make and what they choose to do while on this earth.

Harry decided to go for a cup of coffee even though he knew his stomach would rebel, but he couldn't resist the flavor or smell which called for him regularly. As much as he wanted to change his life style it seemed impossible. He was a prisoner of his decisions. Slowly walking toward McDonalds he based at the sun rising over the mountains and wondered where he could get help. There was no medical insurance he could afford. He had enough money to not qualify for assistance and as far as he knew there were no other options.

As he sipped his coffee enjoying the fine and wonderful aroma and glorious taste, a stranger took the stool next to him. Long hair hanging over the shoulders and a baseball cap caught his attention because this was exactly what a life long friend used to wear. Surprisingly this person looked almost exactly like his friend. He blinked and shook his head slightly in amazement and then for no apparent reason extended his hand in greeting.

As they clasp hands and nodded Harry felt a strange sensation. Wonderment showed on his face and the stranger smiled.
"I know, it happens all the time. I must have extra energy which ofttimes needs an outlet. Sorry to surprise you like that. I'm Joe."

Hi, Joe. Harry didn't know what to think and wasn't certain if he wanted to be this close to the stranger.
"I'm Harry. And, please keep your distance."

" Harry, can we talk? I promise not to touch you, ok?"

"stay away from me!" Harry rounded his shoulders and leaned away from Joe as he started to get off the stool.

Cammon, Harry, I promise not to touch you, please don't go. We need to talk, absolutely need to talk. How's your stomach? Joe waited for harry to sit again but Harry just stood there with his mouth open in amazement.

"How'd,..geese, how'd you know...OHHH...

Harry went pale and started to shake. The room started spinning and Harry sat quickly to make certain he didn't land face down on the floor.

"Here Harry, try this.

Hesitantly he took a sip of the beverage Joe was offering. Within seconds he feltt a little better. Then a few minutes later it was as if nothing had happened. Starring at Joe he pushed the remainder of his coffee far away and sat like a statue. How could this be? For years he had trouble with his stomach but now suddenly he was healed.

Hours later Harry understood everything. He realized his choices made all the difference in how things would work out for him each day. This stranger soon became a close friend. All because Harry decided to listen to someone he didn't know.

They still meet regularly for morning drinks but both of them order herbal tea.
124322112.title: Fate

She is adopted by a loving family and thrives.
1243222.content:
It's only just begun. The mystery of the girl who was thrown away. It seemed, from the beginning, nobody wanted her from the time she was born. She was found in a dumpster when she was only hours old.. In the care of the state, she spent only two months in a foster home. It was found that the boyfriend of the foster mother shook the baby, which caused brain damage.

         After returning to the system, the girl languished for another three months before another foster home was located. Once placed in the home, it seemed that the girl found her place. Little did she know, that was not the case. Two weeks after the placement, there was a fire which the parents and thirteen year old son perished. Only the girl and her six year old foster sister survived. Extended family took the sister, but not the girl.

         What happens next?
1243222.title: It's only just begun . . .

choices: Samantha is caught in the act
12432221.content:
Sarah waited by her upstairs window in anticipation. Her foster parents Clara and John Smythe had told her about the new arrival, a girl ten years old, like herself. As she stared out the window, waiting for the car to arrive, she day dreamed about playing barbies with her new friend, her only friend actually.

In school, Sarah did not fit in, no matter how much she tried. No matter how many foster homes she went to, or however many times she changed schools, she felt like the outcast. Children were often mean, picking on her for her gap between her two front teeth and larger than normal ears. It didn't help that she was scrawny, pale, and half a foot taller than most of her classmates.

Her eyes widened in excitement as a black sadan arrived in the driveway. She grabbed the gift she had wrapped for the new arrival, her favorite mermaid barbie. She strategically chose her because of her red hair, which Clara had told her the new girl had.

Sarah was halfway down the stairs when the doorbell rang. Clara looked up at her and smiled, before opening the door. She greeted the heavy set older woman at the door. "Come in Mrs. Tedesco." She bent down. "And, welcome home Samantha."

Sarah was peeking behind Clara. " Oh, and this is Sarah."

Sarah stared at the freckle faced redhead and wondered if she was teased as much as her. She handed her the present. "I got you a gift."

"Thank you," she said looking towards the ground, but she was smiling at the new gift.

They went into the living room. Samantha was still holding the unwrapped present. Mrs. Tedesco nudged her. "Sweetie, open your gift."

Samantha ripped the paper off, revealing the used mermaid barbie. "Pretty!"

"Momma Clara told me you had pretty red hair. That's why I chose her. Sorry that her eyes are green instead of blue."

"That's alrght, green is my favorite color."

"Girls why don't you get to know each other while Mrs. Tedesco and I talk. Sarah, show her the room you will be sharing."

Sarah perked up with pride. "Come on, you'll love it. I promise!"

She dragged the new foster girl up the stares, smiling in excitement. One they were in the room, Samantha slammed the door behind them. Her shyness transformed to a scary assertiveness. "Let's set some ground rules. I'm the boss. You do what I tell you, no matter what or this will be you." She ripped the head off of the mermaid, and shoved violently into Sarah's chest. "And, keep your nappy headed doll. I don't want your used shit!"

Sarah's eyes pooled with tears. "I-I hoped we could be friends."

"Oh, we'll be real good friends if you don't piss me off." She burst into laughter. "Now stop being a cry baby and smile. You wouldn't want to get me in trouble, now would you." She pointed at the headless barbie in warning.

Sarah tried to wear her best smile, even though her lips were quivering.

12432221.title: She is placed again in another foster home

12433.content:
A beautiful glass globe with a park at it's center.

As I gaze into the globe I am taken to another place, another time.


We talked of the future as we strolled by the planets, our first walk in the park.

Mercury. School.
Venus. My future job.
Earth. Our future together.
Mars. Your prospectives.
Jupiter. Names of our children.
Saturn. Foods that always be a part of our lives.
Uranus. Our spirituality.
Neptune. Our future home, on a beach, somewhere in Florida.
Pluto. How we wanted to spend the end of our days...


As the memory ends the remnants of snow finally settle in the park. The couple, kissing on the bench, lightly frosted. My face, stained with memories of what once were.

Where are you now?
12433.title: Walk in the Park

124331.content: Listening for the silence I can hear you; treading softly through my thoughts, walking in my dreams, watching over what was once your own. Standing at the side of your grave, thinking savage thoughts, I wonder how you can stand to be where none but I can heed you. Like an invisible poison, dripping slowly through my veins, you lurk inside my core, waiting for when we are alone. Don't think I don't know your game. All those years spent standing in your shadow; you'd think I could recognise your intentions by now, yes? Don't blame me for your demise, either. I was not the one who drove the steel support home, to rest snugly in your corrupt heart. Not I. Nor was I the one who laid you to rest here, amoung the willows in a grave too shallow for the likes of you. So don't go and pretend; we all saw through you a lifetime ago. Anyway, I would have buried you somewhere far away, in a desolate valley where no one goes. It would have been a deep grave too, with no headstone and a tainted soil warning posted nearby. So consider yourself lucky. Within, I feel you beginning to stir, and I know you'll see these thoughts and feel vindicated; avenged. And not without reason I suppose; I DID provide the alibi for your killer, so he could live out his life without being hounded by the police as well as you. Not long to go now, love; the night is nearer than you think. It'll all be over soon, and then we can fight this battle anew, in a higher realm. The birds begin their chatter, settling down for the evening, and I realise I want to too. But where we're going, you and I, we don't need rest or peace. Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned, they say, and true enough I'll give them something to think about, when we get there. Don't you worry. Its going to be finished. The lump in my heart begins to swell unbearably as I recall those I'll leave behind. What will they think? But now is not the time for reasoning or thoughts. Standing at your graveside, breathing in the cold air I'll not be feeling again, I think it's time to bury this burden. Shaky hands reach into my vest pockets, searching for what could have been some sort of solace. My rough, callused fingers pop out the pills one by one, and when I have a handful, stop. I take a long swig of the vile gin you used to drink, wondering how you could stand the stuff, spluttering as my throat is burnt by the strong liquid. Coughing hasrhly, I raise my hand to my mouth and swallow.
124331.title: In My Dreams

1243311.content:
Just as the bitter pills slipped past my throte for my stomach to absorb the contents, there was a tug on my pants. Looking down, there was a tiny horned man, no taller than five inches. " Hey, Jackass, you can't kill yourself with asprin.?"

I kicked at the annoying creature, causing him to fly a few feet away. "It wasn't asprin. I told you not to bother me anymore!"

Unaffected , the little man jumped backup and crawlwled up my leg from the inside of my pant leg. I swatted at him as the oddly rodent like feeling crawled up my flesh, but my attempts were met with laughter. So, i removed my pants, in hopes of ridding himself of the little monster.

After tossing the pants on the ground, the little guy walked out of the wasteband, arms crossed, holding his gut in an explosion of laughter. "Oh, you are funny! You know you can't get rid of me."

"You're not real!" I closed my eyes wishing the annoyance away.

"I am very real." To prove it, the little shit jumped up from the ground as if some sort of magical acrobat, landing with his teeth clenched on the tender web of skin between my thumb and pointer finger.

Screaming, instinctively, I banged my hand into the nearby tree, sacrificing damaging my hand, to loosen his razor grip. He let loose, falling to the ground. Yet, again, he sprang up, unharmed. He stuck his tongue out, blowing a rasberry, before hiding in the overgrown grass. "Let's play hide and seek."

Obliging, I began stomping at the ground, my heavy foot banging against the ground everywhere I heard laughter. The little bastard was fast. In exhaustion, I gave up, refusing to play his game anymore.

"I give up. Why don't you just kill me? That's what I came here for anyways. "

"But, you're not finished yet. You promised!"

"I made no promises!"

"Ok, ok, to be fare, your brother made the promise."

"I'm not my brother. Besides, those pills should take effect any moment now. Then I'll be relieved of you and this world."

There was more laughter. " You sure are funny for a self-loathing poet. If it is a headache that you plan to be relieved from, then those asperine should do the trick."

"THEY WERE NOT ASPERINE!"

"Umm, yes they were. I watched your brother trade them out. Or you, same thing."

"What do you mean by the same thing?"

"You don't have a brother. He is just another part of you."

My nose flared in anger. The little shit was playing with my head now. "Stop telling lies, demon!"

He let out a sarcastic exhale. "Cope however you wish, I suppose."

"Cope with what? Choosing to protect my jealous brother over allowing justice to be served in the murder of the love of my life?"

The demon rolled his eyes. "You,, umm, sorry, your brother was just fulfilling his promise."

"What promise?"

The little man clenched his fist, looked down, and shook his head. "Why did you send me up here to deal with this mentally unstable moron?!"

"I am NOT a moron! I will have know that I have published several books of poetry and novels. In a review of my last novel, the New York Tmes proclaimed me a literary genious."

His voice carried a sarcastic tone as if taunting me. "Oh, dear, and do you actually remember writing anything?"

Being honest with myself, I didn't remember writing anything. Typically it was as if I went into a trance, waking up with the finished works. "Now that you mention it, no."

He docked his eyebrows. "You see, you are just some moron that traded his soul for fame."

"I would never do that! "

"This was fun at first, but now you're ticking me off. I wanna speak to your brother now."

To my dismay, the demon crowded under my feet, causing me to trip and hit my head on the gravestone.

124332.content:
Slowly, I realize, that the dream is on again. Or is it a dream? I never seem to know in the end.

When I was a little girl playing at the beach, a giant wave reached for me. I saw it coming, I heard my parents yell, yet I could not move. I was mesmerized. Suddenly, I awoke in my room. I could still taste the saltiness in the air and feel the breeze harsh on my skin. Jumping out of bed I ran to my window shoving aside the curtains and searching the shoreline. Somehow my heart knew you were there.

Remember at the track meet in Baton Rouge? I was lingering in the girls locker room trying my hardest to psych myself up. I so desperately wanted to break the long jump record and I knew I had more than a whisper of a chance. Already, in my private practice I had broken it twice. Today, it would count. As I left to join the others on the field I was suddenly grabbed from behind and pushed into the first bathroom stall, hard, falling backwards on the toilet seat. The breath had been knocked out of me and my right arm hurt horribly. I looked up into a masked face and seeing a bat raised over the head of my attacker I opened my mouth to scream when suddenly, I was back in time sitting on the same bench psyching myself up. The difference was, I remembered what had just happened. Running all over the locker room I tried to find a sign, any sign that what I thought had just happened, had. My arm didn't even hurt. I know now, it was because of you, you in my life.

Who are you? How do you know when I need you? Why are you in my life?

1243321.content:
Ruby Rayne awoke suddenly at the crash outside her front door. She looked at her clock radio and saw it read 2:28. Getting her robe and tying it, she looked out her picture window. What registered was a sight nobody should see. Two compact cars: a red 2005 Chevy Cavalier, and a blue Ford Taurus, had a head on collision, Ruby screamed and grabbed her phone to call 911. Something told Ruby to go into the kitchen to make the call. While on the phone to 911, there was a huge explosion. Ruby screamed.

         The ambulance and fire trucks were on the scene within minutes. This scene was reminiscent of twenty years ago..At that time, Ruby watched as her mother and baby brother, Brian, were in a car accident and before anything could be done to save them, the car exploded and they perished. Now twenty years in the future, she was seeing it again. Only this time, unbeknownst to Ruby, one of the passengers was James, her fiance.

         After Ruby finished the call, she looked at her ring. She wondered where James was. He was going to call her and wish her sweet dreams. Today would have been their wedding day.

Of course it was just a dream! I'm a young man not a little girl in some giant wave waking up to crash on me as my arm is being broken in a bathroom that I am being thrown in to? Or am I?
THE DOCTORS LOOKED AT THE X-RAYS TOGETHER, SPEEding to fix a problem they were witnessing but had never seen before and had no idea how to go about it without telling me that there was no fix!
Yes, while attempting to ride my friend's son's BMX bike on a BMX race track I wrecked. I thought I had a dislocated shoulder. I asked Terry Tauras to pull really hard and relocate it! I am in Australia and figured he could fix it, ridgy didge! He said,"No, Robbie it is a bit more than that!" He called for an ambulance.
He was right. The doctors, after viewing the x-rays said my collar bone (clavical) was broken in three places. Then, that there was nothing they could do. You see, you can't put a cast on a collar bone. So I asked if I could work tomorrow?
I was informed I could do whatever I pleased if I could tolerate the pain. I mentioned that I was currently sanding boat bottoms from scaffolding and they broke out laughing. I did it for two days but my employer's wife is a nurse. She didn't think it was a good idea. I went to work for someone else because I had to. I was a yank (they call yanks, septic tanks) a long way from home I was. In Australia. I had to survive. I'd been weaned a long time before this happened. It got well but there is a lump.

12433221.content: The Australian salute. Ah, yes. Some might be wondering, what about the Australian Salute makes it so special? Well, I'll begin to tell you what me grandfather told me about that. He told me that, the Australian salute is always done backwards. Not only backwards, but also upside-down. It's like Opposite Day when you do the Australian Salute. Therefore, when we typically raise our arms up, the Aussies swing theirs down. Would you like to know how to do it?
12433221.title: Austrailian salute

choices: Traveling in the," Land Down Under."

124332211.content:
Here is the secret that no one knows until they travel in the land down under.

The Australian Salute is a series of hand and arm motions constantly moving up and down then side to side, only stopping, briefly, until the next onslaught of flies find places to invade on your person. You would swear it was impossible for a fly to fly his(or her) way there. Up your nose, behind your sunglasses, behind your clothes (meaning underneath), pant legs and open shirt, all body parts are accessible to an Australian fly.

It would be commercial suicide to inform a tourist industry that those wonderfully unique Australian hats with
all those corks on a string bouncing and vibrating in a 360 degree circle around the hat were to distract (only briefly) the continual and relentless bombardment of the Australian flies vehement focus on making mankind miserable.

Here is how you do it. Everywhere a fly starts to land move your arms and hands to not let him (or her) land on your body. You get better with practice. No worries. You'll be a pro doing the Aussie Salute overnight. Fair dinkum.

"Well Steve, did you get directions back to the highway?"

"No Annie, the old coot just got me more confused. He did tell me there's a diner up ahead, maybe we can get lunch and some better directions there."

Scene Two: Run down 50's style diner. Old juke box, greasy chrome counter, cracked vinyl seats. Deserted except for the 50-something bleach blonde woman in a dirty apron standing behind the counter.

"Can I get y'all something?"

"We'd like two coffees to start, and then we'll look at the menu."

"Ain't got no menu, just what's wrote up on the board," she says, tilting her head towards a chalkboard behind the counter, as she pours the coffee. "I'd recommend the barbeque pork. My son makes it fresh in his smokehouse, it's real good."

"OK, I'll take the pork sandwich, with coleslaw and fries. How about you, Annie?"

"I'll just have a grilled cheese, no sides. I'm not that hungry. Can you tell me where the ladies room is?"

"Ain't got no separate bathrooms Ma'am, just the one. It's down the hall, second door on the right."

"Thanks."
12433221211.title: At the diner

124332212111.content:
Annie walks out of the restroom and stops in front of the next door, which is marked "Meat Locker, Employees Only". Her curiosity gets the better of her and she opens the door and peeks inside. She stares, horrified at what she sees, then slams the door and hurries back to the table where Steve is busy eating his lunch.

"Sorry I didn't wait for you Honey, but this barbeque smelled so good I just couldn't resist!"

"Steve, don't eat any more of that, it's not pork!"

"Well whatever it is, it sure tastes great!" he says, taking another big bite of the sandwich.

"Put that down Steve, we have to go, right now!" Annie says, getting up from the table.

"OK! OK! Just let me just pay the bill first!" he says,

"Just leave a twenty on the table and lets get out of here!"

As Steve is pulling out his wallet, they hear a noise that sounds like a car door being slammed shut, and then a simple looking man dressed in greasy overalls and a Duck Dynasty t-shirt walks in and says "Hi Mama, I'm about starved. Can you make me a Barbeque sammich?" to the woman behind the counter.

"Sure thing, Junior, just let me take care a this couple's bill."

Steve says "We left a twenty on the table, you can keep the change. Do you know the way back to the highway?"

"Sorry Hon, I don't drive. You can ask my Ex, he runs the garage down the road a piece."

Steve and Annie hurry out the door. Junior looks at his Mom, chuckles, and says "They'll be back."

She looks back at him and says "And if I know you, pretty soon they'll be on the menu!"

Then they both burst out laughing so loud that Steve & Annie can hear it outside as they get into their car.
124332212111.title: The Awful Truth

1243322121111.content:
Junior hadn't finished laughing as Annie whispered to Steve," I know what to do".

Steve quietly answered," You mean with the b.........,." "Shushhhhh," Annie stopped him in mid sentence and continued with, "get in."

Annie had seen a rear entrance door to the refrigerated walk-in and told Steve to drive to
the rear of the restaurant and to not turn on his lights.

He, trusting her, did as he was told. They pulled up to the back door not using their brakes but used the emergency brake so as not to have the tail-lights ignite exposing them. Steve thanked Annie for not putting her BREAKDOWN. Annie unscrewed the overhead lamplight and opened the door as Steve pulled the trunk opening lever. He quietly got out to help Annie get the body of the hitch-hiker they had accidently run over and killed while looking for Koalas in the eucalyptus trees lining the highway.

It was bad enough driving on the wrong side of the road. It wasn't their fault they had hit the bum. What was he doing in front of them in the middle of no where, anyway?

"Well the good news is he won't be wasted," Steve said to Annie. "Mama and Jr. cook excellent BBQ."
1243322121111.title: Breakdown

choices: Return to the Diner from Hell
1243322121112.content:
After they get in the car, Annie says, "I looked inside their meat locker, they had smoked dead bodies hanging from the hooks in there!"

"Come on Annie, you've seen too many horror movies, it must be your imagination. They were probably pigs, or young cows or something."

"They were definitely not pigs or cows. You ever see a cow with long blonde hair, or a pig with hands with fingers wearing a ring?"

"Oh my god! I was eating people?"

Steve turn green, opens the car door and vomits onto the pavement. He slams the door shut, says "Lets get outta here!" and turns the ignition key. The starter grinds on and on but the car does not start.

"Oh my god, Steve, we're stuck! What are we gonna do?"

Steve jumps out of the car and opens the hood just as Junior walks out of the diner. Junior takes a look and says "Looks like somebody stole your spark plug wires... Happens all the time around here, just kids fooling around."

"Can you fix it?"

"No, but my daddy can, I'll give him a call at the garage. Y'all can come back inside and have some coffee while you wait, if you'd like."
1243322121112.title: It's a Non-Starter

12433221211122.content:
"Thanks for the offer, but we'll just wait out here until your father shows up. Be sure to tell him to bring spark plug wires for a 2010 Camry."

"Okay, I'll tell him. But if he's still working on that Silverado transmission he started on yesterday, it's liable to be a while afore he gets here. Y'all can come on back inside for some coffee if you change your mind." Junior says, and then he walks back into the diner.

"Steve, I'm worried. What if he comes back out with a gun?"

"I'm scared too, Annie. But there's not much we can do here, we gotta just hope the old man shows up with the spark plug wires. That's probably the scam, Junior steals the spark plug wires then Dad sells them back to the out-of-state travelers for some exorbitant price. Maybe they even put fake dead bodies in the meat locker to scare us, jack the price way up on those wires. Hell, I'd pay anything just to get out of here now if I thought those bodies were real."

"Maybe you're right Steve, but I still think those were real bodies."

As they are talking, a rusty tow truck pulls up next to their car, and the old man gets out holding some wires. "Pop the hood, son," he says.

Steve open the hood, and the old man looks in and shakes his head. "No, I don't believe these will do. I'll have to drive down to the parts store in Clayton. It's after five now, so I'll get right on it first thing in the morning."

"Come on, didn't your son tell you we needed parts for a 2010 Camry? It's a pretty common car, you sure you don't have the right ones? Or maybe your son has them. I'll pay you extra for them, whatever you want."

"Boy, this car may be popular where you come from, but not many folks out here drive foreign. And I'm hoping you're not implying that my boy was the one who took your wires, if I thought you was saying that, I might just drive off and leave you here to find your own way to fix this car."

"Oh no mister, he didn't mean that he's just upset! Please, please, just help us!" Annie says.

"Well alright then, now that we understand each other. Since y'all'l be spending the night, you'll need a place to stay. My cousin Bessie runs a boarding house not far from here, I can drop you off on my way back to the garage."
12433221211122.title: Hoping for a Miracle

124332212111221.content:
The old man drops Steve & Annie off in front of a dilapidated two story clapboard house that looks like it hasn't seen a fresh coat of paint since the South lost the war. A crooked hand-painted wooden sign hanging from the porch light says "Bess's Boardinhouse".

Steve rings the bell, and a heavy-set grey haired woman wearing a faded sun dress answers the door. "Y'all looking for a room? I got 'em available by the day or the week," she says.

"Just for one night."

"You're not from around here, are ya tourists ore somethin'?"

"No, we were just passing through and our car broke down."

"Well come on in and I'll get you set up with a room. Supper is at six, we got tuna casserole with peach pie for dessert. Or I got some of my nephew's pork barbeque left over from lunch, if you prefer. It's real good."

"We'll have the tuna casserole," Steve says looking over at Annie, as she nods in agreement.

"Suit yourself. Once you all get settled you can come sit out back on the porch. I got some fresh made lemonade for while you wait to eat."

"OK, thanks." Steve says, as he signs the paperwork and pays for the room.
124332212111221.title: At the Boarding House

1243322121112211.content:
"Are you Bess?" Steve asks just as Junior walks in eating a BBQ sandwich, and mumbling," GGr-rmm-mm bsstick bla unk."

Bess answers, "Yes " and" get your butt out of here you ignorant, piece of insignificant road kill. I told you never to step foot on this property!" " You and the inbred looney-tunes pretending to be your parents" " Get gone with you or I'll get Sarah, my shotgun and re-introduce you two!"

"Sorry about that" she said to Annie and me, "He's not right in the head. I think it has something to do with what he and his family eat. A dietary problem "I've never seen them eat a vegetable or a piece of fruit. I think they live on BBQ sandwiches. I'm a vegan myself but I don't push it on people like Christianity and democracy."

"I figure," Bess said after a pause," if you've got to shove democracy, a diet and exercise or religion down someone's throat with a gun, what's the point?" "Not meaning to bore you two with a bunch of
meaningless rhetoric or scriptural clichés before you've even checked in and had a decent meal but I'll leave you with one of my favorite scriptures which says pretty much how I feel about stuff. Revelation 22:11. When you get to your room, do me a small favor. Break out the Gideon and read it out loud to each other. If we all did what it says this world would be better off for it."

"Dinners at six. Welcome to Bess's"
1243322121112211.title: Junior Pays a Visit

1243322121112212.content:
Scene, the back porch of the boarding house. A man dressed in a pastel lavender suit is sitting at a large round table with several empty chairs, a pitcher of lemonade and some glasses are in the middle of the table. He greets Steve & Annie as they approach. "Wonderful evening, isn't it?"

"Yeah, I guess so, but we sure had a pretty rough day," Steve replies, as he takes a seat and pours himself & Annie a glass.

"Oh Steve, where's your manners! We shouldn't be troubling a stranger with our problems."

"Oh no, no, that's quite alright, and don't call me a stranger, think of me as a friend. My name is Stanley Teebles, and if you tell me what's wrong I might be able to help."

"I'm Annie, this is Steve, and we were on our way from Charlotte to visit my sister in Rome, Georgia, when we decided to take the scenic route and got lost."

"You two sure are lost, you're in Tennessee! Where's your car, I can give you directions."

"Someone stole the wires from our car while we were at the diner and they served us barbequed people and now they want to kill us and, and..."

At this point Annie breaks down crying, and Stanley approaches her and says "There, there, calm down, girlfriend, I think I know how to fix this. What kind of shoes are you wearing?"
1243322121112212.title: Stanley Teebles

12433221211122122.content:
"Hmm, not ideal, but I suppose they'll have to do. You say you were on your way to Rome when all of this started?" Stanley asks.

Annie, recovering from crying, sniffles and nods her head.

"OK, I want you two lovebirds to stand and face each other and hold hands. Now Annie, click your heels together three times while both of you repeat after me "There's no place like Rome...""

"This is stupid," Steve says, but Annie looks at him pleadingly, and he finally joins her in repeating "There's no place like Rome, there's no place like Rome, there's no place like Rome..."

Fade to black.
12433221211122122.title: Red Converse Hi-Tops

124332212111221221.content:
Scene: The front seat of a wrecked Toyota Camry.

Steve opens his eyes, shakes his head, muttering groggily to himself "Must've fell asleep at the wheel..."

He looks over at Annie, see she is starting to come to, and asks her "Are you all right?"

She answers "I think so. What happened? Where are we?"

"You were napping while I was driving, and I started getting drowsy too. Last thing I remember was crossing over into Georgia, I guess I nodded off right after that and drove us into a ditch."

They get out of the car to look at the damage and try to determine where they are. Annie says "Hey Steve, this is gonna sound weird, but did you dream when you fell asleep driving?"

"Yes, actually I did. And it was a pretty strange one."

"Did your dream have a crusty old mechanic, some redneck cannibals, a run-down boarding house and a fairy godfather in it?"
124332212111221221.title: Somewhere in Northern Georgia

choices: Let's do the Time Warp Again
1243322121112212211.content:
"Yes, as a matter of fact it did... That's really strange."

"Well, there have been cases reported of shared dreams, you know," Annie says.

"Yeah, I guess that must be it. Anyway, let's see if we can get out of here."

They look down an empty road, no way of telling where they are. Annie pulls out her cell and says "I'll call my sister, see if she can help us."

Steve walks over to survey the damage on the car. After punching in the number, Annie holds the phone to her ear for a few seconds then pulls it away, looks at the screen and shakes her head. "Shit! I'm not getting any service!"

"Well I'm not surprised. After all, we are out in the sticks. We'll just have to wait until someone comes along."

A local in a rusty pickup stops shorty thereafter. "I can give you a ride to Leeland's garage, he'll be able to tow your car in and fix it up for you."

They get in the truck and start driving towards town. Steve says, "Is there a Hertz or Avis around here? Somewhere we can rent a car?"

"Mister, this is a pretty small town, we ain't got nothing like that. We do have some conveniences, though. If you need a place to stay while your car's in the shop, Leland's cousin has a boarding house, it's right up the street. And if you're hungry, his ex wife runs the local diner. They make a mean barbeque up there, you should try it. It's real good!"

Fade to black.

Cue music: Nine Inch Nails "Closer"

Roll the credits.
1243322121112212211.title: Unhappy Ending

1243322121112212212.content:
"No, in my dream I was a teenager again, at the high school football game. I was underneath the bleachers with Cindy McGregor, the cheerleader. We were making out and I was almost to third base, then I woke up here when the airbag hit me."

"Steve, you're a dirty little boy!"

"Yes I am, and that's why you love me. Now let's see if we can get out of here."

They look down the road and see a sign that says "Rome 15 mi." Annie pulls out her cell and says "I'll call my sister, see if she can help us."

Steve walks over to survey the damage on the car while Annie talks to her sister for a while. She hangs up and says "She's gonna call the local repair shop and have them send a tow truck, then come out here to meet us."

"That's great, things a looking up. Now we can enjoy the rest of our vacation."

"I'm surprised at you Steve. Usually you're so negative when something bad like this happens."

"Well, I guess I'm just relieved we weren't seriously hurt or killed."

"Or eaten by redneck cannibals," Annie says, laughing.

Cue Music: John Denver's "Country Roads"

Scene: Steve shaking hands with the tow truck driver after he finishes hooking up the wrecked Camry.

Steve and Annie get into her sister's car, the three of them talking and laughing, and they follow the tow truck down the road, driving off into the sunset.

The End.
1243322121112212212.title: Happy Ending

"A friend in need is a friend in deed".

124332212111222.title: A Friend in Need

125.content:
Picking up my now lifeless tea cup
with a shaking hand
by the now quiet phone,
I look downward,
puzzling at the drops
splashing in the near empty
porcelain vessel. Where they are coming from? I look
up to check the obvious offender
was it raining? on top of everything?
Scanning the ceiling
No.. besides it's not raining today.

For the second time that early morning I spy
from the corner of my now noticeably
wet eye, in a corner a little red spider
watching quietly and as stealthily
discerning rightly before even I
the tears cascading my cheeks.

Oh god, I roll my eyes, as I realize
willing the tears back to the
recesses.


NO... no more tears..
. no..why...dang,

why wasn't I
worth the fight, the competition?
NO....
Guttural sobs now
overtake my normally
imperceptible mental tenacity.

As silent as the tears began,
as cruel as the ambush
and realization of my unending weakness
I am brought to my knees,
submitting refractorily rendering
every emotional moral fiber I ever possessed
melting me easily as
one to the floor... Curling up there,
wondering why, after all this time.
after all this time. WHY?

wearily, submitting to the oh so familiar position

the phone once again, uncharacteristically shrills out a pattern
cutting the air with it's pollutive scream.

I questioningly look up to the ceiling now devoid of my
familiar cell mate and find my hand reaching up,

to get it, uncharacteristically, and just as
uncharacteristically the torrent disappears completely
along with quiet forgotten cell mate.
In the corner of my room.
125.title: a little red spider

choices: If I had the time to write a novel, it would be about...
1251.content:
I am sitting here, at my desk,
gazing out my window and
thinking up your funeral song.
It's been days since the crash and my mind is
as blank as the paper in front of me.
No breath of wind,
no sigh of relief.
Only a tense,
waiting
silence.

A tree sways in the distance,
rocks back and forth
to an invisible beat.
Your hips had swayed left and right,
keeping time with the music,
and with the beating
of my heart.
You hadn't seen me.
Then you'd looked up, and flashed me
that thousand watt smile.
The one that could power an
entire entire country for an hour.

They say you'd called my name,
when they'd found you on the road.
They say you'd asked for me,
in the last moments of your life.
While the tendrils of your youth
had run in rivulets down the grimy pavement,
I'd been in an office,
Oblivious.
A whirlpool of agony drags me down,
And it's all I can do
not to follow in your footsteps.

I am sitting here, at my desk,
gazing out my window and
thinking up your funeral song.
It's been days since the crash and my mind is
as blank as the paper in front of me.
No breath of wind,
no sigh of relief.
Only a tense,
waiting
silence.

I set my hand to the paper
and I begin to write.
1251.title: a funeral song

choices: An unknown shadow moves from the corner of the room
12512.content:
But how can I possibly write a funeral song? My soul cries out for vengeance against the man who so forcefully took you in the long grass beside the highway. I cringe at the thought of your violation, of you begging for your life, succumbing to the will of a homicidal rapist, of being left for dead in the wreckage of your own car. And now I peer out my window, wondering what evil lurks in the countryside surrounding this house. Who else will suffer before the monster is caught?          

But that is a question for the police to answer, not me. I am a mere office worker who now travels everywhere with a loaded revolver at the ready. I am ever vigilant for the monster which occasionally lurks at the edge of my peripheral vision. I am sure it is the monster from my haunted youth which so violently took you from this world. I am sure it is the devil himself which lurks out on the fields, extracting evil deeds from otherwise good men. You were the light which had always kept the evil at bay. And that is why the evil took you away from me.

         I look at the gun sitting next to me on the desk. It is bright and shiny, a vintage Colt firearm from the days of the lawless old west. With one pull of the trigger I could cross over and join you in the great beyond. Together we could dance across the cosmos, walk across the eons of time and space. But it is not time yet for me to pass over. I must protect other young women from the evil. I must be alive to do that. I don’t think the police will be able to catch him. I will ultimately have to take action.

         My mind wanders back to the memory of your jade green eyes, of your gentle smile, of the love which poured from your heart on a daily basis. I think about the cold and stormy night we made passionate love in a secluded cabin, and I smile. I finally know what to say in your funeral song. I know how to sing of your majesty up to the heavens. And I think I know how to come to terms with your untimely death.

choices: She who is not without blame
125122.content:
How can I survive when I can no longer feel. How can I do anything but weep, I loved her so.

I feel her arms yet around me, through the pain of memories, I lay my head beside her pillow, breathing her scent into to my lungs, and am terrified that her scent will leave, and I’ll truly be alone.

This monster that took her still roams free, I see him in every shadow, behind every corner, I hear her screams, her pleas of mercy, and I wasn’t there to protect her, as I swore to do.

I saw her broken body, and screamed to the heavens…why, as I was coolly told we are sorry for your loss, as they led me away, I wanted to stay and be with her but was forced to go.

How many tears must fall, before I learn to feel again, I see her smile, I feel her touch in everything I do, The other day I swore I saw her, and my heart quickened, and then I remembered, but in that second I was alive and whole once again, and then the shadows came.

If this is the life I will lead, then I may as well pick that cold piece of metal up and use it, and be free, That monster killed me right along with her, fore I am truly dead.

She was my life, my happiness, my very being, and yet I struggle, to honor her, I want to spit in his face, when he is caught, when they drag him out of the shadows, and show him to be the coward that he is.

He will no longer be an unknown shadow, that exists in the corner of the room, maybe then I can start to live.

choices: Sorrow consuming your soul even as you destroy me
12513.content:
I woke up screaming, like I've done every night since I met you, covered in sweat and pawing at myself to make sure the blood was all in my head. Sleep has been impossible, and rest a fleeting memory of times long since gone by.

Oh God, what the hell is wrong with me. Even as I dream of you, tearing me apart piece by piece. The sound of your laughing echoing in my ears, as the blood fills my throat and spills into my eyes. Even as I choke and drown and feel the life draining from me... I reach for you.

Because I catch a glimpse, every now and then, of your beautiful green eyes. And I tell myself that I can see the sadness in them. Sorrow consuming your soul even as you destroy me. And so even as I wake up screaming, heart racing and shaking from fear. I look for you in the shadows of the room. Not for worry of my death, but for wanting of you here.

I do not see the monster you have become, no matter how the beast may rage or the pain which you will surely bestow upon me. Because I can see the man behind your eyes, the remorse you feel as steal my life. And I know that one day you will come for me and my dreams will be inescapable, but I will only smile and search for your eyes then... because your eyes are my salvation in this nightmarish haunting.

choices: Tonight is a Good Night to:
12513121111.content:
1.) Do something/anything out of the ordinary. 'Seize the day," as they say, rather than just muddling through and doing what you have to do to get by. After all, life is pretty short; it's better to experience it than watch it on your iPad.

2.) Get up early and stop at the local donut shop and pick up a dozen to bring in to share with your coworkers. Even if (especially if) no one else ever does this. And don't expect anything in return for once, just do it to be nice.

3.) Go through your closet/attic/garage and gather all those things you no longer need or no longer fit you and give them to a local charity. You don't really need all that stuff anyway, and it would be a big help to others in need in these hard times.

4.) "Cowboy up" and do something you have been considering for a while but weren't sure you had the guts to do. Join your local community theater group and try out for that part in the next production you've been thinking of; Sign up for that river rafting or zipline adventure you saw posted on the bulletin board, even if you are afraid of water/heights, And convince a brother/sister/friend to go with you. Conquer your fears, you'll feel better when you do.

5.) Pick up the phone and call that old friend or relation you haven't spoken to in years. Maybe it was because of some petty disagreement in the past, but now rather than anger you just feel bad that you no longer are in touch. Just call them and say you're sorry (even if it wasn't your fault), and see where it goes from there. No guarantees, but you might be pleasantly surprised. And if not, at least you'll have the satisfaction of knowing you gave it an honest try.
12513121111.title: Today is a Good Day to:

125131211111.content:
I couldn't believe it! I, "Seized the day",I thought!

Oh, the plans laid out and not one came through! Other things did and I'm not sure what is good or bad? I thought I would try and break through. I called an old relation and he hung up on me!

I took a bunch of my stuff down from the attic and garage storage. Skis, surfboards, two motorcycles, a wetsuit, two snowboards, three mattresses, a kayak with paddle, and instead of doing craigslist, I donated. I ended up putting everything back where it came from?

I tried to cowboy up! I went to church for the first time in ten years. They asked me to leave. My Bible interpretation didn't match theirs? Go figure! A guy died for me. He took my place. What can I say, but thank you? They expected me to do something? Hey! How can I pay a debt that has already been paid? That was dumb! Why would anyone want to even attempt to do the impossible? Is it possible to pay a debt twice?

I couldn't do the doughnuts. I did the holes, though. They are quite filling! Heh!

1251312111111111.content:
I was whistling a tune and thinking while walking home from Church. My Church is
a picnic table located under a giant pine tree growing on the bank of the American River.
It wasn't that long ago or very far from our Church where Sutter uttered his famous, " Eureka, I've found it! and the rest is history.
My sister and I founded our location and as far as I know the concept. Our Church is called," Curch of the Picnic Table". We have a very large congregation and have visitors from all over the World sit and discuss God, Jesus, His Holy Spirit from scripture. We have no doctrine. In our Church members have found through revelation the Bible is alive. It is a living Word. Doctrine is an agreement and a traditional man made belief system. It can be incarceration and is position and seperation.
The living Word transforms. As one's perception changes so does one's interpretation. What I read in the Bible yesterday, when read again today, does not have the same meaning. A changed and different person is reading John 1:1-5. Today is today. So we give on to today what is todays.
If we had a doctrine it would be this; I believe in Him who He sent. I believe Jesus is AND that He is a rewarder to those who diligently seek Him."
The gold we receive at the picnic table on the American is baptism by fire. The Word of God is creation. It creates. We don't. It's the jeweler's fire removing the dross from the gold and silver, releasing the impurities, purifying till what is left is one thing.

When I was whistling, walking and thinking, I was seeing Saul of Taursus and the process of him undergoing overcoming and receiving a new name, Paul.
He witnessed a rapture in Stephen when martyred by Saul's conviction. He was visited by Jesus on his way to Damascus. Experienced his first but not last revelation. Was blinded and did not see until a prophet of God was ordered to release Saul from the bondage of sightlessness. The prophet reminded God who Saul was and what he did and he was still doing.
This zealot, this leader of the Pharisetical Party or belief system, turned 180 degrees in his faith and wrote most of the New Testement. " How can you break through the rock hard heart of a Pharisee?" I can't and would never try unless I was told to by God. He does fine as the author and finisher. He told me He has it under control but would let me know if He wanted any help.
The battle isn't of the flesh. It is strongholds, dominions, territories and principalities. Traditional religion preaches, a rapture of the Church, Armeggedon, 2ND coming of Christ, satin's power, burn in a hell, for eternity, self transforming excercising will, guilt, works, emphasis on the wrath of God, tithing which was finished with the Levitt Priesthood replaced by Jesus and an immortal Melchizeldeciann Priesthood, having no mother or father, no beginning nor end. In essence, what is being taught or at the least suggested, is that God is broke and weak and stands a chance of a satinic victory. He reaps what He does not sow, He's jealous, He doesn't perform what He says He will or has performed. Much more, depending on which denominational doctrine that particular cult or sect worships.
When God said He was finished from His works and entered into His rest, was He finished? When Jesus said, " It is finished," did He lie?
The demonstration of God's plan and will for believers in Him and His son and the Holy Spirit in linear time (worldly) was over two thousand years ago!
Paul says, satin transforms himself into an angel of light and his minions into ministers of righteousness. Pharisee is a word. Saducee is a word. Christianity and Christians is a word.
Religious people aren't automatically spiritual. Many people and peoples saw, touched, stood near, spoke with Messiah and didn't receive him as God's son, their salvation and savior. Very few saw him as friend, brother and His Father as their Father? Why not? It is written.
Pharisee is a state of mind, a stronghold! A stronghold has a stongman. The Bible speaks of what must be done to free the prisoners incarcerated and shackled by this strongman. Unfortunately this is impossible when no one knows who or what the strongman is! Why don't people know?

The answer is: A teacher can't teach and a preacher can't preach what they don't know. There is a drought for the speaking of the Word. This means there is no hearing. Our very faith comes by hearing. Our hearing comes by every Word out of the mouth of God. The traditions of man make the Word of God to no effect!
God didn't invent Catholicism or any of the 1,000's of denominations all calling themselves Christians?. Man did. So what is a Christian. God didn't create Christianity. Christ didn't create Christianity or ask anyone to become a Christian. He was a Jew. I follow Jesus. If I am anything, I am a Christ follower. I am not a Christian, nor could I ever be. It isn't scriptural.
A last thought as I am whistling, walking home and thinking: What did Christ mean to you, when He said," Beware of the leavening of the Pharisee?" Peace be with you, Marlin

1251312111111112121.content:
12/25/2012, 80 miles above Roswell, NM:

T'Kau: these Earthlings have such odd customs, celebrating the birth of one of their own, a being they think to be the offspring of their god. They believe he was sent down by this god some two thousand orbits of their planet ago, in order to save them from a curse put upon their souls by this god even further in their past, when their distant ancestors offended him by stealing fruit from one of his trees.

P'Alai: They do not realize that if it wasn't for the son of one of your ancestors who visited here some two million orbits ago and enhanced the DNA of several of their primate species as a middling school science project, they would not even exist as a species that had the ability to imagine such ideas.

T'Kau: True, true. But it is interesting, the fact that they believe in a god at all, and that such beliefs persist among most of the self-aware species we have seen in our travels throughout the universe. Of course, it is unfortunate that the Earthlings, like all the others, are so misguided in their beliefs.

P'Alai: Yes, it is unfortunate. Everyone knows that ours is the only true God, whose son was sent down to us, born to a humble slave girl twenty million orbits of our planet ago, to enlighten us of the path we must follow.

T'Kau: True, true... I am glad our tour of observation here will be over in time for us to be home in time for our holiday. I am so looking forward to celebrating the J'Su's birthday with my wife T'Peng.

P'Alai: I will also be happy to be home celebrating with my family. I especially enjoy seeing the looks on our children's faces when they decant the gifts M'Lau has hidden for them under the X'Tasmas tree.
1251312111111112121.title: A Spaceship...

12513121111111121212.content:
Bah was a Humbug. His older brother Ho, was awake, ( a rarity) on time and waiting for Bah and his two other younger brothers, Noah and Sad, to practice for their upcoming performance at the Bugall Music Hall.

The Hum's were better singers together as a group than they were as solo Hums. Ho Hum made the audience sleepy. One could hardly hear Noah Hum and
Sad Hum made his listeners look down at the ground after he performed. Bah was what made the Hum bugs one. He was Bah Hum, Bug #1.

Their group was named," The Bah Hum Bugs. Bah, combined the family Hums voices into a combination of their individual projections. What was released by this
unusual mix differed by which Hum bug had the lead.

Every citizen bug, who lived in New Bugme City, would not miss Bah Hum Bug's Bash at the Bugall Music Hall. Ho hum was the master of ceremonies. Many
New Bugme bugs felt Sad a better Hum bug than Ho Hum to MC the Bugall Music Hall Bash! Noah Hum was a bug that bugged no bug. Thus his name," No Hum Bug"!

As it turned out, the Bah Hum Bug's at the Bugall Music Hall Bash ln New
Bugme City was a smash! No, Sad and Ho Hum, Bah Hum Bug gone.

An alien UFO hurrying home for the holidays, took a shortcut, entered our gravitional field unawares. Many witnesses thought the fire in the sky was the returning Son of God. Others wondered how that could be saying, Is it possible to return to a place you already are?"

We can't bug New Bugme City bugs any more. Dead Aliens no more Bugme
Crashed and smashed, the Bugall Music Bash! The end of Bah Hum Bug.
12513121111111121212.title: Bah Humbug!

choices: Two Albatross almost to the Pacific via Terra Del Fuego
125131211111111212121.content:
"One bugs lose is another birds gain." was the new bird Word! Another was," Stop bugging me" and my
personal favorite," That's as cool as a bug in a rug!"

As far as any bird I spoke with could remember there had never been this many different birds of a feather flocking together ever! It bugged me after awhile. There were toasted bugs of every shape, size and form conforming to the many individual bird pallets on display at the aftermath of the aliens total annihilation of New Bugme City.

Every species of bird on the planet had a now very fat representitive gourging himself on a smorgasbord of toasted (no less) bugs with apparently no end in site!

Chicken Hawks were dining right next to chickens. Eagles next to pidgins. I had seen mice eating bugs between the two legs of their natural enemy, Owls! What is the World coming to?

The screeching sound from this once in a lifetime bird love-in reminded me of the Old Filmore Auditorium in San Fran when Blue Cheer was tuning up! If it didn't burst your ear drums, it lifted you off the floor about six inches and your body pulsed with the beat involuntarily!

Me and my mate are Albatross. Haven't ever eaten a bug. Rarely see them where we spend most
of our lives. The peaceful open Ocean is our home. There aren't any other birds either. A sailboat or
a cargo ship is it! We stay away from military ships. They are trigger happy and don't know that any sailor that kills one of us, curses his vessel and shortens his life.

This landfall was worth dropping in to see. When we go to our birthing site, have I got a story to tell? No one will believe me but they always believe my wife! "C'mon honey, time for us to bug out of here!" I couldn't resist. "Let's go fishing. I'm hungry and that bugs me to no end!" Heh!
125131211111111212121.title: Birds of a feather

1251312111111112121211.content:
The two Albatross were full after diving for and filling up on fresh sea fish of exquisite taste. They were heading towards home in the Caribbean islands.
" I see land Duchess! we'll soon be in our old mud hut again he squawked
and not soon enough for me." said the Squire of bird Island. " Can you feel that heat honey." as they breezed towards a safe landing.
"Oh! I can't wait Squire.as she shook her wind swept feathers into a presentable fashion and looking into mirage of water she checked her beak and smoothed her wing over her face .
The couple made their way to the mud hut that was home and were greeted and tweeted by Hannah and Humprey the Carribean couple who look after and cooked for the Albatross squire and his Duchess.
"Master squire and Duchess Albat! It is so good to see you after so long. You must be tired after such a flight. Here, sit and rest. We have prepared a nice banquet of fish pie and salad for you both and you must tell us of you adventures." chirps Humphrey. "Hannah go see to your mistress Duchess Albat she must need a good pamper."
Hannah pampered her mistress and they all had a feast that night and stories of there adventures in a foreign land were told under the warm moonlight of bird Island on the Carribean.
1251312111111112121211.title: Two Albatross in the Caribbean

choices: Who are the strangers using the light house?
12513121111111121212112.content:
Two firery orbs suspended and floating about twelve inchs from the ground went on and off
as the light house's beam marched through the night screaming Danger to all ships venturing close to the jagged teeth surrounding Bird Island. These very jaws are what made Bird Island a perfect sanctuary for breeding pairs of Albatross, who thrive on the solitude and predator free environment of the blue water of the open Ocean.
They rarely come ashore and then only to breed and hatch an egg or two. Both awake now, they slowly came to the realization they were in the presense of their mortal enemy, a feral cat! Feral cats have done more damage to the Albatross breeding colonies around the World than any other single disease or predator!
They were in luck and both knew it. Unburdened by the necessity of protecting a young chick, together they are a formidable opponent against any man or beast. With unusually muscular wings for birds and eight to ten foot wingspans, one feral cat is at their mercy. Their main weapon is not seen but rather experienced.
They are very intelligent and capable of unique, original and unpredictable behavior.
Albatross knock their beaks together making a loud tock-tock-tock sound like soldiers slamming their swords on their shields. The cat had no idea what this meant. He had come for an uncooked omlet not a confrontation with two giant flying creatures that could take him out over the Ocean and drop him where even a fish couldn't make it back to safety and shelter!
Knowing the little pussy wasn't ever coming back to threaten them, they continued knocking beaks. This is also a form of communication and part of their mating ritual. There was plenty of food off shore around Bird Island. Friends and family were arriving every day. Albatross like salmon and many species of turtles always return to the same breeding ground as their parents had and their parents parents before them. It is just the way of things. Maybe this year they might have two chicks. This had happened two seasons back. Though it was a lot more work, it was worth it. He and the Duchess had been married for ten seasons now and it felt like he had only met her only yesterday. Albatross pair up for life. Albatross are monogamous. "Where does the time go and why so readily," the Duke pondered dreamily.
12513121111111121212112.title: They were wakened suddenly

12513121111111121212121.content:
Is there anything funny about what we were talking about that brought about that bizzare ariel
manuever that made Jimmy Doolittle, when he pulled it off, the first American ace of WWI? I'm Ross the cross boss Albatross, asking my partner what was so funny about me mentioning that a long dead relative had passed on a story about Magellan, discovering and then dying here at Terra Del Fuego, never reaching the Pacific Ocean but his ship and crew did.
OK Ross, don't be cross. No mas, boss Albatross and Lois Albatross busted up again! Ross felt rather than saw the proverbial light bulb go on! She was pregnant. Now beaming with parental joy he changed his tone and asked Lois to start at the beginning and let him in on what is or was so funny?
Ross, it's probably only funny to me but I'll give it a shot. Here is the short version.
We were gliding along and I was only half listening to you going on and on about Magellan and crew out of water and them in one of the most dangerous places to sail on Earth, in uncharted waters, which was pretty much the entire Earth at that time. Most believing the Earth was flat and that there was an edge you would sail off and fall forever through space in a perpetual saltwater waterfall! That brought me back and it in itself is funny.
When you said in the story passed down by family members that they became so thirsty
they begin trying to shoot Albatross to drink our blood. We, being the only bird they had seen for some tiome. For some reason I can't explain, I saw over a hundred men tearing apart a seagull they had managed to shoot by some miracle and not one of them got even an ounce of the four ounces coursing through a gulls circulatory system. Have you ever seen the rifles of Magellan's time? Shooting a flying gull from a rolling deck with solid shot from a blunderbus is an impossibility. That also is funny but when added to what you said next, I broke!
With gull feathers blowing around on the deck gathering in little eddies of air currents, all that was left of the gull who had been torn into very small pieces, similar to what the Hawaiians had done to Captain James Cook on the Big Island, you said," and this was the moment Captain Magellan said his famous," "Water, water, everywhere but not one drop to drink!!"
I then invisioned his crew tearing him apart on the spot and drinking his blood for saying something so stupid and reminding them that they were made to crew for him and he alone was the reason they were dying of scurvy and dehydration and they hadn't even an idea yet of what is in store for sailors who attempt rounding the Horn.
None of this happened Ross, the boss Albatross. But what did happen is Magellan died there. The ship had found a safer way to round the Horn and made the Pacific Ocean. Many of the crew made it back to their homeland but not many of their teeth did!
You and I go almost a year sometimes with no fresh water. To bad we don't speak their language. We could have taught them how we do it. But then anyone who thinks blood is less salty than saltwater should just cut themselves and drink their own blood. How about urine? Now that is funny! Lois Albatross, you have a warped sense of humor brought on and emphasized by the egg you are carrying!
Oh Ross, You figured it out! Let's hele on to Kauai! The cliffs of the Kiluaea Lighthouse are calling us home. Kauai no ka oi!

I've asked myself this question many times . Usually at a life-changing junction. A decision must be made and whatever that decision is is a leap of hope and a faith that the decision to accept the offer wasn't agenda motivated.
Living in a world so complex that many people never come to the realization of the depth their very personallity is shaped and formed by constant outside sensory bombardment. They respond to stimulas being presented by an agency, (clandestine) subliminaly, to achieve a control of the masses, bending rebellious behaviors into compliant complacency to the will and purposes of these hidden persuaders, puppeteers, the real rulers of an entire planet.
Is the person looking back at you from the other side of the mirror a stranger?

choices: What do you see in the mirror?
Have you just given up like the masses or are you stronger than that?
125131211111111212122211.content:
I took a long look in the mirror. Life had been suddenly changed and being two was now one.
It's just you now girl, just you." Tears were coming involentery from my eyes as I fastened the small piece of card on to the screw on my bathroom mirror. The card read (I will survive in all circumstances) and below that (To thine own self be true.) The card would be a daily reminder for me that my life was up to me. What happened was up to me and it wasn't going to be easy.

My husband was in the cemetry now his dead friends scattered in graves not far from him on the hill. I'm left now and taking a long look I saw a woman in her late fifties still attractive and her figure was starved of food but still quite attractive to look at.
As I brushed my teeth tears still came. I told myself that I had to be strong and not give up and that was five years ago.

Today when I look in the mirror I see an older but much stronger woman, a survivor and someone who knows how to get through all the trials that life brings each day. I have set up home in a reasonable town and have my partner who is a rock for me and adores me. He has told me on more than one occassion that I am a strong woman and very independant. Yes I have had to be, life has it's good times and some days are difficult, but that 's other people who are part of the thread of life that can't be ignored. Each day has its challenges but as I brush my teeth and get ready to go for a swim at the local hotel with a friend I take a deep breath and get ready for the day ahead. (I will survive in all circumstances.) stares at me from the corner of my bathroom mirror.
125131211111111212122211.title: Who Am I?

12513121111111121221.content: Patty knew that her legs were going to give out if she kept on running, but she didn't want to simply lay down and die. She quickly yanked a tree branch off of a nearby tree, and ran her callused hands along it, stripping it of it's leaves and sapling branches. Then she found a rock the size of her head nearby, so if it was an animal like a jaguar chasing her she could shove it down it's throat. If it was a Chimpanzee then she would maybe bash it's head in. No matter what it was, she wasn't going to be eaten alive. She was a native of the Adirondack mountains, she'd dealt with her fair share of coyotes and feral or inbred dogs. She wasn't going down without a fight.
