14.content:
About a year ago, I started having dreams about a werewolf. I am walking calmly through a big city, and everyone's running around screaming.
         Flashback to about ten minutes ago. I am a small wolf. I'm feeling the energy building inside me. I'm bound in a scientist's lab with metal restraints, but I grow bigger and break out of them. There's something I don't want to, but need to, can't, but have to do and that's kill. The impending kill makes me crazy, and the crazier I get, the sooner I'll kill.
         I'm asking the scientist why has he let the werewolf escape. He tells me the werewolf let himself loose. I say I don't think it's letting loose if it's he who wants to get out. The scientist says the werewolf doesn't want to get out, but it's the hate itself that drives him to do what he hates.
         I am the werewolf. I run the streets. I rip people to shreds. They run away. It's futile, I'll get them anyway. Funny, I don't see others in their eyes as I tear out their hearts. I see myself. I'm making it worse for myself as I try to get better. The hate of the very thing I hate to do drives me to do what I hate. I know I'm going to keep killing, to ruin my hopes of it ever stopping, but it will only stop if I stop hoping. It may be too late. Look what I've become.
         A monster doesn't believe it's a monster, right? It believes it's doing the right thing? Maybe. The scientist and I are the only two left in the city. Everyone else has been destroyed. We make our way to the top of the tower of the tallest building in hopes that we'll think of a way to kill the werewolf off before it corners us at the top.
         I've done it. I've killed everyone. But wait. I still have some unfinished business. That's why I'm still alive. Is the only way to kill myself and end the killing of others to kill all others? There's someone left. I've got to find them, there's got to be a way. No, I shake that thought out of my head. A new one just fills its place.
         If I were a werewolf, why would I be killing people? Maybe I don't know any different. Maybe I'm being driven to do what I do because I hate what I do.
         If I were a human, where would I go to hide from a werewolf? Maybe, I'd get as far as possible. Maybe I'd get closer and lure it into a trap.
         I tell the scientist to show me the way back to his lab. He says are you crazy? Do you have any idea how dangerous this thing is? No, I only know how dangerous I am. That's how it is, right? The things we want to change in others are the things we need to change in ourselves? How can that be true? I've never killed anyone.
         The humans need to get away from me. I'll kill them. I'm already killing myself even faster than I can wrap my claws around their soul. I'm destroying myself. Why do I care about myself more than I care about killing others. Maybe because I am those others. I'm suffering because I'm hurting myself. Weird how hurting yourself hurts.
         We find the destroyed restraints the werewolf broke out of. We don't have much time. We need to get inside the werewolf's head. Make me a werewolf, I say to the man. The only way we can fight him is if we are him. No one fights with something that isn't part of them. If I hate something, it's still a part of me as much as if I love someone with the same strength. He's hesitant, but he realizes my point. He gets a large syringe from his table. Swearing under his breath and averting his eyes, he points the needle at my shoulder. It sinks in. I am suddenly in a state of no thought, but just as soon am in the worst pain I've ever felt. I feel myself becoming bigger. My heart palpitates. The wolf is growing. I'm growing.
         I'm running through the main street when a chill down my spine freezes me in my tracks. Something I'd never have expected is near. I look at the dark window of a shop, and I see my reflection. Out of the corner of my eye I see something move. I turn straight around, but I'm looking into another mirror. I'm staring face to face with myself. I back up a few steps, but my reflection gets closer. I'm dreaming. No, my reflection says. I'm not you. You may have killed thousands, but I'm only taking one life. That's you.
         I'm staring the werewolf in the eyes. I'm eye level with the best because I am also a monster. My intent is different, I tell myself. I'm killing to make things better, and he's killing to make things worse.
         This monster will kill me, I realize. Then, what will he learn? That destruction is the end to destruction? The only way I can kill myself is if I kill him. But what if we were both alive. We could keep each other sane.
         This creature is insane. I step forward again. I begin to crouch, when I see his eyes. He stares back at me with fear, not anger. Now I'm a werewolf too, so why would he be afraid of himself?
         I realize he is the one who is afraid to make things better. Destruction doesn't cure itself. We'll just fight to end the fighting. This is idealistic, but as we're the only two left, I suppose it's worth a shot.
         Why do you kill? I ask.
         To destroy what I've done.
         What you've done is destroyed.
         Then what's done is done, but we need to rebuild what is left.
         Let's go.

This is idealistic, I know, but it was a dream. I know not everyone will think like me, but wouldn't it be nice...
14.title: Dreams

choices: The Universe Is Too Big To Understand
141.content:
Why are there so many interactives about shrinking but so few about thinking?

Why do dreams seem so realistic? Are they real? Why do you not know they are not real while you are dreaming them? Why does realizing a dream is a dream make you wake up?

Why is sex so simple and so complicated? Why do some parents not want their children to learn about sex in school? Do they feel that friends, neighbors, and relatives would be better at teaching it? Can't everything you need to know be taught in less than an hour? Which is better? A picture in a book or a hands-on demonstration?

Why do we have the belief that mankind can eventually understand the universe? Isn't it possible that something could be so big and complicated that we can never understand it?
141.title: Why?

1411.content:
I recently started reading "The Four Agreements" by Don Miguel Ruiz. One of those personal growth/ self help books. Not the type of book I can discuss with my redneck buddies, who probably think "personal growth" has something to do with those ads on late night TV about male enhancement. But it really struck a chord with me when I first picked it up.

The book poses the premise that we are all living our lives through the lens of our own personal idea of reality, our own "dream". Our view of reality as we are growing up is distorted by what we have been taught by our family, our peers, our religious and political leaders. The message we are taught is to take life seriously, don't take chances, be responsible, follow the rules, so we often do what is expected of us rather than taking the path that we really want to follow, fearing what people will think about us if we don't do what is expected.

If you follow the priciples of this book it will allow you to break free of this way of thinking, maybe make a new start in life. Or at least be aware of the sad situation you are now trapped in.

At any rate, when you ask one of your acquaintances in passing how they are doing on any given day and they answer facetiously "Just livin' the dream," you'll know they are really telling the truth.
1411.title: Just Livin' the Dream...

14111.content:
I recently read 'The Fountainhead' by Ayn Rand, a book which glorifies ego in a way that I found hard to stomach until I realized just how much our lives are driven by the hunger for others' approval - a fact which is brought out later in the story - and how the greatest men in history were often those who dared to think or act independently despite circumstances where it was literally them against the world.

Not many stories linger in the mind in a thought-provoking manner as 'The Fountainhead' did. It was a wake-up call for objectivity. One which was not brought out in a long jargon-filled bunch of theories in a science journal, but in a captivating down-to-earth tale of a maverick called Howard Roark who apparently lived ahead of his time; embracing change in the field of architecture where others, including his envious peer Peter Keating, acted like the only right way was to follow historic leads.

I was left thinking that if this world had more Howard Roarks in it, then we would not be waiting for the likes of Obama to bring change to the world; we would bring change to the world ourselves.
14111.title: Wake-Up Call

141111.content: If life is about wining, then the "rules" aren't created by you but, the winner, If life is suppose to be a dark place, then no smiles would ever break a face. Can't we change what we have become? We started out innocent babes. Then, somewhere we lost that innocence by something, someone, some event in time. I never dreamed I would become a killer but, I did. Who determines what is right? Your religious leader? Your parents? Who says killing is always wrong? Murder is murder-rather hunting for food or the enemy in the night. I shouldn't care so deeply about the "right" when I'm blazing my path. I do though...
141111.title: Make a Change

1411111.content:
Wondering what will happen
Or will not happen;
Reliving past mistakes, and not
Ready to go forward;
Yearning to be anywhere but here.

Worry is about borrowing trouble that may or may not happen. Rather than just going with the flow and working with what will actually happen, it paralyzes the individual into inactivity, or even self-fulfilling prophecy. Think of all the opportunities that may be missed when worrying about things beyond our control.
1411111.title: worry

1411112.content:
Blood seeps from my veins
To emerge from what I've hid
Splashes of vivid, crimson stains
Proof of what I did
Fear of emotion; fear of belief
Keeps me from stemming the tide
All these thoughts, without relief
Poison me from the inside
Should I save myself? Should I care?
Or should I keep bleeding; give in to my fear?
I watch my life run red as time runs slow
I make a choice; is it right? I don't know
Six months on, I quell my regret
Cover these scars, know I'll never forget
Still life goes on, painful and feigned
Still I am here, weary and drained.

NOTE: Just thoughts. Merely thoughts. Shadows of a corrupt and toxic mind.
1411112.title: Fear

14111121.content:
Afterwards, when the rush in my head has gone, everything is still, silent. I'm finally able to breathe. Seeing the red flow, like comforting blanket, the room fades into nothing. My eyes feel heavy, my voice, when I speak inside my mind, is hoarse.

I sit on the floor, leaning against my black wall. I try to remember why I painted it that colour. It must have been to mirror the thoughts in my mind.

My cell buzzes and, instinctively, I reach to answer it. I pause. I'm not sure I have the energy, or the will, to chat with my mother.
14111121.title: Silent

14111122.content:
The smarting throb of cold, cruel steel pushed against his neck. Its fine, razor-like tip burrowed threateningly into his flesh, doubling as a harsh promise of ruthless violence and a stark reminder of his fragile mortality. Fear coursed through his pounding veins; he could hear nothing but his rapid heartbeat and the silent prayers begging to Yahweh for deliverance by His immortal, supposedly merciful hands. Finally, after a sharp, alien command rang in the dreadful semi-silence, the man lowered his cold, unloving weapon.
         Large hands and uncouth instruments forced him forward and on his trembling knees to the biting ground, covered in the virgin snows of winter. The hands’ gloves chafed him like the tough restraints preventing his escape. Their crude metal devices glinted menacingly, steel sentinels looming above the captive like the cruel prison guards that had tortured him day and night. The hard, frozen ground made his knees and hands ache as he forced all his weight down. However slight he was, exhaustion, dehydration, and hunger had conquered his feeble body and mind.
         Harsh laughter rang from above, below, and all around in the demonic, living nightmare; it caused his stomach to churn sickly and his insides to burn with the all but snuffed-out flame of inward fury at the wrongs suffered by his kind. The wan, afflicted faces of his family swam before his eyes as their anguished cries perforated the mirthless, disquieting laughter on their way to the cold, toxic gases of a misnomered shower and the alternately hellish heat of the incinerators that reduced the last vestiges of their existence to ash. His head pounded with the noise and eyes welled with tears, an indelible ache coming from somewhere in the depths of his chest at the humbling, pitiful sight of his fragmented family, so easily lost at the hands of such a group of monster-like demons.
         'It's just a dream,' he thought. 'A nightmare, a memory, and nothing more. Snap out of it! Wake up! You aren't fourteen anymore! It isn't 1945!'
         A disembodied voice spoke, unlike any of the others that had plagued him before in anything but his wildest, most all-consuming nightmares, but its words were lost on his red, frost-bitten ears. Yet he somehow already knew what was said.
         The captive gritted his teeth angrily, the booming, gravelly voice still quite clear in his throbbing head. He did not know the speaker, but he recognized it immediately as the voice that had ridiculed him each day he had spent a captive, not only to the Germans but, in following decades, to his thoughts and memories, the gravelly, menacing voice that laughed at his pain, worsened his daily sufferings, and haunted his tormenting dreams. It was the voice collectively embodying itself as those monsters that, as one, were the most unthinkably cruel villains, thieves, and murderers.
14111122.title: Holocaust Survivor

141111221.content:
In the shadows of night, when darkness reigns
My mind sleeps as I release my pains
Lost in these thoughts not quite my own
Burning inside yet I'm chilled to the bone
It's just mere illusion! Only a dream!
Yet at these visions I struggle and scream
A house of coldness; a lock without key
Vivid and bold, a bloody red sea
Savage and strange, filling me with fear
To wake to the dawn, and one I hold dear.
141111221.title: Dream

1411112211.content:
Half the day passes in boredom, and the other half passes as I sleep. When night creeps into the sky I jump out of my bed. I run to my computer and turn it on, waiting as it slowly, annoyingly, start up. Its been the same for the past week or so, waiting for it to start, for the many messengers to start up. Its said to say that life is online, my best friends online. Yet it is how I live my life.
For the pass week or so I sigh a sigh of disappointment as I realize no one is on. I should know they won't be by now. Two have children to take care of or jobs to worry about, one is getting married and thus will be very busy. There is a third the is having money problems and had to pawn his laptop, I miss him and wonder when he'll be on. The last of my important friends logs on from time to time, but his thief of a cousin moved back in, so my friend sleeps with two eyes open.
I myself am hardly on my messengers anymore has a hunt a job. I know some of my family thinks it stupid to miss people that I've never known in real life. Let them, every night for the last four years these were the people that I gamed with and told my troubles to. They helped me out of my depressions and encouraged me to finish high school. With them I am me and I know they like me for being me, not for how I look.
It's day right now and as I type this I wonder if they'll log on to night.
Will he get a new laptop soon? That is the main question in my head. Probably not.
Well till to night, good day.

*Sorry just me trying to get my thoughts out about how i felt for the past week*
1411112211.title: Night

14111122112.content:
Sitting alone, on the painted wooden bench, I sigh. All around me are the groups I'd like to join so much; just to sit there and listen to their mindless chatter would be enough. But no. Toxic as I am, in this society built up on pretty facades and empty words I am merely a number, just another player on the team; another face watching from the other side of popularity, as an outcast. Some day, I'll have amassed enough courage to walk over there, and say hello. But not today. Bitter and silent, I watch my classmates with their so-called 'friends', observing in sadness the petty arguments that tear their carefully crafted facades apart. 'But what do I care?' I angrily ask in my head, soured by failure and solitude. 'I don't need them!' I tell myself, trying to deny the hollow inside of me that cries out for company. And yet I still sit here, waiting for the day that I can just walk right over there and be part of the group.

Sad and weary, alone I wait
Embittered by silence, anger and hate
Waiting for the power to not rue today
To be able to walk over to them and say
'Here I am!' Remember me?'
The girl you rejected, and refused to see
The common enemy; the foe of the crowd
To walk up, and speak these thoughts aloud
Twisted inside, I am poisoned by spite
Unable to trust, I keep my heart tight
My blue eyes watch you coldly from afar
Seeing the fight to be captain or star
Back to the class not, to sit on my own
And hate you all dearly, from leaving me alone.

*Yes; good old school; how I miss it so! Such bitter memories...*
14111122112.title: Friends

141111221121.content:
Sometimes there's so much I want to say to you but I know that when we're face-to-face there's little left to say. All these thoughts are like a poison and now the walls are falling down and words are failing me...

Tell me: do you fear the future?

The strange, silent creature sits hunched on her bed, watching the night come creeping slowly in. Inside the mind of this deranged, savage being there's no knowing what goes on, but the thoughts she thinks are ones of emptiness and shadows; of the products of her mind, from which there's no escape. Come now, child; why fear the future? Tell me your memories, and together we'll heal you anew! A flicker of hope lights up the girl's eyes, which are more gray than blue. Memories, though? Memories are fragments of her past, reluctantly sacrificed in order to begin life again as a normal person. Rocking slowly on her dark single bed, the child has no way of knowing that memories might stay; why fear what you have seen fade away? But even shards of the past can fade to blurry nothingness, and already the girl's memories of true childhood are gone. Sour and aged beyond belief by dysfunctional family values, the girl knows that such ill-acquired wisdom comes at great cost to the cursed bearer; but what price has she paid for the burden of knowledge?
141111221121.title: Memories

1411112211212.content:
The sudden realization that the world has gone mad, hits me like a ton of bricks.

Nobody is able to tell me, why things went wrong.

Nobody can guide me towards saner surroundings.

Sanity is a thing I wish for, but I am not able to locate any.
D
It actually takes the burden off my shoulders.

People will not be able to target me

I'm not a possible scape-goat.

Things would have gone wrong, even if I had not been here.

But who's to blame??
1411112211212.title: Sanity

1411112212.content:
Dawn has already broken-
the sun rising to
pierce the remnants
of foggy dreams

flowers unfurl
leaning into the touch
of warmth and light
and the grass grows
taller-
trying to reach the ears of the sky
and whisper its secrets away

down in the stream-
a child fishing
with muddy hands,
is trying to catch the minnows
slipping between fingers.
1411112212.title: Dawn

14111122121.content:
A dream it seemed, yet, it was real. As I seemed to float through the forest although strolling, I was able to take in much detail of the scenes as they allowed me to enter and investigate. Trees standing tall and guarding the earth, never moving but steadfast in their given duties seemed to exude their powerful abilities to cleanse the air and beautify with greens and browns and other colors creating sensations of breathtaking coloring done by the master. The air tasted, smelled, and felt like having the most beautiful kind and loving person as a friend and companion. All the romance of my interactions with taking in breath and letting it out had a profound effect upon my sense of being alive. The movie played before me with the colors smells and textures of trees, bushes gave me full sensory stimulation which made life well worth living to the fullest. Moving was easy and carefree as if my contact with the earth, grasses, leaves, and other items which were on the ground transported me effortlessly. This for a mountaineer is heaven. Was I in heaven? Was this a dream? How did I get here and where was I going.

Perhaps I should have been afraid but wasn't. Everything stopped abruptly. Spinning, spinning, spinning, getting dizzy and trying not to become unbalanced. grasping for tree limbs, bushes, whatever I could cling to to steady myself. This must be because I tripper! I should have watched where I was going!

"you do not belong here!" Who was that? Trembling and having trouble thinking clearly and quickly, I groped around for something familiar and there was only blackness.

I felt like a train had hit me, and I was ejected outside of a whale stomach into the brightest of white which glowed and sparkled like nothing I had known in my life long experience. Singing of a kind unknown to me yet certainly singing was all around.

Who was...or what was...how...

In a blink of an eye or less, Seated before me were thousands and thousands of beings enjoying a mega huge feast.
This had got to be a dream, or was it?
14111122121.title: Forest depths

141111222.content:
Why is it every time
I run in a dream
I trip
A mile before the finish line
a short inch from safety
and have to crawl-
legs dragging uselessly

and the extra corners
and the shadows where
they ought not be
make me move
sluggishly and tired

time racing ahead
the monster is going to catch me
in this prone posture
where my arms are reaching
for the haven I will never get to

and then I'm jarred into
reality-
which is the cold sweat and numbness
racing heart
and pulsing temples
of waking from a nightmare.
141111222.title: Nightmare

choices: Was the request for more sedative a defense?
Was the news article about Michael?
141121.content:
Conrad administered the dosage and soon his patient was sleeping. He retired to his quarters and turned on the monitor so he would be awakened if there were anything go wrong with the patient. It wouldn't be long before his own sleep was disturbed by the buzzing of the monitor.
At the coroners inquest Conrad answered questions until he began to think the inquisitive board knew more about everything than he did. He was given instructions not to leave town without contacting the police chief in person. He went directly home for it was now two full days since he had had any rest. He could not sleep, but turned on the TV to distract his thoughts. That too did not help.
The TV news program was blurting out the latest on the death of a celebrity and the circumstances which led to the situation. It said an arrest was eminent. He started to sweat. It was if he had developed a sickness and was about to heave up his socks. He recalled the instructions not to leave town and it became clear in that instant that he was the prime suspect of wrongdoing. His thoughts were running full blast. He would have to travel incognito. But where would he go?
His thoughts turned to Michael------
141121.title: Death, the Final Frontier

choices: Make a stand or sit down
1411211.content:
Running away will not help. Clear images of what has transpired may not reflect the actual face of truth but he must stand now and face it. Even though truth is only an idea of the collective many, passed through the tides of time.
However, fiction is devised in the minds of the few who have his fate in their hands.

He turns to the one who must speak his truth and braces himself for the ever haunting question, "Was the request for more sedative a defense?". He is lost in the ever changing immorality of the lawyer who wants to take him by the hand and lead him to the needles as the witnesses watch on. Facts change each day as the reflections of the few mingle and are lost in the clear images of the past. The ones who judge should have a look at their own shattered lives.

14121.content:
My name is Jacinto, I am a welder.
I have done welding for construction, on ships, and oil refineries.
I got my citizenship papers seven years ago.

I can work stick or wire, brazing, whatever you need.
I was working for a construction company, I got laid off six months ago.
I have been looking for work ever since...

My unemployment just ran out, and I am over my limit on my credit card.
The refrigerator is empty, we have only some beans and rice, and I cannot pay the rent.
I thought seriously of killing myself but I could not do such a thing.
I know the trauma it would cause my daughter.

My daughter Rosalita is all I live for, ever since my Estella died.
Estella was the love of my life, but the cancer took her away from me.
I almost cursed God when this happened, but I know He has his plan.
And I know my Estella would not want me to leave our Rosalita alone in this world...

Rosalita looks at me with disgust, I am a failure as a provider, a father.
She is fourteen years old and she has to wear her old worn clothes to school.
Sometimes her friends give her jeans or blouses they no longer want, because they feel sorry for her.
I worry that a young man may come along and promise her fine clothes and jewelry in exchange for her virtue.

So do you know anyone who is hiring, anyone who might have work for me?
I am an experienced welder but I would take any other work.
Construction labor, dish washer, anything!
Can you help me?
14121.title: Life is Hard

141212.content:
The door burst open with a loud bang. The light cut through the darkness like butter and hurt my eyes. The eyes of a madman, the eyes of a lover, the eyes of a killer. Guns pointed into the air all aiming at me right at my soulless eyes. Juliet laid on the ground next to me dead her eyes wide open with sadness, with betrayal, with lust. We’ve all got our story to tell in this book but not all of them end in a positive note. I stood up knowing full well that after this minute me and God would have a little chat in Heaven.

The first of the guns went of sounding kind of like an atom bomb dropped on an unsuspecting village. The bullets stung my skin sending me into a standing seizure the kind you have when pain grabs hold of you and squeezes. I fell to the floor eyes starting to cry I looked up at the wall where my blood splattered on it like some type of grotesque finger-painting. The last thing on my mind before it goes blank, the last thing in my heart before it explodes are three words. The three words said before I killed her and sent her to where she belongs; I love you.
141212.title: Depths of Despair

It could be my imagination, could be that green monster inside if me, or it could be true. My eyes never deceive me and you were cheating on me. That girl is...well was my best friend. She has took everything away from me...that spelling bee trophy, the part in Grease that I wanted to play so badly, and now you...But she cant have you. You are mine. You can never be anyone else except mine. We will laugh again and if you refuse I'll make you laugh again. Our love is perfect...."

141221.content:
The errands of my mundane life
cause our paths to cross, often with my wife.
I've said "Nice weather," or such before,
wishing that I could say more.
Today she saw I was alone,
so she approached me on her own.
My flesh was willing but spirit weak,
I missed my chance, I was too meek.
We made small talk, she walked away,
I watched her leave, sorry to say.
This ring I wear can be a chain,
But for better or worse, I now remain,
faithful to those vows of old,
but wishing I had been more bold.
141221.title: Desire

1412212.content:
Say it loud and there's music playing
Say it soft and it's almost like praying.

Oh Maria, goddess of your dreams. Mid or late twenties. Shoulder length dark brown hair. Red, red lips on her lovely face. A face that's roundish rather than oval. Other than the lipstick, her perfect porcelain skin needs no makeup. There's just the barest hint of color on her cheeks.

The dark green cocktail dress shows off her trim, toned body like a simple, elegant frame around a masterwork of art. Long, sleek legs. Her arms manage to look muscular and feminine at the same time. She's spent some serious hours in a gym. You just KNOW her flat stomach is rock hard. And, of course … Breasts!

She's Major League.

You?? You're not Major League. You're not Minor League, Little League, or Bush League. You're about four leagues below that. And in the cellar. If she notices you at all, it's same way she notices something sticky on the bottom of the pump that matches her dress.

But, unaccountably, she HAS noticed you. Who knows why?? Maybe you accidentally said something witty. Maybe she can't see well in this dim light. Maybe she's a Star Trek girl - Likes to go where no woman has gone before.

So … Lips parted in a slight smile ... Brown eyes dancing with amusement. She's looking at you in anticipation.

The spell will last three seconds max. You need to say something to keep her from turning away, to keep from being reduced once again to the s**t under her shoe. You'll get no SECOND CHANCE.

What Do You Say??
1412212.title: Only Chance

14122121.content:
"I promise you, if I catch you in one of these internal battles again, I'm going to hit you with a book." Chad pretended to cover his mouth from a fake yawn and loosely tossed his right hand at Aaron's cheek, slapping him out of the internal debate and landing him back into reality as Maria turned away.
"How long was I out?" He asked, blankly staring at the back of Maria's beautiful dress.
Chad casually looked at his watch, gently pushing his tuxedo's sleeve back while trying not to spill his glass of white wine. "Two minutes. And if I didn't stray away from my night's objective, you'd still be at it."
"She's beautiful."
"You've told me that some one-thousand times now, so much so that I think I'm the crush of your life. You should tell her that." Chad sipped at his wine and looked back at his college friend that, undoubtedly, had helped him get out of college. Aaron was back at it again, lost in the unique and divine beauty that was Maria Fields, Aaron's college crush that had, of course, gone unapproached. Seeing that Aaron was at it again, Chad stepped to the left of his friend and snapped his fingers in his face. "You have issues, man."
Aaron blinked to signify that he was conscious of his staring. "How so?"
"You've known of her for four years. Why not say something?"
Aaron's admiring was interrupted by the suggestion. "Like what? I can't sat anything to her."
"Why not? You act as if she's the President or something. Secret Service won't attack you if you ask a simple, 'Do I know you?'" Chad explained, extending an innocent hand to the crowd of party goers.
Aaron fought back. "But what if she doesn't remember?"
"Then make her remember." Chad paused as the words left his mouth sounding a bit more aggressive than usual. "On second thought, you likely wouldn't know how to do that." Aaron casually looked to his left and right before shrugging his shoulders.
"No idea."
"Do you know what women like?"
"Money?"
"N-." Chad stopped and considered the fact that there were indeed women that solely took advantage of people because of their wallet. "Well...yes, but that wasn't the point. Women like two things: confidence-"
"-which I don't have."
Chad paused and smiled again before swishing his wine around in his glass. "Luckily for you, women like first impressions."
"How do I do that?"
"I know just the thing." Aaron looked at his eight-year friend in nervousness as Chad's thick and mischievous smile rose on his face. It was that smile that Aaron grew to fear, but before he could protest, Chad gently patted his friend on the shoulder and walked into the crowd.

Aaron grew increasingly anxious the longer Chad and Maria stayed out of his sight. He searched the entire hotel lobby and the ballroom for either of them, but his search always turned out empty. It was this that tested his nerve even more and it was this that triggered his asthma. Aaron was a fragile kid, so fragile that Chad almost thought he killed the guy when he tackled him to the ground while playing football. It wasn't the tackle itself that almost killed Aaron (technically, Chad just ran him over with his huge size), but the asthma attack the occurred in response. Chad was a pre-med student at the time that they were in college and was roughly aware of CPR, but was he prepared to do so on a guy in front of his college team members. He contemplated letting Aaron die.
Long behold, a paramedic was on the scene within seconds of the collision as was able to revive Aaron with ease. After a few seconds of gasping for oxygen, that was when Aaron erupted in a frantic, unintelligible, verbal rampage that few could understand. It was the birth a beautiful friendship, one that Chad knew he owed and what was expected, but he generally enjoyed.

Knowing this, Chad was using this card again Aaron. From the balcony above, Chad watched his anxious friend down another glass of white wine before knowing that four glasses of Conte Priola was enough to sooth his friend and disable his guard.
"You're up." He pressed send on his Blackberry and casually placed it back in his tuxedo's inner pocket. Below him, to his right, was a setup being put into play. Chad's ex-girlfriend, but good friend, Claire, located a suddenly mellow and soothed Aaron McCoy. Her iPhone buzzed once before she read the text and smiled as she looked up at Chad and shook her head. Before she could pull out her lipstick, her phone buzzed again.
"Not too much."
She giggled to herself and she put on her lipstick and typed her reply.
"No promises."
Chad watched from above as Claire quickly typed up her reply, sent it, and immediately engaged Aaron, walking directly toward him. His heart raced in excitement as he saw Claire tap him on the shoulder. Aaron stiffened in surprise, almost jumping in fright, and slowly turned around. He assumed Claire was telling Aaron something along the lines of, "Very nice bow tie," "What political party do you belong to?" or, "Do you like dogs?" Generic chatter to just establish some sort of conversation. But before Aaron could disable any conversation, Claire went in.
And Aaron went down.

"Move! Move!" Chad dashed down the stairs and towards the circle of people surrounding a collapsed Aaron McCoy. Chad's speed was no match for the cheap tuxedo that he rented and did not slow him as he pushed through he crowd and toward his friends.
"Chad, you didn't-" Claire started, resting Aaron's head on her lap and fanning him air. Chad's eyes widened as she spoke, signaling her to say no more. He was also nervous; Aaron wasn't breathing.
He stared at a still Aaron. "I thought he would hyperventilate?" Claire glared at him. "Uh..." He began to look around the circle of concerned neighbors, business owners, and statesmen. "Doctor? We need a doctor! Someone!" No one moved, only looking around in confusion. "There's not a single doctor in this building?!"
"Move!"
With almost-perfect timing, Maria Fields dashed into the circle and slide to a stop right above Aaron. She quickly knelt down, untied Aaron s bow tie, and ripped open his shirt
"No, not the butt-" Chad started and then silenced himself.
Maria placed her left ear against his chest. "He's not breathing."
"No shit!" Chad covered his mouth as the words bellowed out of his mouth; he was scared that he may have indirectly killed his friend. Claire glared at Chad again, but Maria ignored him.
"Someone call an ambulance if you haven't already. I'm going to try to bring him back." She said.
"Wait, you're not-" Before Chad could even finish, Maria opened Aaron's mouth, plugged his nose, and placed her mouth on his and attempted to resuscitate him. But as soon as her lips met his, Aaron's eyes opened.
Chad covered his ears.
"AGH!" He quickly crawled to his side and stared at a confused and just-as-surprised Maria Fields. He breathing was rapid, but his asthma was not trigger. Aaron's face was red from lack of oxygen and heat, but he showed no signs of anxiety.
He froze.
"Are you okay?" Maria broke the silence with an honest question, perplexed by Aaron's silence and stillness. As if on cue, Aaron blinked before crawling to Maria and going in. Claire looked at Chad in shock and Chad returned a confused look. But instead of denial or immediate rejection, Maria did not attempt to flee and, instead, grabbed onto Aaron and held the kiss even longer.
"What the fu-" Claire interrupted Chad's comment with a gentle slap to the cheek.
"It's a lasting impression; let it be." Chad spared Claire a glare and then turned to see Aaron and his dream girl still making out in the middle of a circle of previously concerned citizens.
"Seven seconds and they still aren't even..." Chad gave up and gently started to clap. The rest of the crowd eventually joined.
14122121.title: Lasting Impression

The weirdest thing was where I found myself? Behind a microphone I was asked in front of God and everyone, " Tell us why you have a right to be here with all of us?" Then tell us the gift you have bought and brought for the host?
I had no choice but to tell the truth, " I was invited to be a guest so I came. I was invited and so I came is the gift that I bring. If that's not enough for you I'll leave. So here I AM. And here YOU ARE. Aren' WE both gathered in YOUR NAME? I thought so............Just maybe I have a gift to bring?

1413.content:
Why is the Universe Too Big To Understand?

Good question.

I believe that God created the universe, and He did not mean for the universe to BE understood. There is just too much going on. That was by design. Otherwise, we would not need God. And we do need Him. I am aware that a lot of people do not believe there is a God. If there is no God, however, then how did this big universe get here? It did not just appear out of the blue. Something had to cause it to get here. Even if a person does not believe in the creation story in Genesis, surely they have to admit that SOMEONE created this place we call home.

I believe that it is GOD and nobody ELSE!
You can agree with me or not, your call, but I hope this gives you some food for thought. And please respect my right to my opinions, I will do my best to do the same.

14131.content:
"Did you hear the news, George? I never heard such a thing in my life!"
         "Don' know if I did. What is it? You sound awful flustered, Louise."
         "You recall little Susanah, the Bradfords' kid, what died of yellow fever two seasons past?"
         "Sure. Anna like to broke her heart-- she was her youngest child, and as pretty a girl as this town ever saw."
         "Well, George-- George, they say--"
         "Stop chewin' your handkerchief, woman. Spit it out."
         "They say she came back."

         (The words ring like a dropped kettle.)

         "Folks'll repeat any damn thing they'll hear these days! What a load of--"
         "Pastor Creeley swore t'me he'd seen her! His hand to God! Everyone's been saying how happy the Bradfords are now. Some people are sayin' it's a sign of the end too, the resurrection of the dead and all. If you'd of seen them all, George-- somethin' was different-- they was like animals when a storm's comin' in."
         "Take a deep breath, Louise. Don't mean nothin'. Not unless we see her with our own eyes."

         (Outside, a commotion heralds the arrival of a family of seven, all ranged around a pretty little brown-haired girl-child-- maybe four or five years old. She clutches her parents' hands in her own. Her steps are small and wobbly, and she looks just a mite too pale and thin-- brittle and translucent as fine porcelain. She looks up. Her big blue eyes meet the combined gazes of the man and the woman in the general store. They are unreadable.)

         "Sweet holy Jesus!"
         "Well--I'll be damned."

         A long, pregnant pause.

         "Unless some charlatan tricked up some orphan child to have the same goldurned eyes as Susanah... Louisey, you were right. I'll be."
         "I just cain't believe it, George. I don't like this none at all."
         "Why, cheer up, honey. Must be a miracle, right in our home town."
         "Was it a miracle, though? That's what gits me, George. We don't know. Was it God or... somethin' else?"

choices: The Stars Take You On A Journey
14132.content:
I look up at the stars. They call to me, begging for me to fly among them once again.
Then I remember that I have a husband now, and a child on the way. I tenderly touch my growing belly.
She will be here in only a few days.
Adam calls my name. I smile at his voice.
"Samus," he calls, love in his voice.
I walk back to him, ready to practice the breathing again.
"Coming, sweetheart."
He takes my hands, and helps me sit down on the cushion in front of our picture window.
I tilt my head back and kiss him softly.
"I was just thinking about the old days," I say, stroking his arm.
He kneels behind me.
"Really?" he asks, rubbing my back.
"Yes. I can feel the stars calling for me once again."
I suck in a deep breath.
"Are you going to leave?"
I let it out.
"Not until I can fit back into my Zero Suit, anyway," I joke, looking down at my loose cotton dress.
Adam smiles.
"I almost can't wait for the baby to be here."
His hand appears on my belly, gently rubbing.
I lean into him, forgetting my breathing.
"Me too, sweetheart, me too."
14132.title: Why should we worry about understanding the uni...

141321.content:
Night
Inky-black, Abysmal
All-consuming, Enveloping, Deepening
Darkness, Chill, Gray, Light
Brightening, Warming, Greeting
Orangey-red, Watery
Sunrise


         As the poetry flowing from my mind flies through my fingertips and into the liquid ink I fuse into the fibrous page, I pause and take a moment to consider my muse. I stand from my dimly lit desk and press my face flat against the cool window pane, trying to see past the organized plots of houses with similar wrought-iron lampposts standing guard at the street's edge. Failing considerably, I ventured to escape into the inky-black chill of the refreshing night air in nothing but my robe and slippers. There was far too much light pollution for my taste, but I could still see the bright pinpricks of lights, faceted jewels set into the black fabric of time and space.

         'What would it be like,' I pondered, 'to be a part of such an infinite dance of beauty and light?' Yet, we are, aren't we? We are all a part of the universe, and, therefore, a part of such wonder. From another planet, we may be one of those bright specks, as Mars and Venus appear to us. Could there be something more out there? Could we travel through the stars, a journey to other dimensions and cultures that we have explored only in our wildest of fantastical daydreams and most laughable of Star-Wars-esque science fiction? Is our vision deterred by the stars to the stars themselves rather than the dark space between them? We see pictures, the constellations, made up of pinpoints of stars. Why do we not see pictures in the blackness of space's vacuum and name those, as well? Are we so close-minded as to not be able to see what is in front of our faces? Space is infinite, and so is the human imagination. Why do we set barriers for ourselves?

         I stood in the dewy grass, pondering my mind's journey of the stars until the cool, gray light of dawn greeted me as the sun's fiery head rose above the tree-dotted horizon.
141321.title: The Stars Take You On A Journey

1413212.content:
Close-mindedness explains my sister, who cannot forget the past. When someone talks about holding a grudge, they can't compare to Hazel. She still holds grudges from 20 - 30 years ago, when we were children. She has minimal attempts at pretending to be social in company, but inside, her mind seethes with her list of things people have (supposedly) done to her.

She will not listen when someone tries to explain that maybe she's seeing something the wrong way, or that there was a misunderstanding. Nope, it's her way and that's it. There's been a Wrong against her, and it can never be fixed. She won't let the Wrong be repaired. And she'll never say exactly what she's mad about, so there's no way to make things better even when we want to.

This doesn't make me mad; it just hurts, so deep inside it feels like my guts have been torn out. My emotions fall on the floor, crying, wondering what I could've possibly done to incur such hate from someone who is Family. Family is the most important thing in the world to me! How can anyone believe that I don't love them? My heart cries.
1413212.title: close-mindedness

141322.content:
An island, small but not so small that it disappeared when the tide came in. It was called Pudding Island because that's what it looked like when you viewed it from the high road on the peninsula. From the low road on the peninsula you could walk across to it when the tide was out. Of course if you stayed too long and the tide came in you had to make sure you had brought with you something to eat, drink and perhaps a tent.

I never stayed at Pudding Island over night but a friend and I often stayed until the tide went out again. This was the closest I ever got to what I called living at sea. I couldn’t actually imagine living at sea with no sign of land or even another ship in sight.

I had travelled on ferries from one island to another which left you all at sea for a while but soon the shore of the other island appeared and you were back on land. In fact on one ferry ride I spent most of the time looking for the other shore because the boat was rocking and rolling and heaving and hoeing so much that I couldn’t wait to get back on land.

I had in mind the inter-island ferry that had sunk not far from land on the very same route only in reverse. The ferry named Wahine went down with a boat load of people, cars and goods on the Easter weekend of 1968 in a terrible storm, high seas and fog. The pilot had the boat headed for rocks instead of the shore and th Harbour Master couldn’t see the Ferry.

There were 610 passengers and 123 crew aboard. 53 people died but many others were saved as people with small boats headed out into the stormy seas to rescue the survivors. Some people made it to shore on pieces of wreckage or by swimming but who would have thought that when they boarded the Wahine at Lyttleton Harbour the boat would smash into rocks at the entrance to Wellington harbour and 53 would not make it to shore alive.

A life on the sea is not for me!
141322.title: Life On The Sea

1413221.content:
Going abroad was my plan, untill Fate decided otherwise.
We set out on a clear Monday morning, my crew and I. The sails filled easily enough, after the cargo had been loaded, and the sloop Adventurous Visions sailed for the port of Hong Kong from the city of Belfast.
The winds held well enough for the first few weeks. We spent most of our time playing cards or betting on below-deck cockfights. I lost a good deal of those bets.
On the 23rd day of our voyage, the crows-nest spotted rough weather on all sides. We were caught in a vast hurricane, with no means of outrunning or evading the storm. We barely had time to reef the sails before we were broadsided by the power of the storm. Twenty foot waves rocked the boat, and lightning threatened to strike our mainmast. I was tied to a railing, but when the mast was struck, the front half of the ship flew apart by the action of the lightning and the waves. I was tossed into the sea, still tied to a splintered piece of railing.
Luckily, there was a small island in the distance, and, letting the action of the wind push me towards it, I landed after a long ordeal on the waves.
I had no provisions, no tools but some rope and a shard of wood, and no means of climbing the sheer cliffs above me on the shore. My situation was hopeless.
1413221.title: Going Abroad

choices: Does he set out to swim around the island?
Or does he look for a way through?
14132212.content:
...wanting only to get away from the incoming tide. Up against the rock I laid down, using the rail as a pillow, and jumped off into my dreams.

In the first dream I went back, not to the wreck, but the start of the trip out of Belfast. This time the violence of the storm greeted me when we left the harbor. As great as the impact of that storm was, having it so north made it seem small. It blew past us, disintegrating as it did and I awoke on a wave of optimism.
14132212.title: Exhausted, I staggered toward the cliffs...

142.content:
To Thine Own Self

To thine own self be true,
No matter how much the world may indulge you.
You are the only one who can see it through,
Before you can call out the final adieu.

You are not alone,
Though it may feel like you are on your own.
And no moss gathers on rolling stone.
But in the end you'll gather only what you've sown.

So, take heed and be true,
To love the old and the new.
One who understood more than he knew.
And embrace the child who still lives withing you.
142.title: To thine own self be true

1421.content:
Eat, drink and be merry! For manana you die.

This isn't from the Rubiyat of Omar Khayam and it isn't what a bunch of us squids from
San Diego said to each other while guests of the Green Note in Tihuana, Mexico while on shore
leave before being shipped to," The Nam".
But I did drink mucho to kill ya and I was merry ( so I was told) and I did INDULGE in eating.
I also did something else and it probably saved my life. I got amebic dysentary and almost died. I was comatose for four days. The tequila saved me from death by postponing the delivery of the poison til I got back to a hospital that was familiar with the maladies that sailor's bring back from inches down under! Shoot! I'm from Kansas. What do I know of Oceans or Mexico?
They pumped out everything I had consumed when I was being the world traveler including my blood which they replaced! They then found I had contracted syphilis, and crabs! While doing my blood works they found that I had hepetitas B and asked me if anyone in my family had ever contracted tuberculosis. I said it was in my file. They re-looked and found that three of my aunts had died from it and that my mother had survived.
I never made it to The Nam. They washed me out. Good thing I never told them about the
malaria my dad passed on to me? Saved my life. I think Nam would have killed me. I heard it was a lot rougher than Mexico.

14222111.content:
The world and every thing in it is like a large clock. If you look inside a clock it has a lot of cogs and each one is, a certain size. every screw has a purpose. The balancing of the clock is precise to enable it to function to a high standard and on time every day, Year in and year out. If one cog is broken or missing the clock stops.

Like a heart stops if the arteries in our bodies are not healthy as they are meant to be. If our heart doesn't work as it should we slow down and get weak and deteriorate, if it's not fixed then it is inevitable death. Take our brain, we have been given a brain to use to the best of our ability. If we don't learn as we grow and take in the correct knowledge, or dis-regard the correct knowledge that is offered and go our own way, for instance. How to manage money; how to clean a house or wash and iron our clothes, looking after our teeth, personal hygiene, Training our children in the way that they should behave in the world. How to be good and treat our neighbors as we would like to be treated ourselves.
Every small detail, every good or wrong in life has to have a consequence.

Let's go back to our world, our planet, spinning around in the space given to it in the infinity of creation. Just like the cogs in the clock, like the blood in our arteries, misused it all falls apart and self destructs.

A man needs to work to feed his family and pay the bills. The house a family lives in has to be cleaned and it will show a shine or decline by the effort that has been put into it. Children's school work is defined by the effort and knowledge they have put into listening and learning.

Cleaners get up early and clean our streets, airports, banks, Dr surgeries, hospitals, Tax is deducted from our earned monies to pay for making our country a better place to live.

God set laws in place for us to follow and if followed and understood, our lives prosper and we are in good health.

So, if the cogs are taken out of society, for instance, Nurses, Street cleaners, taxes, clean food preparation from seed to serve. If we don't recycle as we should, if we throw food out on the street, if we don't clean our surroundings or look after our bodies, or our neighbors, then consequences, breakdown, meltdown, rats, dis-ease, death. OUR one and only world, our one and only body. our children and children's children will suffer.

Every person has a roll to play every day, no matter how small, even if we are sat at home, or out of work, or rich and famous or can't be bothered because no one sees what we are doing. Think again. We pay the consequences of our actions. It all matters

Well, on a good note let every one take time to make this planet that we all live in a better place to be. Plan carefully what you will do and it will turn out right,
14222111.title: The author of forgiveness explains

choices: I talk of peace, but I know this person who I will never forgive, ever!
Heaven is not about flowers and gold; it is about looking into the eyes of God.
14222112.content:
Not forgiving is like drinking poison, and hoping that your enemy will die of it.

Yes, it is the best kind of "selfish" or selfishness, or enlightened self-interest, to forgive any wrong. If no wrong, or suffering, ever came to an individual, would she or he ever fully grasp what Jesus actually showed in his human life on earth?

It is hard to say Jesus was selfish in forgiving humans all their sins; but He wanted us back "walking with God" as Adam and Eve had done, before the Fall, in the cool of the evenings. We could never meet the standards of perfection. Or even TEN commandments or rules. Jesus had to be human to die like us, to sin, though he was tempted like us in every way. Even the devil tested Jesus in the desert as Jesus fasted and prayed before beginning His ministry of teaching and healing. Each time, Jesus forewent all the enticements of this world (controlled by Satan, since Adam and Eve gave up "dominion" by sinning).

So, every nightmare - of hell - and every good dream, tell us we are receiving messages that seek reconciliation. I can forgive without asking the perpetrator permission. Most great dreams begin inside the individual. Did society encourage Einstein, or Mark Twain, or Abraham Lincoln. I believe the Spirit of God deposited inside of us, beckons toward His Plan of Reconciliation. Only the lateral thinkers can agree with this Plan. Naturally, we love having the power we get by holding grudges, or waiting for revenge. "Vengeance is Mine," says the LORD. Even Gandhi - an average student and lawyer - was a lateral thinker who noted, "An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth will make the whole world blind and toothless." As we see in the Middle East, there is no end to revenge, be it for honor, or avenging the previous battle, conflict, or war!

So many people talk of wanting peace in the world. Again, it has to be selfish to be meaningful. What do I mean? You can hope for peace in the world, when you hate your brother, or sister, or parent - never wanting to forgive their mistakes, ignorant errors, or their deliberate cruelty. If no wrong was ever done to us, we would know goodness and forgiveness only as a distant star. But investing in peace-making at home, will snowball into the community, society, nation, and the globe. I am not surprised that soldiers who kill in the Middle East sometimes kill family members when they return. Call it PTSD, or anything. We must be selfish: forgive ourselves and others! Self-condemnation is a horrible virus, that goes on infecting all of life, everywhere. STOP IT INSIDE YOU! By forgiveness, the only sure-fire medicine and cure. Try it ... most of us have not. Yes, it is a very selfish act: forgive yourself for not having been perfect (God knows it; that's why He sent Jesus to do all things well for His followers). Don't stop with self-forgiveness: keep expanding the circle.

I had to join Nelson Mandela and forgive my horrible, semi-fascist government in South Africa. I was not excited about joining Mandela. We had good grounds to take leaders to the Hague, to face justice and jail-time. But Mandela was wise to know HEALING of a nation cannot come from the courts. He admitted he did not want to let the whites off so easily; but the nation needs ALL its resources, especially the human beings! Are you wiser than Mandela, Gandhi, and Lincoln? Are you seriously concerned about global peace? Then forgive your neighbor, your imperfect parents, even the abuser ... we have so many role models. Otherwise spare me the easy talk about loving people and wanting to save the planet! The planet and God wants you to start by saving yourself from hate and hell. Blessings.
14222112.title: Spiritually, forgiveness is a selfish act
