1422212.content:
If life was a wishing well.

I wish I could apologize for not forgiving you your transgressions against my person.

I can't apologize to you for not forgiving what you did to me because I'm not sorry I haven't forgiven you
but I wish I could apologize for not knowing how to be sorry for not forgiving you.

Wishes and wishing are a lot like the word if. Small words, occupying very little space with no basis
in reality. When used together in a sentence the sentence falls short of having meaning.
Here's one: What if you got what you wished for?

I wouldn't be wishing I could apologize for not forgiving if there had been no transgression in the first place.
1422212.title: Wishes

14222121.content:
Is it hard to do unto others as you would have done unto yourself? I suppose it is. What if they don't deserve it?

There he sits, smug and spectacular, with a coffee in hand, as if he hasn't realised that I'm here too. I know he has because that's what the smirk is for. He is very obviously not looking in this direction. Did he come in because he'd seen me through the window? I am sitting right next to it, though I hadn't seen him in time to get up and go.

Together for over five years, our relationship had become dry and brittle and easily broken. I took a week-long trip abroad. After I returned to find the house a mess, I started cleaning and was putting things away in his bedside cabinet when I found a lip-gloss from a brand I'd never even heard of let alone purchased. Whose is that? I wondered, taking it out. I didn't think much of it - he picked up some colleagues who lived local before heading to work on a morning and one of them was a lady. Maybe she'd dropped it and he'd assumed it was mine and brought it home?

Then I found a certain item of ladies' clothing that had not been mine when cleaning around the bed. That definitely rang some alarm bells. I confronted him with it. He paused a moment, looking from the garment dangling from the tips of my fingers to my face. "Well," he began at last, "we...uh...had a party at work. I must have got drunk. I...I don't...I just assumed that this girl was...you."

This pathetic excuse had me screaming the house down. The house was his so I packed up my things, though it would have been so much more satisfying if he'd left. The bastard. He kept pleading with me not to go but I was so angry. Was it Rachel? I asked, referring to the lady he took to work. Was it Libby?

I still remember slamming the door shut as he continued to plead. I wish I'd slammed it harder, broken it off its hinges. And then thrown it at him.

Back in the present, he has stood. I sit up a bit straighter, turn my attention to my phone.

If he comes up to you, how would you want to be treated right now? I thought. Do you want him to beg you to take him back? Is that what you want? Do you want him to sweep you off your feet again?

I scowl at my phone.

"I was wondering what you were looking at," a voice says nearby, "you seemed so angry."

I feel my face redden and quickly put the blank phone down screen-first. "What do you want?"

"What, I don't even deserve a "hi, how are you?" anymore?" He casually pulls out the chair opposite me and sits down. He smiles. It's a smile that would have left me a gooey puddle on the floor, once upon a time. He has a youthful face and a dimple in his cheek.

I try not to look at him. What do you want? I asked myself. You're pleased he's come to sit with you. You're not as angry as you thought you were. What do you want?

His smile fades away when I say nothing. "Look, I know you don't like me but...won't you at least forgive me? If you were in my position, wouldn't you want me to forgive you?"

"Oh, very nice," I hiss. "All right, you wanna switch places? Ok, so you come home from a holiday and find another man's things scattered across the bedroom. What would you do? Sit there and tell me "Oh, it's all right. These things happen"? Well they don't! They're done very deliberately! I leave for a week and come back to find that you'd allowed another woman in my place?!"

He takes a deep breath and lets it out. "I'm sorry, okay? I made a mistake."

He has attempted to speak with me a few times since I left and every time, I could not contain myself. But I have been thinking about it. About forgiveness. Do I forgive? Do I want to forgive him? Clearly, I do. Some traitorous part of me wants to be with him again. But then what? Peace, perhaps? The ability to move on with life? Or would I really get back together?
14222121.title: Is it hard to do unto others as you would have ...

14222122.content: So now you ask, is it possible to judge not? Well, for us humans, it is only natural to judge. If only the fit will survive, then what is so wrong with scoping out the playing field? What is wrong with seeing what you are up against? How would you play chess without knowing how the pieces work? How would you get to a destination without directions? How would you fight a beast without knowing it's weakness? The act of judging, whether used rightly or wrongly, is using common sense to deduce if a situation or being is suitable to be around or work with. So having said this, without having judgement, we would all go blindly into any situation without any foresight or premonition of what might come.
14222122.title: Is it possible to judge not?

1423.content:
A rolling stone gather no moss, I have read and 'a rolling stone gathers no moss' I have heard but what does it actually mean? Well, it could mean that a stone starts rolling and goes on for ever which is most unlikely unless of course the stone was in a river or a stream of water and was being tumbled by the water. But rivers and streams can dry up and water can be turned off or no rain falls.

Some people move from one place to another, never putting down roots. Like a tumble weed they are moved by the wind or more likely by desire to see new and perhaps better things. Roots are like the moss, they are there because you stay in one place. Of course roots and moss spread but roots are there to keep the tree in place or to keep a person in one place.

Gathering moss could mean becoming overwhelmed with responsibilities and the rolling stone could mean freedom. Now comes the question of freedom or ties? Second and third questions arise, does freedom mean the same to all people and do people who are settled in one place feel tied down?

Questions often bring about more questions.

"Did you eat your lunch today?"
"Yes mum. Was that good?"
"Yes dear, it was very good?"
"Why?"
"Because it’s good for you."
"How?" etc.

So, is it good to be a rolling stone or to stay in one place and put down roots? I don't know, after all I don't know the answer to whether freedom or tied down means the same to everybody.

Perhaps 'a rolling stone gather no moss' doesn't either!
1423.title: A rolling stone gather no moss

14232.content:
Draining pool of crimson mud;
erodes the endless day—
and in its gelid realm,
sullied of ‘is pain—
hewing, thou docile being!
Gulled, on direction south;
have you no strength?

These tumultuous words of he,
this vision, his journey—
the rout between the shadows
drowned in the river of no return,
as once upon the moonlit drear,
the dirge began to play.
14232.title: River of no return.

142321.content:
Like a sad song the sun insisted on setting... I wondered again, for perhaps the hundredth time; "{Why does it bother, always the same?" I meant the sun of course, in those days I thought it made a difference. I thought I made a difference! "Was it ten years ago?" "No A hundred! I decided, and with that I continued to reminisce about my first days. I had been out of the military for some time, so that was no longer an excuse.

I was lying in my special day bed thinking about how I'd made it. It had to be, some, story, but was now the time? This of course was an important question to me, as my success was so long in coming. At least I had no doubts about that. Time was everything, whatever else is said about the enemy, it was certain that, indeed, time was everything. That was why I was reminiscing, or maybe daydreaming about my, "Great overcoming."

I'd walked away that evening from more than a sunset, indeed, I was walking away from any number of ignorant beliefs, schools of thought, lists of drugs, and their requisite trips... I was walking away from a delusion; "The life delusion." It was already not necessary to consider the others that had walked before myself, nor was it any longer a care as to the ones whom would not succeed. The revelation, or perhaps awakening did not come to the accompaniment of any trumpets, fanfare, ticker-tape parade, or even champagne bash. It was not any sudden plum into the depths of some unknown genius, there was not a drum-roll.

To this day I am not satisfied for a justification as to why none of the above was, or was not appropriate. There was no special secret divulged, no "in," vouchsafed me. Just the same disgust with the worlds incomprehensible willingness to fail in my stead.

In the years that would come to pass, for a time I had missed a thing here, and an event there that could be experienced no more. That too finally faded into obscurity. You could say that as I became calm, not complacent, I eventually did find myself occupying a world that you might describe as a dream, but no dream of any note.

I soon found that there had once been a time of steamships, and airships, as in dirigibles. Without any pomp, and circumstance I was introduced to the well to do, and realized that people generally mix naturally with that which they often deny. It was not an earthshaking news-flash to find that all that was wrong with the world had been instrumented intentionally. Though it was of course a better thing to know, and separate myself finally from whatever vestiges of ignorance had kept me losing. Inarguable the fact I must be away from the wrong doers, still no answers were here.

Still that's why although far from the madness it was yet the work of investigating the one overall mystery. How and why was it so long a process? So painful. This question continued to plague my peace of mind, I would have answers. I did have some insight, in that I had learned that the depths of ignorance knew no limits, that the reach of deceit was crushing. The dream quality did not come unfounded either, verily the foolishness of magic is far more consuming, and encompassing than the average person could ever comprehend. Indeed, it reaches its depth, and fullness of destruction in the name of society. Under that heading drugs are introduced, then justified, once it comes to justification all is lost as regards society. From that point on it is but a matter of time before the wolves die off, and then those sheep that have milked the Earth bare for their conceit, die off. Who’s left; owns the Earth.

So in some sense as I lie in my special day bed, I am something like, taking assessment of my world. No I don't have any illusions of creating a new world, or even seeing one come to be. If it is to be, it will happen of its own doing. It may repeat the whole nightmare again for that matter, you know that it does not matter, you go on every day facing things that cause the most staid, and thoughtless to shudder in the depths of their sleep. Yet you barely notice the thunderous tsunami of ignorance, or its necessary destructive end, only certain that you can do nothing about it.

The mystery ensues, however, and we can not truly rest until we know, after all if you let the parasite continue its reign unchecked there would never have been any solidity. What we in the know call reality. Do you think for one second that the pathology of the delusion is not hounded down, controlled, is left at all free, for even a second? Go not under such a misconception, for you the bell tolls, and while their at it, the Gods may serve the wine!

This entire delusion, as destructive as it is, does not even touch on my reality. So again, it was necessary to get away from it all, it is all one, extra, large distraction.

The rest is profane, by what "Authority" do they commit this crime?" You say, and with that, give them "Bread and circuses." You would not waste an instant of your existence considering this, yet you count on it, and expect just enough of the world to fall victim, that society must rise and fall, and with it the pain.
142321.title: The dirge began to play.

14233.content:
"I am sorry you didn't make it back here in time to see your brother before he passed on, Lance. I really thought he was gonna make it, he seemed to be improving right up 'till the end. I just keep thinking that maybe there was something I could've done better to nurse him back to health."

"It's not your fault, Kaylin, I'm sure you did all you could. It's not like it was in the old days, back when you could bring someone in to the emergency room to see a doctor when they got real sick. Hell, the nearest place I heard of where they even have any doctors left is down in Atlanta. And that place is a war zone, same as Asheville and Charlotte."

"I suppose you're right."

"I am glad I got back in time to help see Spencer off, at least. A woman shouldn't have to bury her husband all by herself."

"I am grateful for that, Lance. I was afraid I wouldn't have the strength on my own to dig a grave deep enough to keep the coyotes away..."

"Have you given any thought about what you're gonna do, now that Spence is gone?"

"I guess I'll just carry on as best I can here. I got the dogs to protect me. I got the garden just about ready to harvest, and the hams from the last boar Spence killed hanging in the smokehouse. I'll be OK..."

"I don't know, Kaylin. It just ain't safe for a woman to be livin' on her own these days. There's gangs of desperate men out there who'd try to take advantage of you. I'm thinkin' it would be better if you came back to Clayton to stay with me and Susan."

"Lance, you and Sue got your hands full trying to provide for your three kids, I'd hate to impose on you all."

"It'd be no imposition at all, Kay. You could help Sue out with our garden, you always were good at making things grow. And it's not like you'd be freeloading, you'd be bringing back the hams, and everything we could harvest before you leave here..."
14233.title: Moving On

choices: The writer goes back to bed, end.
142331.content:
The road to Clayton. I woke up suddenly with the stranger's last words ringing in my ears. I usually didn't take much interest in dreams, whether they had meanings or not. It was 5.30 on a Saturday morning but I decided to get up anyway, I could sleep in on Sunday.

Clayton, the road to Clayton. Was it the name of a book, obviously a place but was it a real place, could I go there? How could I find out at this time of the morning? The Internet of course! Search.....Clayton.....Clayton UTZ..... a law firm in Australia......people called Clayton......Clayton California. The US and Australia are too far away.....try the title as a book......561 results......doesn't seem to be the title of a book. Ding dong, light bulb, perhaps I'm supposed to write a book called "The road to Clayton" but I am not interested in writing, I've never written a book. For God's sake I'm an engineer, a Civil Engineer, but it doesn't mean I couldn't write a book, just as a hobby. Here goes........

I launched my car........No, no, no, you don't launch a car. I wonder if there is a place called Clayton on another planet. Try again........The journey to Clayton was long and tiring........ This Clayton US of A was full of tumble weeds and the town's folk were gathered in the saloon.......... Nope! It was the North of England in Spring and I hated the thought of going to Northern Australia when their season was Autumn or Fall, depending on where you went school.......not going anywhere, nah........I left the mane highway to continue on my journey to the mysterious place called Clayton........

Gosh I'm tired........
142331.title: The Road to Clayton

1423312.content:
I gave up on the idea of writing a book but the name Clayton niggling at my brain and I tried to ignore it by singing out loud but that was coming back to me as something worse than niggling.

About mid day the phone rang, it was my sister. "We're not far from your flat Josh," she said cheerily, "You can get out of bed now I'm coming to see you and Daniel is with me he......"

"I'm out of bed," I cut her off. I loved my big sister dearly but to be part of a conversation with her I had to cut in or it was a very one sided conversation.

"That's a miracle," she said and continued, "Daniel wants to tell you about something he made for a school project. He wanted to bring it and show it to you but I thought it might get broken."

"Well I won't say that I could come to your....."

"No I know," now she was cutting me off. I didn't get along very well with her husband. "Its ok, I'm just outside the flat so watch out for a little whirlwind.

I hung up the phone and opened the front door and Superman nearly knocked me down. My five year old nephew, Daniel said something that sounded to me like." Unclejoshmumsaidishouldwearthissupermancostumebecauseyouboughtitforme."

I made a quick translation, as usual, ‘Uncle Josh mum said I should wear this Superman costume because you bought it for me.’ “So what you’re saying is that you hate it and you’re wearing it because your mother said it would……”

“Why do children always do that!” Becky stated rather than asked.

I gave her a hug and said, “Because mums try to make their children dishonest. The fact is Sis children are basically honest.”

Daniel was pulling at my shirt tale and saying something like, “Unca….unca…unca.” He was just as cheery and excitable as my sister. When I gave him all my attention he said, “I got first…”

I took his hand and lead him to the couch, Becky followed and we all three sat together. “Now!” I said to Daniel.

“I made……..something..” Daniel started.

“A town,” Becky filled in for him.

“How did you make it?” I asked showing great interest. It sounded like a big job for a small boy.

“I made with moodling…mooding…”

“Mo-del-ling,” Becky helped him out again.
Daniel looked a little confused then said, “clay”.

“From modelling clay,” I said enthusiastically, “A town, a clay town.”

“Yes,” he said looking very pleased with himself, “Clayton, I got first. Mine was the best.”

I kept hearing it bouncing around in my head. Clayton, Clayton, Clayton! Am I going mad, did I actually dream what my nephew had made?

“A clay town dear,” the mother was helping her son again.

“No Clayton mummy, Clayton.”

“He knows what he’s saying,” I said to Becky, “the town made of modelling clay is called, ‘Clayton’.”

“Yes, yes,” Daniel was saying, having jumped off the sofa and was now trying to fly like Superman. “I got firrrrr……st firrr…my……Clay…..ton. Zoom!”

At that moment I woke up from my dream to the sound of the telephone ringing. It was my sister Becky.

“At last, at last,” the excited voice said, “I’m going to have a baby.”

“Congratulations Sis. I have a feeling it will be a boy and that you might call him Daniel and………!”
1423312.title: The journey to Clayton continues.

142332.content:
"I really do appreciate your offer, Lance, and I don't want you to think I'm ungrateful. But me and Spence lived on this ridge for almost twenty years, and now he's buried on that hill. I don't want to leave him up there all alone. And you know our boy Calvin joined the Peacekeepers when they came through here recruiting last year. How do you think he'd feel if he came back to visit his mama and I was gone? No.. I think I'd best stay."

"But Kaylin, it ain't safe for a woman to be on her own in these times! I feel it's my obligation to look after you, same as I expect Spencer would've looked after my Susan if I had passed on first. I'd never forgive myself if anything were to happen to you."

"Now don't you worry about me, I can take care of myself. And I got my neighbors. Junior's still living in his place up on the hill, and LuAnne and Mickey are right up the road less than a quarter mile away. We all look in on each other. And old Roscoe's still a pretty good watch dog, he gets all the dogs in the neighborhood barkin' to let us know when someone who don't belong here comes around."

"Well OK, Kaylin, if you're sure... Is there anything else you need before I go?"
142332.title: Winter on Pine Ridge

1423321.content:
"Well Lance, If you got any spare ammo for our rifle I'd appreciate it."

"Spence had a 30-30 Winchester, same as mine, right?"

"Yeah, he always was bragging about how he could outshoot you with it, too."

"I suppose he could, he always was a pretty good shot... Well I got two boxes of shells in my pack, you can have 'em both. I got more back at home."

"No Lance, you'd best keep a box for yourself, I wouldn't want to worry about you being defenseless against marauders on the trail."

"All right Kaylin, but you be careful how you use those shells in your hunting. Keep at least half of 'em for defensive purposes. I'll try to bring you more come Spring."

"Don't worry, Lance, Spencer taught me how to trap for food after we ran out of ammo. I plan on keeping all the shells for defense... Hey Lance, why don't you take one of those hams with you for your family? Now that Spence is gone, I can't eat it all myself."

"Are you sure you don't need it, Kay? I'd hate to take advantage..."

"I'd say it's more than a fair trade for the ammo, Lance."

"Well OK, but I'll be sure to bring more shells when I come to check on you in the spring..."
1423321.title: Bullets

1423322.content:
"It is getting kinda late in the day, you might want to stay and get a good night's sleep before you hit the trail."

"Here I am asking what kinda work I can do to help you out, and you go on and tell me to take a nap instead, now I know why Spence married you!"

"No, seriously Lance, you'd be doing me a favor by staying. I got something on my mind that I never told nobody, and I sure could use someone to talk to about it now. I think it might go easier if we had something to drink. Would you like a glass of wine? Spence bottled it from last summer's blackberries, probably wouldn't win any medals for taste though..."

"Sure Kaylin, I'd love a glass of wine. Knowing Spence he made the wine more for the kick than the taste, but that's OK with me. So what's on your mind?"

"Well,I guess I'll just come right out and say it. When I met your brother I'd already missed a period, so I'm pretty sure Calvin isn't really Spencer's son..."

"You can't know that for sure Kaylin. Not to be indelicate, but you two were probably doing it pretty regular after you two got together, right?"

"That is true Lance, but in all the years after that we weren't able to conceive another child. And it wasn't for lack of trying, not to be indelicate. And considering how much younger than Spence I am, I think the odds are pretty good it wasn't my fault."

"Even if that's so, why tell me this? Why now, after my brother is gone?"

"Well Lance, I really wanted to have a child of his. You know, to carry on his bloodline. And since you are his brother... Do you know your Bible?"
1423322.title: A Night of Comfort

14233221.content:
"You're talking about where this guy is supposed to get his dead brother's wife pregnant so she can have a child in his brother's name? But that was a long time ago, those folks had different priorities!"

"Were they really that much different than we are, Lance? Civilization has moved backwards quite a bit since the war. I'm sure people a couple thousand years ago could relate to the way we live now, hunting and farming same as they did. Here, have a little more wine, and at least consider the idea, okay? "

"This is crazy, Kaylin! It's bad enough you want me to leave you here all alone, but now you want to have a baby on your own too!"

"You're thinking too far ahead, Lance. Even if it takes, I'd still have until next spring before I needed help getting ready for the baby.... It is something I really want, and you did agree to help me out with anything I wanted, right?"

"No Kay, I couldn't be unfaithful to my Susan like that. If she knew you were to have my child it would break her heart... And she'd probably break my neck!"

"She wouldn't have to know. Spencer's only been gone a few days, so as far as anyone was concerned it would be his child... Come on Lance, I seen you checking me out more than once or twice when you thought I wasn't looking. You're a guy, you can't tell me the thought of what it'd be like to spend a night with me hasn't crossed your mind before. So why don't you just finish your wine and come to bed?"
14233221.title: Genesis 38:8

142332211.content:
"Wake up, Lance. I got eggs, biscuits, and ham steaks for your breakfast."

"Aw Kay, you didn't have to go and make anything special for me."

"No, you deserve it, Lance. Three times in one night!I don't think Spence and me ever did it three times in one night before. I figured you'd need something to recover your strength after that."

"Knowing how bad you wanted that baby I just wanted to make sure it would take, is all. If it wasn't for your circumstances and times being what they are, I'd never have done it with you, Kaylin. And I'd hate for my Susan to find out I had, too."
142332211.title: In the Morning

1423322111.content:
"Well I won't be telling Susan anything, Lance. If, as they say in the Bible, "your seed bears fruit," it will be Spencer's child as far as anyone else is concerned. But I do have to admit that last night I was thinking on what it would be like if I'd married you instead of your brother. We might have been a pretty good match, if only you'd spoken for me first... But that is neither here nor there, as they say. You've got a perfectly good wife waiting on you back in Clayton, so you'd best be moving on... I'll be just fine here on my own, although I would appreciate it if you'd come back this way in the Springtime to check up on me."

"Sure Kaylin, I'll come back as soon as the cold breaks...You know, I was thinking, I might be taking another hunting trip up this way in November, before Winter closes in. If you want, I could check up on you then..."

"That would be just fine, Lance, I sure would appreciate the company..."
1423322111.title: Setting the Hook

143.content:
I kill them, and the blood flows
I am giving roses but they seem so wrong,
I crush necks in my hands,
and my hands fill with gold

I save lives,
but at the cost of others,
is it worth it,
is my life worth it,

Do I deserve to be banished,
do I deserve to die like those at my blade,
what is right and wrong, I have long since forgetting,
I don't even have my own name,

I have lost so much, as well as others,
I have denied the needs of the many, for the needs of the few,
I am an assassin.
143.title: I know it's wrong, but I still do it

1431.content:
These troublesome thoughts and more muddle my mind and make me weary. Stumbling through the dirty labryinth of alleys long forgotten by the good citizens of the crowded city I half-consciously make my way to the cell-room sized apartment that I call home. Dirty, dingy walls breeding who knows how many species of mold offer the tiniest bit of protection from the outside world and I welcome their meager comfort. A single foot above my greasy brown hair, now plastered to my sweaty forehead, the water stained ceiling drips steadily when the upstairs toilet is flushed and the sole window is hardly large enough for a cat and bordered up anyhow which is just fine by me.
With all the weight of my emotional burdens I allow myself the freedom to fall face first onto the thin twin mattress covered only by a torn blue plaid sheet and an older green military issued wool blanket, my only momento from my days serving the government that used me until I was spent. Their training still courses through my veins like poison, boiling my blood, making me itchy and uncomfortable until I can no longer stand it. The anger triggers it, memories of wrongdoings, mine and others against me, come bubbing up and like the taut wire of a warrior's bow I snap. Fighting the hatred I rock back and forth, trying to soothe myself and induce the sleep I long for. My body is too tired and before long
I am no longer in control. Like a wild animal I rage against the confines of this tiny room, tears streaming from my heart knowing that just moments ago this was my sanctuary. Like yin and yang, black and white, there are two sides to everything and the poison is the darker,unwecome side of me. Heaven help me for I am a monster again.
1431.title: Poison

14311.content:
It's hard for me to see why anyone would want to live in a city. Walking on hard flat paths, shutting oneself inside a wood and stone box at night, that's no life for a man.

Men were meant to live under the sun and stars, hunting and gathering with their wives and children. The old ones must have been mad to live in cities.

It looks like not many others have discovered this city. Although most of the boxes are in ruins from the Great War and the work of Father Time and Mother Nature, there is still much useful material here.

I have found a piece of good iron to forge into arrowheads, and a shiny metal cooking pot to give to Seena when I get back to the camp. I will tell the others of this place and we will return to look for more items. Our tribe should do well in trading this year at the Summer's End Gathering.
14311.title: Destroying the city.

14312.content:
It happened to me in the night, I was moving along the quiet streets of a small city that never felt welcoming. It had a dark feel to it which made me feel cut off from the rest of the world. That night I traveled past an abandoned military base that lingered on outskirts of town. I wandered through it, welcoming my death, as I knew that only these feelings of pain, and hate would find an end, should I too find one.

As I walked a man stumbled toward me, or should I say, shambled towards me. I felt panic fill my stomach, and freeze me. Why would such a man come at me with such hate in his eyes? Why are his arms extended before him like some ravenous creature whom I must face in order to find the gold. The man approached me, and I could see his skin sliding from his face, the bone from his jaw extending through what was remaining of his skin. The next thing I realized, is that this man was not a man at all, and his teeth had sunk into my chilled flesh. It was a sensation much like a child biting your finger when they are young and unaware of the consequences.

I tore away, and ran home. I laid there with my thoughts all evening, fell asleep for mere hours and awoken, feeling the pain in my chest first. Then finding that my skin itched, and my heartbeat was slowing. What is to become of me? This poison which seeps through my veins, this nightmare which is reality. The bite from the hideous man. I. am. becoming. a monster..
14312.title: Seeking solice.

143122.content:
and that is going to be my bright future. It might look like dark future for you. I do not have to have care in the world. I will have a guaranteed job from tomorrow. That job is to use my jaws to great effect.

I know there will be no shortage of victims. They would be coming along the way. I do not need to try much. Did I not walk into the trap. When I was on the other side it looked scary. Now it looks enjoyable.

Best thing iin this part of the life is I can seek my end. It can come very quickly. Let me at least prepare eight more guys and gals before I seek my end.

The end I am seeking is far more beautiful than you think! The first guy is already visible that should leave me with seven before I seek my end!
143122.title: Seeking My End

choices: If you're happy and you know it...
1432.content:
I can hear the faint beep of the machine monitoring my heartbeat. The smell of hospital fills my nose. If you've ever been in the hospital, you'll know what I mean. That chemical-y clean smell. I've been surrounded by that smell for at least half of my life. But why am I here now? I feel dizzy...
Did I faint? That would explain a lot. The throbbing in my arm... and my head... Someone would have seen my medical bracelet and called 911 right away. I feel sick. But that's not a new sensation. I've always been sick.
I was born with a weak immune system. I get sick all the time. I'm also... frail, is the best way to put it. I mean, come on, I'm almost seventeen and I don't even have hair <i>down there</i> yet. Let alone breasts. The only thing that hints at my real age is my hight, and even then, it only makes me appear thinner than I really am. Which is pretty thin to begin with. Any less weight and you'd see my ribs through my skin.
I try to take a deep breath and pull myself up out of the darkness that still encompasses my vision. It hurts. I wince at the pain.
So this is it, then?
This is going to be my Last Stand?
I could almost laugh at the irony of it all. A few more days and it would have been my birthday.
Instead of laughing, I find myself crying silently. I can feel the tears running down my cheeks. I don't want to die yet. Everything goes black...

The sound of faint singing reaches my ears. Is that the angels? No... no, it's too off-key to be angels. Slowly I'm able to make out the words.
"Happy Birthday dear Brittany... Happy Birthday to you."
Slowly I manage to open my eyes. My brother is there, grinning at my, and behind him, my parents. He's holding a cupcake from the hospital cafeteria with a candle stuck in the top.
I manage a smile and blow out the candle.
We made it through another one.
I had fainted, and broke a rib when I fell off the fence I had been sitting on when it happened.
They had me drugged down to lessen the pain.
But I was awake all day for my birthday.
"And many mooorrreee." My brother sings softly, still out of tune.
He's always out of tune.
1432.title: Last Stand

14321.content:
"If you're happy and you know it clap your hands."
The sound of a familiar childhood melody,
While calming and reassuring,
Also brings back memories,
Good or Bad,
Only you could choose,
Would you control them.?
Or let them control you.?
Youth is a gift,
Oh, to have the innocence of a child again,
To have their mind,
Sweet and pure,
But as we are older,
Fake innocence is common,
Some might say children are in their own world,
But is that really a bad thing.?
14321.title: If you're happy and you know it...

143211.content:
Dreams. They are all that make up us. We dream for a better job. A better house.
Children dream for they still have an infinity beyond them. Elders dream in nostalgia.
If not for dreams, what are we? We live without purpose.

I think all this as my life flashes before my eyes.
Before I pass out, I think this.

Monsters playing as cats are simply dreaming to be the predator.
143211.title: Dreams

143212.content:
Black horses with fiery chariots
Searing my fantasy land
Barbie-proportioned men in yellow jumpsuits
Kidnapping my brothers and sisters
Unable to protect
Them from the clutches of another

Used to try to scare myself
Now it's out of my own control

A priest returning from the dead
My family turning into bulldogs
And frogs at the the end of my bed

Unable to reach 911
Huddled in the pitch black closet
Motion for quiet and hear their quick steps
Moving closer
Hands shaking with trepidation
Can't let them come in
They enter my room
The phone goes dead
My littlest sister begins to cry
The closet door swings open...
143212.title: Nightmares

1432121.content:
The light pattering of rain, even and constant, is all I can hear as I sit under the evergreens, waiting for the unknown to sweep me away from this tortured reality. My eyes feel crusty and sore with the residue of wasted tears, so I reach out and capture some of the glittering rain, using it to wash away the debris of my failures. Sitting here, drowning in my eternal solitude, I hope for reprieve; a copper lantern to light my path back to normality, but I know just how fruitless wishes are; I know nothing ever changes and that this state of inert existence will be mine forever. Each breath I take feels as if it should be my last, but death will never knock at my door. The rain becomes louder as the skies open up above me, giving in to the tears I know so well, and I realise that I'll be waiting here for a long, long time. The darkness in my heart grows, and I recall a rhyme I wrote so long ago:

Red of blood and blue of soul
Solid and shattered; broken yet whole
Tides seep forth as inside they receed
The dry wound erupts and begins to bleed
Boiling hate found in numbing cold
Loose grip felt in a choking hold
Eyes closed tight so the blind can see
You're so different, but you're part of me

But is it part of me, or am I part of it? I'll soon know.

Now the light begins to fade away, and I see a shadow creeping closer, sneaking through the twilight. Smiling through the rain, I greet my other half, glad to see it skulking ever closer. We've put this off for so long" I murmer, feeling myself being drawn into the sweet embrace of my destiny, knowing I'm free to leave the stage. We finally collide, and I melt into the warm silence of my death.
1432121.title: Wishes

14321212.content:
She breathed in the mildewy scent of rain-soaked wood, opening her blue eyes. The smile adorning her chapped lips hardened with the bittersweet sight. Innumerable, scraggly limbs soared towards the gray sky overhead. Lifeless, wooden fingers scraped across the horizon, clinging desperately to the last of autumn's glory trembling in the wind. Fiery scarlet, brilliant gold, and burnt orange colored her vision as her eyes raked across the blanket of death that would soon lay beneath a burial shroud far more frigid and devoid of life.
         Stooping, the figure brushed away the slick coating at the gnarled roots of the tree, fingers desperately digging, digging, searching, seeking, then finding at last. Her fingertips brushed against the harsh stone, traced the grooves across its angular surface as the woman had time and again through the ceaseless turning of the seasons. Icy blue eyes watered, a living testament to the man she never knew but through the stories that had surrounded her childhood with their comforting warmth of an ethereal presence shadowing her steps. Even if she had never known them, she could imagine the feel of the rough, weather-worn hands that should have embraced her for the twenty-odd years stolen away.
         Nothing escaped her parted lips except the condensation from her hot breath on the cold wind. Ages passed, leaving an echoing trail of her ghostly breaths streaming out unto the world. Of the past decades he had missed, of everything that they both had never known, that was all she could find to say: I'm alive, Daddy. Yet, as she closed her gaping mouth, she knew that nothing ever needed to be said. He, her guardian angel, already knew.
         Nothing broke the stillness but the final golden leaf as it floated down to kiss her brown hair.
14321212.title: Falling leaves

143212121.content:
It was another typical day at the office. There I was on the phone, trying to squeeze some deadbeat into making at least one more payment on the mortgage our firm screwed him into taking before we foreclose on his house. The next thing I know I'm lying on the ground clutching at my chest. I try to call out for help but I can't seem to move my mouth. Then I have this strange sensation, I'm floating above my body, looking down at myself just lying there.

After a couple minutes Claire from accounting walks by my cube and peeks in to say Hi. She sees me lying on the ground and screams. Someone calls 911 while our resident safety guy tries unsuccessfully to revive me. The whole time I'm floating above, just calmly watching the whole thing like it's a badly scripted TV show.

They wheel my body out and I feel like I'm being pulled away from the scene, down this long tunnel. I can see a white light ahead and I have this sense of impending doom. I haven't been a very good person in this life, and I haven't been to church in ages. If now it's time to face old Saint Pete, I'm most likely in deep shit here.

Suddenly I burst into the light and I,m not facing Saint Peter. Instead it's big blue guy with six arms and an elephant head. He's got a voice like Apu from the Simpsons and he says "Mister Anderson, you do not seem to have improved yourself in this life. I think we will be sending you back this time as a..."
143212121.title: Rebirth

choices: Women, Wealth, and No More Work!
An End to War, Poverty, andHunger
143212122.content:
So anyway, Steve, this is how it all happened...

A couple months ago I started getting into that show on cable where people buy old things really cheap and then sell them for a whole lot of money.
You know the one, some old lady buys a painting in a cracked frame at a yard sale for two dollars, then finds out it was painted by some famous guy who died a hundred years ago and it's worth twenty thousand.

I decide that is gonna be my road to riches.
I'm tired of living in this trailer park and barely getting by; I'm gonna go out and find me some antiques and make a fortune.
I know what old stuff looks like, this should be easy!

So this past last weekend I'm at a yard sale and I spot this tarnished oil lamp that looks straight out of that Disney movie I took my granddaughter to a while back.
I knew it had to be really old, probably worth at least five grand.
When I ask the old lady how much she wants for it and she says "Two bucks," I think "This is my lucky day!"

I get the lamp home and start to polish the dirt off the thing and this genie dude dressed in robes and a turban pops out of it.
Man, you shoulda been there, he looked like he coulda been Saddam Hussein's kid brother!

So he tells me I get three wishes for setting him free and I start thinking "This is even better than what I could get for the lamp!"
If I pick the right wishes I could be set for life!
143212122.title: Golden Eternity

choices: The Genie drops the lamp and you pick it
The wizard under your command puts the genie back in the bottle.
1432121221.content:
You know me Steve, If I didn't have to work I'd spend the rest of my days just drinkin' beer and shootin' pool at the the Mill, or I'd be watching the dancers down at Miss Kittie's.
So my first wish is to never have to work again, and the genie says "It's done!"

I wasn't gonna tell you about my second wish but since I'm gonna die anyways, I guess I don't matter.
I Always felt a little shortchanged in my ability to please the ladies, if you know what I mean.
So thinking about the old Aerosmith song, I ask the genie if I can have a "Big Ten Inch", the genie says "Done," and sure enough now I got it!

Right about then I start to think about how I heard genies try to trick you into wishing for something that ends up causing you problems you didn't think about. I figure this Genie is gonna get we with the first wish. I might not ever have to work again but then I might be broke, and end up starving on the street.

So for my third wish I say I want everything I touch to turn to gold. After all, no matter what else happens, gold is always worth a lot of money, right?
The genie says "Done!" Then he vanishes, along with the lamp.

So I start touching things. My old guitar that I could've pawned for fifty bucks is now worth at least fifty grand as gold, right?
This solid gold kitchen table with matching chairs are probably worth more than I make in five years!
Then I get thirsty and go to the fridge and grab a beer, that's when I realize why that damn genie was laughin' as he disappeared.

Well, my drinkin' days are over, Steve. My eating days too. Soon to be followed by my living days, I expect. I want you to have all this gold stuff when I'm gone, somebody ought to get something good out of this. I'd shake hands on the deal, but I don't think that would do you much good...
1432121221.title: Women, Wealth, and No More Work!

choices: Someone else picks up the lamp
14321212211.content:
I was walking down the sidewalk when I saw this old lamp. What now, I thought cynically, I'll rub the lamp and some genie will appear. In the stories, no good come from that. Before I did anything with it this guy came crawling along, leaving a trail of gold behind him.

"Did you fall for the King Midas dodge?" I asked.

"Yeah, and now I'm dying. Everything I touch turns..."

"I know, to gold. Didn't you know better?"

"I got greedy. Please help me, man."

"What makes you think I'm any smarter than you. I'll probably just mess things up as well."

He started howling in despair.

"Stop it," I told him. OK, I'll see what I can do to end this mess."

I rubbed the lamp. Of course the genie appeared, gave me the three wish line, and waited for me to make a fool of myself. I didn't have an agenda, and I knew how tricky these genies could be. So I didn't say anything.

"The genie said, "Well?"

I said, "Are you in a hurry?"

The genie grimaced. "You're supposed to wish for something. It's in the rules."

"Wait a minute," I said. "Aren't I the one in charge here?"

The genie became cranky. "Everybody wants something. Just tell me, so we can move this along."

"What happens if I don't wish for something? "

"Listen," the genie growled, "I can't stay out more than an hour without granting a wish, or else I lose my powers and get thrown out of the genies guild."

"Gosh," I said with false concern,"That would be terrible." I then just stared at him.

We went on like this for about fifty-five minutes. The genie got desperate. "OK, what do you want?"

I said, " I'm not going to make any wishes, but what you're going to do is undo all the mischief you did to this guy who's starving to death and all of the other fools you've let trick themselves with their greed."

The genie started wailing. "Come on man I can't do that."

"Suit yourself," I told him as I started walking away.

Next thing I knew, the starving guy was hopping around yelping with joy. "I'm free," he hollered. He rushed over and hugged me.

The genie chuckled as the wise guy with the lamp turned to gold. "Genies always find a way to outsmart these idiots," he said as he disappeared into the lamp.
14321212211.title: The Genie drops the lamp and you pick it

choices: No, I'll take the cash and  booze, and the  Hooters girls!
1432121222.content:
Not sure what got into me, Steve. Maybe it was how my mama was always trying to instill those good Christian values in me when I was a kid. Telling me I should help those less fortunate in life... Stop fighting with my brothers and try to bring a little peace into this world.

I was gonna wish for a million dollars, a keg of Jim Beam, and a threesome with those twin sisters that work down at the Hooters. I'm sure you would agree those are completely sensible wishes, right? But then it was like I could hear Mama calling out to me from beyond the grave...

So I wished for an end to war, poverty, and hunger.

The genie scratched his head and said "That goes against human nature son, are you sure that's what you really want?"
1432121222.title: An End to War, Poverty, and Hunger

14321212221.content:
So when I said "Yes," the genie said "Humans by nature use warfare to advance themselves at the expense of their fellow men, who will suffer the consequences of poverty and hunger. There is only one way to put an end to this cycle, and I hope you are satisfied with the results of your request."

Then he vanished, along with the lamp...

Then the nuclear bombs started falling...

I guess I'm glad my granddaddy built this bomb shelter in our back yard back in the 60's, otherwise we'd probably be dead now too...

There haven't been any explosions outside for at least a couple days now, Steve. Do you think we should go out and try to look for the lamp to see if we can undo this mess?
14321212221.title: Yes!

143212122211.content:
I really wasn't prepared for the absolute destruction I would see when I opened the door and stepped outside the shelter. I guess the genie was right, the only way to end war and suffering would be to put an end to the human race. How on earth would I ever find that damned lamp in time to undo all this destruction?

I wandered around at random figuring it would be hopeless, but at least it would give me something to do until the radiation sickness killed me. Suddenly there it was, the gold lamp, half hidden under a pile of rubble. It was almost as if I had been guided to it.

I quickly rubbed the lamp and the genie appeared. "Thank you for freeing me from the lamp. In return for your favor I will grant you three..."

"Spare the speech, Buddy, just undo the last guy's last wish," I replied.

"But you must make three wishes, and since your first one is to undo a previous wish, you must make the other two before the first is granted."

"Okay, but I know it's all a scam. I read the stories, there is no way you'll let me profit from my wishes. So here goes nothing. Second wish: I want a winning lottery ticket."

The genie said "It's done," and a "California Gold" scratcher appeared in my hand. I pulled a quarter from my pocket and scratched off the numbers, and sure enough...
143212122211.title: Steve finds the lamp

1432121222111.content:
"Big deal, I won a free ticket. I bet when I cash it in the next one is a loser, right?"

"Unfortunately that is probably true," the genie replied. "I wish it were otherwise."

"What do you mean you wish it were otherwise? You're the one granting the wishes!"

"Yes, but I do not control them, I was tricked also, put into this lamp by a sorcerer. It is my fate to grant wishes that cause grief, that is why I tried to warn your friend. The only wishes that appear to benefit anyone are the ones that undo previous wishes. But they only go into effect after you wish for two others, that appears to be part of the curse."

"So how did you get trapped in the bottle? Who put the curse on you?"

"You know, in all these hundreds of years you're the first person who ever asked that..."
1432121222111.title: I Won

14321212221111.content:
"I was a great ruler in Mesopotamia, a long time ago. I was dying of an incurable disease, I had my servants send for all the healers and mendicants in my kingdom, they tried countless spells and potions, all to no avail. One day a young magician was brought in. He told me he could cast a spell that would let me live forever, but I must agree to give up my palace and servants and live in a small abode, and I must grant three requests of any who ask. I was very near death at this point, so I agreed to his demands."

"So that's how you ended up in the lamp?"

"Yes, but before he put me in the lamp he laughed and said "You may not remember me, I was just a boy when you killed my father on one of your conquests. And then you sold my sister into slavery. Now, after all these years they have been avenged! You will rue the day you wished for eternal life, and the wishes you grant will cause great despair!""

"Man, that's pretty harsh. But I guess you can't blame the guy for being pissed off. If it had been my dad and my sister..."
14321212221111.title: The Genie's Story

143212122211111.content:
"Believe me, I many have regrets over things I've done in my past. Especially all the grief the wishes I grant have caused. I wish I had accepted my fate and never asked for eternal life. But as part of the curse, none of my wishes are ever granted," the genie said

"If that's what you really want, I wish it for you, as my third wish."

"It's done," the genie says, as if in a trance.

I look down at my feet, and the genie is lying there, looking much older and gasping for breath. "Thank you for freeing me, Steve! may the Gods smile upon you in the afterlife!"

I look over at the lamp and see it crumble into a pile of rust. I look back at the genie and his body has turned into a pile of ash and tattered rags...
143212122211111.title: The Genie's Wish

choices: No thanks, I gotta get these antiques listed

"Hey Steve-o, long time no see! Where you been?"

" I don't know Lennie, Just woke up a little while ago, musta forgot to set my alarm."

"I'd offer you a beer, but I spent the last of my money on all these antiques I got at a yard sale this morning. Gonna make a killing once I get 'em up on Ebuy."

"Did you buy an old oil lamp, kinda like in Alladin?"

"No, didn't see anything like that, Steve. Why are you asking?"

"Never mind Lennie, just a weird dream I had... You wanna walk down the 7-11 with me and get some beer? I'm buying..."
1432121222111112.title: Steve Goes Back

14321212221111121.content:
Steve pulls out his wallet to pay for the beer, pulls out a California Gold scratcher worth a free ticket: "That's funny, Lennie, I don't remember buying this, but it's just like the ticket I had in that weird dream last night!"

"That game ended a while back, you probably bought it a couple months ago and stuck it in your wallet and forgot about it. The dream was probably your subconscious reminding you to cash it in before it expires."

Steve looks at the tickets under the glass counter display, spots one with a picture of a genie on it. He hands his ticket over to the clerk and says "Gimme one of those Aladdin's Treasure scratchers for my freebie."

He pulls a quarter out of his pocket and scratches off the numbers and it's a $100 winner.

"Hey, that's pretty cool, Steve! You gotta be the luckiest man I know! What ya gonna do with your winnings?"

"I dunno, you wanna go down to Hooters and get some wings after we kill this six pack at your place?"

"Sure thing, Steve. I think the twins are working this shift. Man, what I wouldn't give for just one night alone with them..."
14321212221111121.title: Sure, Let's Go!

1432122.content:
Some folks inherit star spangled eyes, ooh, they send you down to war.
And when you ask them: "How much should we give?" Oh, they only answer: "More, more, more..."
- John Fogerty "Fortunate Son"

"Turn it up Joe, I love this fuckin' song!"

"Yeah, me too. I grew up on classic rock, my dad was really into it. Told me they used to play their Credence and Hendrix tapes on an old eight track boom box during down times back in his war."

"Here we are, forty years later, fightin' just like they were, listening to the same old tunes, I guess were part of a tradition."

Randy pulls a joint out of his shirt pocket, holds it up and says "I got something else that's part of the tradition."

"Shit Randy, where'd you get that? If the ragheads catch you with that they'll hang your ass!"

"No worries, I got my connections. Hey, you wanna shotgun, old school?"

"I dunno, never tried it, heard about it though."

"It's something they came up with back in Nam, wouldn't be surprised if my dad invented it, much as he liked his weed."

Randy lights the joint and says "cup your hands in front of your mouth to catch the smoke." he picks up his rifle and turns it sideways, slides open the chamber, puts the joint in his mouth backwards, and blows the smoke through the barrel.

Joe inhales the smoke coming out of the barrel holds his breath, coughs a little as he exhales. A smile crosses his face as he says "That's a much better use for a gun, Joe, isn't it."

"It certainly is, Randy, it certainly is..."
1432122.title: Smoking Gun

14322.content:
They will never know, how it feels to be more robot than human. My parents, my brother, my entire family think that I am on the mend, but truly, they have rebuilt me. I tried, I really tried to stand up, win, and do my best, but that didn't matter to the Game Masters. We, us people who are chosen to play, to face the monsters, are put out there to learn, to teach, to entertain, and were just another piece in their game.

There is a rule though, which I am glad they honor. They will let a player fight and defend until the end, but not let any death go by. I was in just such a position. I would escape, live, and win, or I would be caught, played with, eaten or taken apart, as if I was made for this purpose. It was up to the Game Masters now. I had done my best.

It was cold, dirty, wet, scary, and I was out of energy, I could not run anymore, could no longer hide, I could not get away or fight anymore. I had done my best, and had no more to offer. I sat on that large gray and green, moss covered rock, holding my knees close to my chin as I rocked back and forth, arms wrapped around my knees, hands locked to my arms. This seemed to help comfort myself.

All I could think of now, now that I could do nothing else but wait, was think about how much I like pie. With my eyes closed, I could almost smell mom's home-made blue berry pie, or grandmother's blue ribbon winning apple pie. Of all of the things that I should be thinking about after realizing I had come to the end, had decided that there was nothing else to be done, I sat there thinking, wishing for, pie, my favorite thing to eat. I always felt better after eating pie. Maybe this was just another time that I would feel better, after all, I was thinking, wishing, almost tasting it, I like pie.

There was a loud noise, a loud scary noise, then, everything seemed to change. It was cloudy, misty, I was not on the rock anymore, but in a strange bed in a strange place. Something had changed for me. I felt different. No pain, no fear. I was different, but there was still one thing in my mind, something I was totally aware of, something that I knew for a fact. I like pie!
14322.title: I like pie

choices: The queen leaves the room and..
143222.content:
Unfortunately when the fog cleared and I saw my new environment. no pie was to be seen. Just a load of dark chocolate bars sitting on a tray on a high table by the bed. It was a poster bed complete with a track for curtains.
The room was huge and ornately decorated like something out of Louis the 14th castle! The light shone through small windows and I knew it was daytime. There was some kind of ruckus outside as I heard shouting and ..gunshots? I pulled up the covers on the bed and considered eating some of that luscious looking chocolate.
Not sure if I liked it as it was not pie, but thought I might as well give it a try. New place, new choices.
Just as I reached out to grab one, the doors flew open and in came this flurry of women... all dressed in royal clothes -one in particular was quite queen like. She was very upset and all I heard her scream was "let them eat cake!"
I quickly buried my head in the bed covers and waited. What on earth was going on?
143222.title: Chocolate Bars

choices: I crash to the floor and watch the ceiling
1432222.content:
As quickly as she waltzed in the queen left in the same flurry of agitation. I peeked out from under the covers and when I saw noone was around, I got out of the bed and reached for a chocolate bar, that seemed to be calling my name. There was still no pie like my mom used to make and if this was the Game Masters new ploy, what choice did I have. I didn't really want to stay and relive the French Revolution, if that is where I seemed to be.

The chocolate was dark and semisweet , melting on my tongue and by the time I ahd eaten two bars, my endorphins and energy was raised sufficient enough to change my depressive mood and low ebb to get up and look around. I stood up off the bed and whoah!
Dizziness struck me. The room spun and I couldn't get my balance! What did they put in that chocolate?
1432222.title: The queen leaves the room and..

14322222.content:
I crash to the floor but don't really feel it and watch the ceiling. The moldings are spinning and I notice the sunlight hit the chandelier crystals to make bright rainbows. They are so mesmerizing I am having trouble keeping my eyes open.....

When I wake up, I am laying on a grassy knoll with bright light beaming down. I feel my body again and prop myself up to see a gurgling stream and a green valley with fields running on to the horizon. I sit up and listen. As I go to stand up I feel somthing at the back of my neck. I turn and look right into the nose of a guernsey cow sniffing at me. I crawl away a bit and get on my feet.

Ok I am not scared of cows! I was just startled and again wondered where on earth I was and what game was at work here. It did not seem the the regular rough fare of the Games masters. I was rather happy about that part and yet this was a mystery.

I reached out to pet the cow and she was fine with it and then as if bored, sauntered back down her path, as cows are known to do.
I saw there was a herd down in the valley so it must be farm country.

I hiked down to the stream when I realized how thirsty I was, after consuming all that chocolate. The water was clear and clean and assuming that the cows must drink it, I figured it was safe. I just tried a bit on my finger to taste first. Yum! It was cold and fresh!
I bent down and drank from cupped hands and then sat to ponder on my next move when..
14322222.title: I crash to the floor and watch the ceiling

1433.content:
I see them. Do you?
         Do you see the angels, too?
         Their folded, feathery wings cut curved lines for a misshapen silhouette of such holiness. Two beautiful heads, mounted on bodies clothed in flowing robes, watch at either side of the great, golden cross. There, in the elegant alcove behind the altar is where the cross and two angels make their home on the peeling wallpaper.
         Every Sunday, my eyes are glued to the rich contours of the angels beside the cross as the pastor preaches, only taking my eyes off long enough to read the music and to sing among my soprano companions in the chancel choir. Then, when finished, my gaze returns to those dear, precious angels and their striking, distinct personalities. The one on the left stands tall with a statuesque grace, hair flowing about her smiling, gentle features. On the right, the angel stands not quite so tall, slightly stooped as he offers to those below the fruitful bounty he carries in his strong, comforting arms for those too weak to attain it for themselves. I watch their frozen forms from my lowly pew, staring at their cozy home on the wall beside the symbol of Jesus's sacrifice.
         Rather, it was their home.
         Now, the wings are no longer there, their shadows no longer cast upon the peeling wallpaper. No more does the angel on the left stand guard and watch, nor does the one on the right spread for all the world small blessings of heaven like occasional raindrops upon the lush greenness of the Pacific Northwest that lies beyond the walls of our little church. Instead, it is just the cross that is comfortably nestled in the freshly-painted alcoves. And no longer do I stare at that cozy alcove from my pew, for there are no more pews of which to speak. The Angel of Protection and Angel of Blessing, the two that kept company the now solitary golden cross, are no more there, for their graceful silhouettes are buried under a layer of brown paint over the peeling paper.
         Once, I was the only one to see the gentle angels hidden in the wallpaper of the sanctuary, enjoying the soothing comfort they brought me. Now, no one may see my angels, for they are hidden to all the blinded eyes of the children of God.
1433.title: My Angels of Blessing and Protection

14331.content:
The child sits alone on the cold cobblestone pathway, a tin can in hand, rattling it for some possible spare change. It wasn't a common sight these days and I almost cried when I seen him. Broken-hearted and feeling sorry for the young child I went over to him, knelt down before him and smiled.

"Hello," I said to him and he simply looked up. Didn't say a word, didn't mutter a sound, just rattled his tin can again. "My name is Annie, what's yours?" I ask him, hoping to get a response. Still nothing. I smile at his small face and remove some money from my pocket and tip it into his tin can. "Will you tell me now?"

"Jasper," he whispers, like he shouldn't tell me. Uncaring of what others who are walking by me think, I sit down in front of the boy. I hold out my hand, there are ten coins in it and he eyes them,- excited about them like I held a whole treasury in my hand.

"These coins will be yours," I say and he looks up at me with joy on his face, "When you tell me more about yourself." Jasper frowns and tries to snatch the coins from my hand but I pull them away. "Uh-uh. Now... how did you end up here?"

He bit his bottom lip and whispered softly, almost to softly, "My mom forgot about me and I was hungry. I left the house and when I went back there was a lock on the door." I drop a coin into his tin.

"Why did she forget about you/" I ask him.

"She forgets a lot of things when she is doing drugs." Clink. Another coin. Half an hour later, Jasper now has all my coins and I have learnt so much about him.

"I'm out of money for now Jasper, but will you do me a favor?" I ask him, and he rattles his tin and shows so much surprise to how much money he has, "Will you be here tomorrow. I'll come back with more coins." He coughed heavily and then nodded his head. "Go and get some dinner okay?"

I felt bad, leaving him there alone but I was off to my night-job and couldn't take him with me. I hoped he was there in the morning so I could help him again.

He wasn't.
14331.title: Child

143311.content:
Death befalls the child in the night
as a cough led him to pneumonia
his sweet innocent eyes will blink no more
He will lie in repose all alone
His spirit is in Heaven, I know in my heart
the child all alone lying in the dark
but his body so frail and oh so pale
is not the child whom I know
He is with Jesus and His father God
I know he will not know any further suffering
He will only know love and warmth
He will know freedom unlike any we could imagine.
He is now loved for his gentle soul.
143311.title: death comes quickly

14332.content:
There was once, an azure blue dragon,
carrying refreshing waves of burden,
But now its slain - it is no more,
what remains are institutes of lore.

There was once, a sea of green,
carrying life - of beauty and serene,
But now its drained - its disappeared,
what remains are tombs of the endeared.

There was once, a never-ending field of blue,
carrying pillows of silver hues,
But now its trampled - its hidden from view,
what remains is contaminated dew.

There was once a world of bloom,
carrying nature, life and promise,
But now its dying - damned and doomed,
can we save it? - our one true wish?
14332.title: Nature

143321.content:
It's a Life or Death situation we have here folks, nobody gets out of this world alive. Some say, give me liberty or give me Death, live free or Die, Death before dishonor, Death be not proud, et cetera, but in all their pompous pride and glory do they really mean it? Do they, really?

Pride comes before a fall, and as we all know, the ultimate fall is Death. A well known politician of his time once told us, "We have nothing to fear but fear Itself," but what about Death? Don't most of us fear Death more than Fear Itself?

Why do we fear it so, why not accept the inevitable? After all, as that wise old alien sage once said in a galaxy far, far away, " Death is a natural part of life, rejoice for those around you who transform into The Force."

As for me, I take comfort in the words of wisdom penned by a somewhat obscure west coast alternative rock band based on a quote from Italian playwright Luigi Pirandello: "As soon as you're born you start dying, so you might as well have a good time..."
143321.title: Death

1433211.content:
we always used to claim
that, being young,
time was on our side

promises were made and kept,
made and forgotten

we played roulette
with life and love and lovers,
knowing in the end we would always win

the deck was stacked in our favor
we were new to the world and powerful
full of life
invincible

and we always said we'd stay this way forever,
our tiger blood would never fade away,
always stay strong

I guess we lied
1433211.title: Time is on Our Side

14332112.content:
The splatter of raindrops.
The splashes that constantly broke my train of thoughts.
Forceful intruders that disturbed me as I intend to seek solace from my memories.

Yet again, I could only sigh.
What can I do? What do I have?
Youth? Energy? Time?
Those are not on my checklist.

Just yesterday, I visited one of my friends with fresh, white Chrysanthemums. As I glanced at her usual pale face, I knew that I would be greeted like this by other people sooner or later.

I stared outside the window. Rain is falling down. Pit pat pit pat.
Like that mechanical clock that hanged at the wall. Tick tack tick tack.

Life, is a countdown.
I knew that a long time ago. I knew that when I saw my friend.
But I just can't accept it.
I guess people like me are not ready to leave. Because I have had so many memories and emotions tied down to my life.
Tightly. That I do not know when to let go.
So tight that the truth; the ways of this world...
I am not able to accept.

The rain continues to get heavier.
More dark clouds clustered.
It is natural to see a rainbow after a heavy rain.
But. I don't plan to see any.
Let the rain continue to get heavier.
Maybe then I would get a little better.
14332112.title: The Rains Fall

1433212.content:
Forever creeping towards the black devoid
We reach for hope a calming balm
Set our eyes on everything else
Ignorant of this black devoid
Where are we going?
Most of us run away but some stay
Accept that any day might be the day
So live life for the future
Not for them but those they tutored
All we have is lineage
Family is the end
And death is just the beginning
So set your mind and spread your creed
Find a match to plant the seed
Live for them and fear has no need
1433212.title: What's on the Other Side?

14332122.content:
I didn't know how to control it, it was an accident. I didn't mean to kill them. I had no control over my body and I was angry. I was running away from the police, I heard the cop cars coming closer. My adrenaline was kicking in, I could hear my heart pounding through my ears. My legs were throbbing but I had to keep running. Then one of the cars came in front of me, they police got out and pointed guns at me. I turned around to run the other way but there were cars surrounding me. Everywhere I turned I saw guns pointing at me.
"It was an accident!" I cried.
"I understand if you come with me, Lauren, then we will help you not hurt you." a police officer said through bullhorn. He stepped closer to me but I used my powers. According to the people giving me test, my power is that i have angry issues and when I trigger them claws come out of my fingers and I can't control myself. He stepped closer to me and grabbed my arm.
"Let go!" I yelled. My eyes turned red and I felt my claws coming out. The next thing I knew his blood was all over my hands and he was lying dead in front of me. He was covered in claw marks. It was an accident!
14332122.title: Destruction

143321222.content:
I am red with anger,
the heat swells me.
I have contempt for the laws
that leave you here to make
others suffer. You have
taken a life, yet you remain free
you are a monster
a killer,
you went on a murderous spree.
There is little I can do to remove myself
from hate. You run the roads, free to
attack again, to maim or kill
you are a dweller of the underground,
a demon straight from hell.
may your body whither
and bring you low.
May you suffer as you caused
much suffering.
Hate! is not really in my heart,
but revenge is my mind set.
should you find yourself around
me I will do what I can to repay
you for the murderous rampage
you are responsible for.
My blood boils.
My face frowns.
My pulse races.
My heart breaks.
And I hate you.
You are he who has killed.

Harbouring dark judgements, seething with rage

Trembling and tightly clawing inside creating barriers
Eliminating all pathways to peace
1433212221.title: hate

A nxiety with a edge of dread

Guts wrenching as you rise

Travelling a roller coaster.
143322.title: Angst

1433221.content:
I see the streaks of light at night
it reminds me of when I was a child
I'd catch a firefly and place it in a jar

Oh how lovely the streaks can be
I love to watch them don't you see
fire flies in the sky
make me feel like I am flying high
because I loved to be a child
and they remind me that she's still there

As we Traveled the long road from Mississippi to Kentucky each summer I recall the night being so black that you could not see any thing in front of your face. But I recall the lovely little fireflies that darted around in the sky. They were so unique I thought.
my sister and I would fight over who would catch one first because Daddy would stop around Georgia or Tennessee and let us girls get out to catch them. We would have a ball, we giggled like the children we were.
My sister was the oldest and I the baby she always caught the first firefly and then she would remove the end of it where the light shined and it was florescent she rubbed it on her skin to glow in the dark and it did I recall. Oh the trips we take ...
1433221.title: fireflies

14333.content:
Trapped in an environment of cruelty
Tortured by my memories
Treated like garbage
Terrified of what I am to become

I wonder how this could have played out differently.
I thought that I would never be seen in this place.
I never knew that I would bring shame upon my name.
I never would have thought that my girl would put me HERE.

Recalling the night when it began, I had been
Recovering from an illness when I had decided to
Return to my girlfriend's apartment.
Really? Three days away and a different guy in her bed?

No time to think
Nor to calm myself down
Next minute I know, the guy she is next to is dead.
No one believed my side of the story.

Why would I have killed him
When I am a pacifist
When I am 99% sure he died from an asthma attack
When I never bought a gun from this state?

They blamed it on me.
They should have never listened to my girl.
Telling me to live up to something I never did,
Their evidence of a bullet matching a gun with my fingerprints on it...

And my girlfriend being a forensic scientist could have easily framed me
Avoiding the trauma of reliving the moment,
Apparently nothing can make me forget her.

All I want from this messed up world:

Is my freedom and for her to have wanted me as I had wanted her
It should not be a hard thing to achieve
I knew I should not have fell in love because
I wanted to be free

But now I am in these chains of misery and with no body to love
14333.title: Freedom

144.content:
Crystals, that is what I see, as I think about going. I point them out to him, the glints, as a deluge hits.

They come as a way to re-direct, the way light is changed by a prism. A raindrop as a smooth crystal, the thought of rain washes into hius heart. It washes everything, including everything wooden. Will it be degraded by water? Initially, it looks shiny and wet, but there are mushrooms, and mold. Glints come with so much glare, he must be getting Vitamin D from looking.

The poor guy had Seasonal Defective Disorder. Glare on wet, and he's distracted. Not hungry, he starts to think about dry.
144.title: Polyanna

14412.content:
What is my destiny?

It is a question asked by many. Pursued by many. But, does anyone truly know? Some claim they do. They say they can read your destiny, your future. Claim that it is written in the cards, or the tea leaves. Is your destiny that tangible? So physical that it can be seen or known. Maybe, our destiny is inside each of us. It can't be prophesized, or guessed at, but shows itself in small ways. It shows itself through what we do, how we treat others, by how hard we try. Many try to find it. Some do not succeed. Others find it in places they least expect. But everyone's destiny is there. Some just have yet to find it.
14412.title: Destiny

1442.content:
bananas, rice, applesauce, and toast: This is what Darell had for breakfast as he walked through the busy streets of New York. It was so packed that someone bumped into him, knocking his food to the ground.
"No one destroys my breakfast!" he said. "No one!"
He saw the woman that knocked over his breakfast. "Hey lady!" he said. "Pick up my breakfast!" Everyone was yelling at him because he was in everyone's way.
"No," she said.
"Listen, lady, if you don't pick up my breakfast--" he showed her a gun. She was terrified. "Please don't--"
"Sir, if you don't leave her alone--" a female jogger said.
Darell suddenly took out a knife and stabbed the jogger in her chest, puncturing her heart.
He then shot the lady that knocked over his breakfast. People were shocked at the scene and ran for their lives.
"I told you to pick up my bananas, rice, applesauce, and toast, but you didn't, now did you! And now look at you!" he said.
THE MORAL IS: DON'T MESS WITH DARELL'S BREAKFAST
1442.title: bananas, rice, applesauce, and toast

14422.content:
Jackson was my next door neighbour that would always be getting into trouble. Big trouble. He would take illegal drugs such as cocaine and sell them for money. I knew it was the wrong thing to do but I didn't want to be a snitch so I just ignored him hoping that he would stop. Unfortunately, his habit only just got worse as he threatened people for money just to satisfy his drug addiction. If only I knew what was going to happen then I would've gotten some help. Except I didn't so I just kept ignoring. As he was gradually getting more and more violent, it was hard for me to keep on ignoring it so I got help but it was too late.

Jackson had already murdered someone and was facing life in jail.

If only I was brave enough to get help earlier...
14422.title: Jackson

144221.content:
Never more than today has the cliché, "hind-sight is 20-20," been so crystal clear. So many times after one of
Jackson's coca-maniacal episodes I had my hand on the phone and even partially dialed for help. I couldn't do it.
It seemed to me that would only make matters worse. I couldn't have been more wrong.

It was just one day after he spent two hours with a shotgun and flashlight looking for an imaginary (paranoid-hallucination)
coca-man just out of his visual range. hiding under his house. It would have been funny without the shotgun. I like to think if he had fired off a round, I would have called. Eventually he calmed down and I just added it to long and getting longer list of Jackson and his growing monkey spiraling ever deeper into their personal theatre of madness.
The monkey on his back demanded to be fed. It was the day after I'd watched, peeking through my curtains, his frantic search for pieces of his mind the coca-man had turned to grey mush, that he murdered who he was robbing. Witnesses said he pulled the young man out of his house in broad daylight screaming, " I told you to stay away from me, I warned you," while stabbing his uncomprehending and now dead, victum, long after the poor young man's lifeless eyes glazed over. The occupant was no longer in residence.

The word if and saying, I wish, fit into the hindsight is 20-20 category. You see had I made just one of the calls to stop Jackson's rampages, I would be alive today. I was the young man being slaughtered in the front yard of his own house. The witnesses just watched as I had done myself in the past. What could they do?
144221.title: Regrets
