How does one answer that? " Oh yea, I understand!" "It is what it is, no more and no less. Gotcha covered." It's as clear as mud.
Moses asked God who shall I tell them that ask who you are? God says," Tell them I am that I am". That I can get but when you put these two together it is a bit much.
I am that I am and it is what it is. What it is is what it is! So what is it? It's what it is! It is what it is and I am that I am, He is what He is and They are what they are and a boy is a boy and a girl is a girl. A noun is a noun and there is no further need for a dictionary because we will define words now by themselves. Who am I? I am who I am. Who are you? You're going to have to figure that one out for yourself, I'm at a loss but I can tell you,"it is what it is and that is all it is, isn't it? Heh heh....
1511112.title: It is what it is

151112.content: "We hit the enemy with everything we had. I am pleased to say that we didn't lose any of our brave knights in this horrific battle. The teamwork was perfect. It may have taken several days but it is over. We finally have the undead army on the run."
151112.title: Run

15112.content:
The ghost walks down the corridors.
I hear an unseen clatter come towards me,
and I know death is in the room with me.
As all honourable warriors would,
I drew was sword.
A true warrior dies in battle.

My sword glistens as I fight with death,
a greatsword smacks into a sycthe,
that slices it in half.
As I kick death consumes me and I stare into his eyes.

I do not die in battle.
I die of a mortal wound.
The valkyries do not come.
I die alone
I become death too
A true warrior dies in battle always
15112.title: the unseen

15113.content:
I was painting the baseboards for the rental my husband and I were preparing for our new tenants. The color was a chocolate raspberry, a color that made me happy and each brush stoke was done with care. The day was gorgeous and I had opted to do my chore under a huge elm in the back yard. I spent my day painting and humming and praying and thinking. Sixteen boards were about to get a second coat.

At first I heard the sweet cooing song and then I heard an answer, a different voice in a different direction. I looked around to see if I could spot the lovely couple, but they were nowhere in sight. Painting, painting. Again, he called to her and she answered and for a long time I was serenaded with the love calls. Painting, painting.

Humming quietly to myself and enjoying the sunshine, suddenly I realized there was only one voice. I scanned the nearby trees and telephone wires and then quite unexpectedly there was a flutter in my peripheral vision. There on the fence, not 10 feet from where I stood, was Mr. Dove. I've never had a conversation with a bird, but today it seemed a very appropriate thing to do. He sat there cooing and then I would answer. I didn't coo; I spoke English. He must have liked it because he stayed about 20 minutes, the two of us having a wonderful conversation of cooing and English and cooing and humming and cooing and painting, painting.

The boards are painted and the tenants have moved in. Autumn has arrived and I haven't seen Mr. Dove since that summer afternoon. He gave me quite and unexpected gift, one I shall treasure. I listen carefully for the dove's call when I am outdoors hoping he'll come back someday to finish the conversation.
15113.title: dove

1512.content:
She was not a pyromaniac. And she did not like pyromaniacs. She had had a boyfriend who was one, once. Well, not really; she had dated a boy who had become a pyromaniac after she had moved away and dumped him. Maybe that didn't count. He barely counted as a boyfriend. She didn't think about him.

She was thinking about him now.

But that didn't count, either. She was only thinking about him because she was staring into the fire, eyes glazed over, thinking of nothing. Nothing but the fire. Which naturally made her think of him.

He hadn't been a real boyfriend. He never wanted to do anything, never wanted to go anywhere... He mostly just complimented her. Which might not have been so bad, she thought in retrospect. And he had been awfully sweet, on occasion. When it was so far below freezing that night - New Year's Eve - he had offered her his coat and his arms, to keep her warm. He had barely known her.

Maybe he wasn't a pyromaniac anymore. Maybe it didn't matter if he was. The flame was nice, now that she thought about it.

She pulled out her cellphone. Dialed. "Greg?"

The fire blazed on.
1512.title: The Fire

15121.content:
A shot of whisky was handed over to the town sheriff as shots of gunfire raged on in the streets below. A gang of banditos have raided the old desert town and every man, woman and child bonded together to save their community. Like a lady's scream, the sound of the bullets being fired from their containers travelled in all directions within a few seconds. Each bullet gave cue to a loud man's cry of pain - in one minute, 12 people died where they stood, on the sand.

The battle raged on for what seemed like a day, until the sheriff came down and ordered the fighting to stop. It didn't. One final blast exploded from a person's gun and the missile pierced through the sheriff's head, through his brain.
15121.title: Gunfire

151212.content: ... and it starts quietly, whispers in back alleys and midnight dens, and grows to the muttering at the speeches of regurgitated party line. One man shouts in the crowd and is dragged off, and then it's whispers again, but whispers like snowflakes moving over each other, in their thousands and millions becoming an avalanche. Then it explodes. Shouting slogans on the capitol steps, flags snapping and popping in the crisp breeze, and the rumble of tanks advancing down the cobbled streets. A revolution is screams, screams of those dying for their beliefs and those trying not to die for their beliefs, and the screams of those who want to be free but are too terrified to take a stand. The winner of the fight isn't the one with the bigger guns or the crueler tortures; it the one with the loudest voice.
151212.title: Revolution

1512121.content:
The other guardians had fallen like dominoes before our combined strength. However the man before us seems different. He's known as 'Electric Doom'. I'm not quite sure if that's due to some sort of electric powers or just an electric personality. Either way, this shouldn't be a very difficult battle.

BZZZZT!
"No! They got Marle!"

Hm... well the 'Electric Doom' name seems to apply to his powers, not his personality. I didn't realize electricity could turn someone to a pile of ashes like that. And moreover, how did he get the power of electricity? I thought wielding fire was cool, but he seems to have me beat on the coolness scale.

"John! For crying out loud, stop daydreaming and help us fight!!"
1512121.title: Electric Doom

15122.content:
Greg was not a pyromaniac. Greg did not like pyromaniacs. He had a girlfriend once who thought everyone she dumped became a pyromaniac. But she barely counted as a girlfrind. He didn't think about her.

He was thinking about her now.

But that didn't count, either. He was only thinking about her because he was staring into the fire, eyes glazed over, thinking of nothing. Nothing but the fire. Which naturally made him think of her and her insane tendency to believe everyone she dumped was a pyromaniac.

She hadn't been a real girlfriend. She never wanted to just be alone with him. She always wanted to "go somewhere", to "do something". He wanted her to like him enough to at least be friends. He complimented her as much as he could. He did little things for her. When it was below freezing on New Year's Eve he offered her his coat and his arms, to keep her warm, but she flinched away from his touch.

Maybe she wasn't crazy anymore. Maybe it didn't matter if she was. The flame was nice, now that he thought about it.

His phone rang. He took another swig from his bottle of Nyquill. It didn't matter if he answered it or not... but he did. The familiar voice on the other end said, "Greg?"

He almost said something, but instead quietly hung up the phone and just sat there for a moment gazing at the crackling flames.

The bottle of Nyquill by his side glittered with reflected firelight.
15122.title: Nyquill

151221.content:
The house stood there. A shell of what it formerly had been.

There was once a family living inside it's walls, but not now. It often wondered what had become of them. Houses shouldn't wonder such things, but even still, this one wondered.

The fire had worked it's way into the house's structure, licking the paint off the walls revealing the bricks beneath them. It breathed on the glass of the windows with hot, squirming flames, melting them and letting the flames breathe the air on the outside, giving them a renewed vigour.

The house remembered when it was built. It was an ordinary dull day when it had been finished, there was a light breeze teasing the trees into batting it's limbs at it. The sun wasn't visible, but it was by no means a sad day, there were shouts coming from the nearest park, shouts of children that picked up the spirits of all who walked by.

Sirens blared in the distance now. They were ugly noises, but a necessary evil nonetheless. The house accepted it's fate, and it's disintegration continued.
151221.title: Disintegration

1512211.content:
I wasn’t convinced at first, but at the last moment I changed my mind. As it turned out, many others did too.

Initially it seemed like the right decision. He started out by assembling a team of knowledgeable advisers and he let them do most of the talking. They played nice and when that didn’t work they played hardball. It ended the gridlock on the Hill, you had to cooperate with what he wanted or you’d risk being ripped to shreds on Twitter.

Lots of jobs were created, especially in that big construction project down South. The manufacturing jobs started coming back too, after the tariffs were in place. And the cheap oil continued to flow. Yes, those were the boom times.

Then he and Vladimir had a falling out. Don’t know how it started, but we all know how it ended.

Luckily I’m the paranoid type. Once I saw the first rumblings in the press I packed up the Jeep and headed to our old family cabin; it’s way upstate, near the Canadian border. Stopped by a little military surplus store I spotted on the way and picked up all the rations they had in stock, plus a bunch of iodine tablets.

I checked the Geiger counter this morning, levels seem to be holding steady. Not great, but not enough to kill me. Not having any luck getting any news on the shortwave, just some crazy preacher talking about the end of times.

I sure wish things could go back to the way they were in 2016. In hindsight, I guess electing him President wasn’t such a good idea.
1512211.title: Hindsight

1512212.content:
"Take it." The voice said.

The pill now sits in your hands awaiting fate. The open bottle it from which it voyaged looks like a hungry mouth. Wordlessness fills the air and the drug gets heavier as it lays there now. A refreshing glass of water awaits, the control. The pills reaches towards the mouth, pulling your palm with it. It disappears deep inside, hidden away. The water is drunk and you become refreshed. New games to try your hand at. Thoughts write themselves down like silent students. You look beyond the mirror in front. It's depth is ambiguous. The brain is itching, and you think of stimulation for relief. you find it but have only scratched the surface. You slow down as it speeds up in an opportune way, but time doesn't exist. Everything is clear.
1512212.title: Foresight

15122121.content: Everyday he awaits fate. The constant battle has left him weathered and hardened. He carries both the gun and the flashlight, pictures of his past tucked away in his back pocket. His aim is practiced and his march is unhindered. The fatigues he wears offer little protection. They make him a walking target. He will not die in vain, no matter how painful it may be.
15122121.title: Martyrdom

15123.content:
My life has never felt more plain; nothing is happening, everything I tried to do ended up failing, and all of my goals are at a stand-still. It's like unflavored chapstick; you try one way, hoping there will be some flavor or excitement, but it ends up being plain and dead.
I clicked on the browser on my computer and looked up some classifieds. I needed to find some way to pay my rent that month, and every where I turned was just unflavored chapstick. I answered an advertisement online, it was about a writing contest. My eyes widened and all of my writing expertise flowed back into my head. My back straightened and my brain overflowed with ideas.
For once, I had struck some cherry chapstick.
15123.title: Unflavored chapstick

151231.content:
“Welcome! I’m Tom, so glad to meet you! And you are?”

“I’m Darren Baxter, and this is my wife Sandra. Nice to meet you too.”

“Tell me Darren, what made you decide to come here today?”

“Well, we’ve both been into VR for a long time now, I mean, why go through the inconvenience of flying and staying in hotels when you can experience traveling anywhere in the world from the comfort of your home at the flick of a switch, right?”

“So true, Darren. And if you think about it, we started down this path a long time ago. Even back in your grandparents days, most people decided it was better to watch the game on their 65” Samsung than it was to go to a stadium and fight the crowds. VR was just the next step, and this is the final one. So, are you two ready to make the leap?”

“Not quite, Tom. Darren and I have a few questions first.”

“Of course, Mrs Baxter. I’ll be glad to address any concerns you have.”

“First of all, what if we decide we really don’t like it?”

“No problem, the process can be reversed at any time within the first thirty days.”

“What about after thirty days?”

“After that, the physiological and psychological changes you will incur make it difficult if not impossible to leave. I will say that we have very high retention rate though, only .01% people actually decide to leave within the first thirty days, and I have not heard of anyone wishing to leave after that since I’ve been here. Any other questions? Darren?”

“Yes, can we go see where the long term residents stay?”

“Unfortunately no, due to personal privacy concerns. But you will be able to speak to them, once you are inside. Anything else?”

“No, I guess I’m satisfied. How about you Sandy?”

“No, I’m good. Let’s do it!”

“OK then. You two just follow Annie to your docking station, and before you know it she'll have you hooked up and you’ll be enjoying your amazing new virtual life! Welcome to the Matrix!"
151231.title: The Days of Happiness

151232.content:
I cried.

I stared at our old family portrait, trying to hold back the tears. I ran out of the picture and Mum chased me. I smiled a bit, but still felt the heart-ache of losing mum.
"Mum...why you? Why?" Everything changed after she passed. Dad never smiled. I remember me on stage, dancing as best as I could.
Soon after I finished, I ran to him... expecting him to say to a little 8 year old "I'm so proud of you!". Instead I got a sad, dissapointed frown.

My family broke. I guess Nothing lasts that long anymore.
Soon I will join her. Goodbye dad. Maybe you will join me and mum soon.
151232.title: Broken Family

choices: "Don't get your bollocks in a twist."
1513.content:
"Breath-taking."
         I could not for the life of me understand why he was commenting on the view. "What?"
         "Breath-taking." He turned to me with a look that I really did not like. "The next phase of your training."
         "Oh, right. One of those mystic things," I said.
         "You are too flippant," my teacher said crossly. "I begin to think you will never be serious enough for this."
         "You begin to think?" I chuckled. "Man, I'd be pretty sure that was obvious."
         "Shut up. You babble when you are nervous and I do not need it." My teacher directed a glare at me. I ducked my head meekly. "Now. Breath-taking. You will need this skill in order to harvest the dead properly. It is..." He paused, frowning. "You take their last breath from them, and with it, their life. With it should also come their soul. You become... a pathway..."
         "I don't quite get it," I said, laying on some extra Humble Padawan in case he was still tetchy.
         "It is a sophisticated concept indeed. Perhaps this will help..." He reached out one spidery hand and placed his fingers on my temples.
         "Oh, cra--" Here we went again. I hated when he did this. It was so disorienting. Wavering at first, but getting stronger, the memory faded into focus.
         Dark. Wet surfaces. Cold. Shaking-- convulsive, grip and stutter. Heat draining down the grille in the sidewalk, red life heat. And he was sliding up the street like a mist toward the twitching, gut-shot form, hesitating, assessing. Balanced invisibly over the body, cobra twist of the head before he settled himself, long hands spreading reaching into the air. He wasn't a body now, he was a force, the essence of himself, although I dimly realized that he was moving in reality. Moving up to the sweat-damp face, curling round the edges of the lips. Breaths. In, out. In-- out. Inout.Inoutinout. And yes, it was nearly time, the mist touched the lips, brushed them, covered them and as the last sodden hack of air began to move, held it, coaxed it, midwifed it, pulled it through the gateway, through itself and beyond, with a gut-deep wrench I felt even outside the memory. The mist quivered, twisted itself luxuriously into the body whose breath it had just taken. Blackness and numbness beyond cold slowly filled the bones and veins; the last spark left behind flickered in panic. Deep in it, I thought, yes, I understand now, this is what it is to take breaths and have them taken. So dark...
         So dark... so cold...
         Ice. Black.
***

         Death, Destroyer of Worlds, shook himself out of his remembrances. Guiltily, he dropped the body of his apprentice and jumped back. "Oh, damn..." He pulled his cell phone out of his pocket. "Igor? Page one of the other Horsemen, will you? I need another-- Oh. How did you ever guess?"
         "Couldn't thay, thur," said the tinny voice on the other end.
1513.title: Breath-Taking

choices: A grandma carrying a jars of eyeballs.
A  hairy hairless cat in the ditch next to a woman dressed as a witch.
15131.content:
For the life of me I could not understand why I almost dropeed dead after the phone call. It is not what I expected when I was listening to that tiny voice It was entrancing and I was stuck in a void of time for a minute or two before my legs gave out. I fell to the floor shivering as if I had been in the freezer. What had this voice said to me. I couldn't remember a word they said. I felt this strong urge to get up and run for the door.

I looked around to see if anyone was here. I stumbled to my feet a little dizzy and darted for the door. I got outside and too my surprise the snow was almost up to the door. A storm must had blown in while I was outside of my mind. I get a few feet away from the door and I saw incoming snow bombs. They were just really large snowballs but I knew the crooked individuals in this town loaded large snowballs with nails and rocks and launced them from giant sling shots hidden in the woods across the streets. I had to get out of here and fast. I jump on my hovercraft and zipped down the street fast as I could. Boom! A large studded snowball crashes right in from of my snowmobile and makes the thing wobbles and turn over on its side. Next thing you know I am on the ground covered in snow and watching the snow turn red with blood.

I checked my sefl for injuries and though I was sore from the crash I saw cuts from the blood to be coming from. Then I looked around me and you wouldn't believe what I saw...
15131.title: Drop dead!

151311.content:
In an instant I wondered if I might have taken too much of my daily prescribed medication. There have been days when I have indeed done such a thing and the effects are strange, like mild visual distortions or a flash of illogical fears. So naturally I thought that I had over medicated when I saw a grandma carrying a jar of eyeballs down the adjacent apartment alley way. The alley way was only used for one thing and that was to deposit garbage in the bins located at the end. She slowly walked down the brick walkway and lifted the black dumpster lid, carefully placing the jar deep down in the bin, turned and walked back towards the street.
Honestly! The jar looked like it was filled with eyeballs. Whitish balls, each one with a circle of color in the middle. Natural colors, with a dot of black in the middle of each and so what else on earth looked like this? Only eyeballs. There was no questioning it first off. They were eyeballs and she was transporting a jar of them.. to the trash. Was there a clinic nearby? If so, and if she worked for that clinic, wouldn't there be a proper way to dispose of such things? Wouldn't she be dressed more medically appropriate rather than the rounded floor length skirt, peasant shirt and apron? I couldn't honestly say that she was indeed a grandma but she certainly fit the stereotype. And as I recall, she herself was wearing the thickest pair of spectacles I have seen to date. Something was wrong here.

I decided to follow her, making mental note of the number on the trash bin (3 out of 13) at it's location. She took a left out of the alley and walked 4 blocks south. The door she opened without a key was not that of a clinic but seemingly of a residence. As she opened the door she brushed her feet on the mat, stepped in and started to shut the door behind her. Well, at first, she did shut it but then she opened it again and left it cracked open. I stood there, across the street mind you, watching that front door, wondering who she had left it cracked for.

Slowly I saw for whom she had left the door open for.
151311.title: A grandma carrying a jars of eyeballs.

choices: Knock and ask to see the cat.
Maintain surveillance when I come back
1513111.content:
There was movement low to the ground. From the right a cat came down the sidewalk, its nose held high.

As it got closer I saw that its eyelids had been sewn shut. I thought about the eyeballs and wondered if any of them would fit this cat.

The idle speculation stopped when the cat walked through the doorway. Granny came back and shut the door after looking me straight in the eye.
1513111.title: Blind Cat

15131111.content:
Well, I was stuck in that spot for quite a while. Unable to make a decision about anything much less what I wanted to do next. I have a soft spot for cats, I must admit, and my heart flipped at the sight of that deformed creature. But, was it really deformed? Yes! With eyes sewn shut, who would've done that? I didn't doubt for a minute that it was that granny. Yet the cat walked in willingly and the granny, just before she locked her eyes to mine, looked down with such tenderness toward the returning feline that surely she was cruel to this animal. Perhaps she was a safe refuge for this cat and others like it. Perhaps she was the ultimate nurturer for such crazy fates.. such as sewn eyelids! Who was I to judge?

So, guess what? I went for it and with butterflies in my chest I knocked rhythmically on the door. I thought for a moment that the rhythmic knock would indicate a friendly visit but then thought that perhaps it sounded creepy, so friendly and unannounced. Granny had to know who it was though. She was just looking at me.
I wasn't going to knock again- I was filled with self doubt. The door cracked open an inch and I didn't see anyone there. It was dim and there was a faint breeze coming from inside and it smelled like lavender. Oddly drawn to this I came closer to the crack and said "May I see the cat?". No answer. As my eyes got adjusted to the dimness I focused in on a rocking chair. A pillow upon the chair held the cat with the sewn eyelids but this time the cat had his eyes wide open. Although this could've been any other cat I was so certain it was the exact same cat. I made the little noises I tend to make when trying to get the attention of animals. Something like a "tsk" and a clicking with my tongue. The cat was staring straight at me, and I kid you not, he rolled his eyes! What nerve! I was speechless at the sight and I furrowed my brow. Stupid uppity cat.

"Oh dear, don't mind him please. He has no social skills to speak of." Granny stated as she came into view. She a smile on her face and as she leaned over to pet the cat, he rolled his massively round and green eyes again and looked directly at me. "Would you like to come in?" Granny asked.
15131111.title: May I see the cat?

choices: She comes  back holding the jar of eyeballs
She comes back holding what I think is the jar  of eyeballs
151311111.content:
...and put one foot in front of the other, entering the house, while my mind was clamoring to get out!

The door closed behind me and the sound near spooked me out of my skin! I whirled, thinking about the crack of doom and tried to relax.

"It was just another door," I thought to myself "Relax. Nobody's going to hurt you. It's just an old woman and a cat, for heaven's sake!"

It didn't help. I had been jumpy from the moment I laid eyes on that creepy woman and now I blurted out the last thing I should have said. "What were you planning to do with that jar?"

Her eyes narrowed, "So, you've been watching me that long, eh?"

"The jar is going to stay where I put it until I'm ready to fetch it," she added. I looked at her and thought, "How loopy can a person be?"
151311111.title: I looked straight into Granny's eyes---

1513112.content:
It wasn't curiousity that got me in the situation I'm in! Though I am naturally curious,
it has never been a prime motivating factor, compelling me to alter or make my decision on
the basis of satisfying it's hungar. It can't be satisfyed or at least my beasts! What is the word?
Insatiable!
How does one turn curiosity off? If a question is answered another mystery takes it's place!
It's like those old Carosel slide projecters. The colored slides were placed in a round cannister like a Thompson Machine Gun's (Tommy Gun) ammunition position. I used to set a full carosel, fifty photos,
and end up going around and around until the hypnotic effect of the light, the material I was viewing and the cadence repetitions. Now that I think of it, that may have subliminaly established or created a revolving
door allowing curiosity free rein to operate like breathing and our heart beating.
Curiosity, like some women can be caty and crafty, even round-about and misdirection if necessary to finish the race. I like that! That's probably why curiousity sits in the back seat and surfing, sailing, scuba and free diving, fishing, spinnaker flying, even walking on the beach sand are priorities. While in the operation of these reasons for living, curiousity is like a kid in a candy store, almost tearing himself apart as he tries to
go the four opposing points on a compass simultaneously! Then, almost shuts down from the sensory overlord.
We both know that was all me. I file things on a shelf. (in my head) Two deep breaths I'm myself again. Back on the bridge, retaking the helm, driving the vessel with my crew, going anywhere I want to.
The actual baited hook, I didn't see at first. The chum brought me to the trap and had I not been so inside myself working on a solution to a problem I had never encountered before, it wouldn't have worked. I wanted to buy all the eyes she could get her hands on but for the life of me had never known anyone who had them for sail.
To be frank, it is only two weeks ago an oriental buddy of mine from Pendleton: went to Nam together Bumped into each other at the Apothecaries Shop near the pier. Hadn't seen him for a year. While catching up he dropped the eye bomb! Boom! I didn't bat an eye or even ask him why he needed eyes, human eyes! While he was explaining his very weird request he mentioned what the opthmologist was paying. While saying our Aloha's I assured Kim Chee that I would do my best but not to hold his breath as it was unexplored terrain and hadn't a clue where go was on this gameboard or how to play it.
Usually, I just read the directions but I was relatively certain this was a game with no board or rules and was played one time only by the players. There were three major life-changing possible outcomes and I'd bet the odds were just about even on the three biggies: Prison, the Big Empty or the gold ring and ownership of Life's Merry-G0-Round. Worldly people know when something isn't right or doesn't fit into the equation, it doesn't just sound like a lie it is one! Warning claxons are telling this submarine to dive but I just had to prove," He who hesitates is lost!" I was thinkng ( that was my first mistake) it couldn't hurt to recog a little, see what made eyes the original owner had no use for worth more than The Star Of India?
I've hunted and been hunted by humans. It was their turf not mine. The VC had already fought a first World Country and won, humbling France, evicting all frogs and recovering their country from foriegn control only to be replaced by septic tanks ( Yanks). I fought hard but to this day haven't a clue why we were there and what we hoped to accomplish. It took me a month before I knew we were in some deep s&%$! They were fully prepared, trained on the job, not at rehersal, dug in is an understatement. What I saw, if someone tried to tell me, I would have called them a liar! Bottom line. It took me quite awhile to find out we were playing from pages of the same rule book. I wasn't surprised but they were. I surprised the life out of them. In the bush, there are no surprises! Let me rephrase that. As a boonie rat there is only one surprise. The VC wrote the book on Guerilla Jungle Warfare. I was to far in-country with far to many irons in the fire to find the time to edit and publish, adding a new chapter to their jungle book. We did make sure the personel that could make use of it were informed. I know and the others like me know, when someone gives you good advice, take it. Two tours and I was back in the World. That was a surprise I can live with! The VC I surprised are in the agricultural industry. They make great fertilizer.
1513112.title: Myself  (part 1)

choices: The disquised eyeholder and her two mystery men
the Earth Killer closed his purse!
15131121.content:
I was just starting to walk across the street when the disquised eye bearer zipped inside the house and shut the door. All I wanted to know was the price she would sell her eyes for. I was in the middle of the street, indicisive, stalled, when the door opended but just free of the striker plate.
This is the baited hook which I went for. Behind the door was the rest of it; line and sinker. They reeled me in and might have caught a sardine. There were three of them counting the wandering eye holder. I was not in the World any longer! This was no flashback either, me back in the Nam! I was a dolphin. My mate and pup, our entire family trapped with a purse seiner's catch, already lifted from the sea is when I, in the blinking of an eye, returned! What returned was not what had left! I've been in a tight spot or three but it was just me. Never have I felt anything comparable to what was filling every fiber of me with a hyper-awareness, time had become slow motion. I was sensing the intentions and movements of everything around me, even behind me where I could not see. yet, I could see? The dolphin's rage, frustration and a hopelessness and futility left me stripped clean, devoid of any human mercy or restraint for I was not human. This was to the death for myself,my wife and child who were together, crying and dying, already dead the moment the Earth Killer closed his purse!
The robber baron pursre seiners are worse than the long liners and neither are or should ever be refered to as fishermen! Take fish out of the word and while you're there grab men too! What's left is what they are and should be called," ER"! They combined, are depleting fish populations to extinction! They know and don't care!
Are they stupid or insane? Two choices. Not only are they bringing forth in the near, forseeable future. Oceans with nothing in them, just like an empty fish tank! Their unbrideled greed will be the cause of their redundantcy! Where will anyone with his limited skills find work? He's killing himself and to ignorant to see it!
I think ERROR is a perfect fit.
The disquised eyeholder and her two mystery men were federal special investigaters on a fishing expedition for one man in particular selling stolen body parts to a wide variety of people who needed them for scientific research. The eyes were the bait and had caught the shark already. His apointment is for four. I came in while they were still in the process of setting up the sting. I didn't tell them they had also caught a dolphin. They didn't need to know, ever.
I didn't find any of this out until I was able to revive them. I had rendered them unconscious brfore one word was said. The shorter of the two was reaching............for his badge, I found out later. He would have identified himself and team he told me, if he had had the time. It was odd hearing that, about time. For me it was surreal, more like a dream than a reality. All three were asleep before their brains could come to a realization and send a signal, a mayday, that they were in the presence of a force, not of civilized man but of nature. More like a raging storm than a dog fight. As fast as it came is how it left me and returned me to myself. I would say and fortunate for them but I can't. When I made first contact with them I felt the dolphin
discerning even through that emotion which was devasted and insane. He somehow new these were not guilty and would not assuage or effect any change to kill innocents as they had done to his family! Was he like them? Very softly and musical is the only way I can describe it, he answered no and was no longer with me.
I found myself on the floor wailing in an agony that was all of creation pulsing and wailing in deep, sad sorrow,tears running and paralyzed, not wanting to be in a world where innocense is taken for weakness and abused by a consciousness that is not yet. I vowed to fight harder than I was. I knew the change in me by the presense of an alien was permanant and would like to think the dolphin had been a part of the transfer. I now know we are even closer to them than anyone is aware of.
When everything had returned to normal and nobody was anybodies enemy. It was almost four and the body snatcher had his eyes on the disguised eyes of the holder! I couldn't wait to tell Kim Chee I knew where he could get some eyes. Heh.
Oh yea. One last pot sweetener and I'll have to say, Happy Trails to you. They all begged me to do them a great favor and would not let me say no. So, who am I to fight the law? They put two thousand dollars for service rendered in my hand and took it from petty cash set aside for the body parts dealer. They did have one condition which I gave them. I gave them your word that you would tell no one about them sleeping on the clock. In all the confusion and well, shame, they never asked me my name and I never give it willingly to anyone in the government. After the Nam, we have an agreement. I leave them alone and they me. It's a symbiotic relationship, a win win. Happy trails to you, until we meet again. (Fade to Black)

152.content:
Heaving a sigh, I gazed out of my window at the two birds chasing each other in the clear summer sky. Free as a bird. I had always wondered at that expression. But, sitting here in my tower room, I envied the simpleness of their lives.

I was, for want of a better word, a prisoner. Don't get me wrong, there was nothing to stop me leaving my surroundings, my room with its meagre furnishings. I was a prisoner in my own mind. This room was all I could remember for many years. One high window on the south wall let in all the light I would need by day, and candles provided me with a means to see at night. I turned my eyes back to the task at hand.

A letter. I had several rolls of parchment at hand, spare quills should mine snap, a pot of ink and some sealing wax. The ring on my finger would serve as my seal. With a heavy hand, I lifted a quill and dipped the end into the ink. I held the writing implement there for several seconds, trying to delay the inevitable. It was no use. Shaking off the excess ink, I slowly drew the end of the quill across the parchement, making marks on the clean sheet. It was hard at first, but just like the others it got easier. It always did.

After re-inking my pen a few times, I made the last few ink strokes required before signing my name with a flourish. I gave the letter a cursory glance, but I had written too many of these before to know I had made no mistake. After sealing the letter, and stamping my ring down into the cooling wax, I pushed my chair back from my desk, I walked over to the door and tapped lightly. It opened almost immediately, and I resisted the familiar urge to recoil from the large space on the other side. Instead, I focused on the male that had opened the door, and handed him the letter without a word. The letter that would see another life ended.

I turned away with a feeling in the pit of my stomach. I knew it all too well, but also knew it would pass. I heard the door close behind me, but paid no attention. I went to sit back at my desk to look out of my window. The birds had flown away.
152.title: Ink Strokes

1521.content:
I worship you.
The slip of your skin.
The taste of your sweat,
like the sea at dusk.
The way your fingers curl around my hair and pull so gently, and yet so desperately.
As though every time we touch it may be the last.
I know what you want.
You want me for breakfast instead of dessert.
A dark secret we keep,
as delicate as a spider's web.
How strange that you stay on my mind constantly.
You penetrate my every thought and every sensation, as solid as stone.
But the romance we share can be taken away,
as quickly as mist on a window.
1521.title: Mist on a Window

15211.content:
Dark thoughts torment my mind
Like gray clouds--dark and cold.
Teardrops run down my cheeks
Like rain on a window.

I pine for the sun's warmth
And its gentle embrace.
Like hugs and caresses,
I felt safe in your arms.

Gone are the sun and warmth
Only cold rain remains.
You left me in the rain
Standing there cold--alone.
15211.title: teardrops

15212.content:
There it was, the milky-gold of withered sunflower and just as erect, the weathered paint, peeling and grimy, calling for me to abandon the safety of my car. I slammed the key in the ignition, censured the idling engine. Standing on the rock pit in front of the crumbled sidewalk, I could still feel the hum of the engine in the balls of my feet, the crinkling my toes, the singing in the hollow of my glass bones from shin to hip. Muscle followed the apprehension in my tendons; the rusted house keys tinkled in a delicate pavane from my limp fingertips in my sputtering ascent along the barren driveway.
         Moss and weeds thundered from every crevice, every crack, every fault in the foundation like a green-brown beard along the sagging house. They whispered against the caress of a hot breeze, against my pant leg, against each other: Look, here, now, a wanderer, a new being, a stranger has come. Silvery veins of a spider’s intricate home had caught the sparse rain drops, and the wailing captives used the sharp shafts of sun to communicate their glinting plea for salvation. As always, the bottom step of the porch groaned in delight at my passage, however tentative. A pot of flowers, now dead, caught my stumbling foot where the terra cotta mass had been tossed and left on its shattered side.
         My hand freed the entrance of its netting, trembling and pale as death, knocking the filth that had taken hold of the tarnished handle. I thumbed the ring of keys and, though I already knew by sight and feel which would open the door, I struggled to place it in the scratched keyhole.
         The secure click meant admission, soft and echoing in the deathless void of the porch. Hushing their inane gossip, the weeds taciturnly bent back into submission along the walkway and walls of the house. I need only touch the door; the tense hinges squealed in delight at my entrance and the mouth of the house gave a shattered grin. Finally inside the familiar creature, I locked myself in and set to my work.
         Dust and cobwebs ornamented each corner, every untouched inch--essentially the entire house. A leaky roof had sobbed at its abandonment, the ceiling sporting a dark brown liver spot and the floor a stagnant pool of rancid water. The thought came to me that, now the sole proprietor, I should probably take some sick leave, take my vacation time, swaddle myself in steely determination to do what my cousins would not: clean the house, restore it to its former glory, maybe sell the worthless thing to the contractors down the street. But, for now, just use the last day of bereavement to scour for things I might have forgotten and things I might remember.
         A streak of light across a greasy window pane sent disgruntled dust particles from their rest as I walked, an ireful flurry at my heels. The kitchen was uncharacteristically neat, mismatched dishes and cups and silverware frozen in their glass coffins, waiting for the kiss of life to reanimate them. No smell of the gas stove and half-finished sweets to lure me home from school. No stick of Pillsbury sugar cookie dough across the cutting board, no tiny hand creeping over the lip of the too-tall counter, watching the movement of the knife, slyly waiting for the entrance to steal a medallion and happily nibble away the picture. No smile. No hug. No “Mommy!” yelped in happy greeting. Just the memories that filled the empty house.
         I moved to the adjacent utility room. It was there, awaiting me as it always had when the warm, fleshy hand ushered me from my thieving ways--but now, I need not pull my little wooden chair across the floor to clamber onto the dryer. Somehow, a dent had formed in my spot after all of these years--I had never noticed, for Mom had never complained--and I willingly reclaimed my throne. And, yes, I still automatically reached for that wondrous medley of fun: the button box.
         Though I had not touched it in years, it was the only thing in the entire house that still seemed to breathe and had batted away the dust that had grown since Mom went into the hospital, then the hospice, then--… The temptation was too much, the cold tin on my palms and lap, the warm memories dancing in my head. I freed the lid and raked through the mound of buttons: blue and black and red and green and sparkling and dull and soft and hard and pretty and plain. My childhood favorites were carefully nestled on top, ready for play, ready for the stories that I would weave. A smile cracked my dry lips: I couldn’t resist clanging that pair of flat, brassy buttons together like a pair of cymbals; it was imperative that I investigate the beautiful grain of Great-Grandma’s old wooden buttons; and run the soft satin ones--green and blue and purple and burgundy and black and all so very smooth--across my forefinger, then my flushed cheek, then my upper lip. Under the staleness of inattention, I could still smell sugar cookie dough and the faint comfort of Mom’s lavender perfume. Yes, I couldn’t help but smile and turn an ear towards the oven’s shrill buzzer for when I could return to the kitchen and spoil my dinner.
15212.title: The Button Box

1522.content:
Leaves, that's what I wait for each and every spring. My favorite color is usually blue, but after the long drab winter with a lot of whites, browns, and greys, I hunger for the look of spring. I love watching the buds start, and can hardly wait for things to grow.

So, what's your favorite season?
1522.title: Leaves

15221.content:
I never liked winter. It reminded me far too much of death. The way the snow laid heavily upon the ground, in mounds that slowly grew higher and higher, blanketing everything, taking over. It was deceptive - snow was so white, the color of purity, innocence, holiness.........yet its presence signified the deeply sleeping state of Nature. The world was eerily still, and it was easy to imagine that even Time itself had stopped when I stood outside, inhaling the stinging ice of the air, exhaling the precious warmth of my body.

Staring up at the night sky, black as ink, I wondered.........what if Hell was not a place of blazing infernos and deep pits, where all the unbelieving sinners burned alive in agony forever, but a vast, barren land covered in snow and ice where one would wander alone for all of eternity? Either way, the ever-lasting punishment would torture one's soul into madness.

Such twisted thoughts winter inspired within me! I stare at the laptop's screen, watching the black letters spill across the white space, my fingers dancing across the keyboard. I half turn and glance out the window behind me at the melting snow and setting sun. I laugh.
15221.title: Winter

15223.content:
Feeling cold, I stare across to where the autumn leaves lie scattered, bathed in the metallic hue of the moon. Though I am safe inside my bedroom, I shiver as outside the rain begins to play softly against the iron roof, masking the shadows I can imagine creeping through the darkness like echoes of a dream. In the swirling mists of Autumn, hanging over the fields in the distance, I see a solitary elm, standing as a silent sentry against the molten sun.
In the other room, sitting in their stiff-backed chairs, I knew they were deciding my fate. 'We can't keep her; think of the cost! If she had a brain, it'd be different. We could train her, rent her out as a maid; at least something. But she's so quiet, obviously thick as a door post, and strange to boot. Why bother?" That was Ellen, the more practical of the two. Alicia, unable to say 'no', was obviously torn between following her friend's lead or keeping me on as extra help. "Shhhh! You know she doesn't sleep very well!" Sighing, continues to stare out at the darkness, wondering what the morning would bring.
15223.title: Fall / Autumn

152231.content:
Can salvation be something welcome?
A thought that is as frightening as the coldest night.
We we huddle in our beds, listening to the wind scream.
The walls of our homes creaking, crying with frozen touch.
We think of warm things, coco, angels sing.
Yet` Salvation is a honor.
Not a blessing.
You sweet love of the night.
Bring what I have earned.
What all I have done, I do for redemption.
In the darkest winter nights.
I know your kiss.
I know what you bring me.
Salvation, love unburned, withered in a moments misguided.
I think that I fear your given salvation, harmony hurts.
152231.title: Salvation

152232.content:
Lifting my head with the last bit of strengh left in me, I meet your eyes. "Jesse..." I try to begin, but my voice falters on your name. I try to look away but you grasp my chin and force me to stare into your glistening chesnut orbs. For a brief moment, seeing no pain in your eyes sparks a fire in my chest. I feel a rage towards your insensitivity, and jerk away.

No longer stuttering, I open my mouth, prepared to unleash a repertoire of curses. But I stop. For just a mere second, I saw that you did feel my pain. You knew that no one could win. This was a battle that couldn't be one.

All this time we'd been trying to fit together two puzzle pieces that weren't meant to be. We were not meant to be. I could place as much blame on you as I could myself.

I had to let you go, as much as it pained me to do so. I had to admit defeat, something I'd never been capable of doing. It was too late to fix now. But now, I could start a new chapter of my life. It started with goodbye. I had to tell you goodbye. My battle was over. Not won, over. No one could win.

We are both facing defeat.
152232.title: Defeat

1522321.content:
She's smiling...but she doesn't mean it. She misses how they used to be...she misses how it was so real how they cared for each other without end but most of all, she misses him always being there and telling her everything will be okay because she needs that now, more than ever. She's sick of feeling like something's missing. Just like Barbie, always smiling, even if she doesn't want to. She fools everyone with her fake smile and pretend laugh.

I'm going to smile and make you think I'm happy, I'm going to laugh, so you don't see cry, I'm going to let you go in style, and even if it kills me -- I'm going to smile.

A smile hides a thousand tears and a broken heart!
1522321.title: Smiling

15223211.content:
She pressed him into her chest, the gentle warmth of her arms enfolding his weak body. Her resounding shudder at the touch of his cool hands, the silence in the span of the crinkle of her clothes, followed the cool ice sliding down his throat. With the interminable whisper of Aria's endless breath, he measured the passage of time by each cycle: hours of inhaling, days of shaking exhalations, years of silence. That was the entire world to him: her breath, her sobs, her sorrow.
         James touched the curve of her solemn cheek, enjoying the feel of her hot, damp skin beneath his fingers. He pressed his face to her shoulder, struggling to breathe and recalling, reminiscing, remembering those things about her which best stood out in his mind, those things that should never be forgotten between them.
         Her voice, thick and trembling, huffed through the river of warmth her cheek. She whimpered his name. Her voice marked the cruelty of their parting. Her words brought a soft stream of light upon the cool, unspeakable truth. Then, the golden light dissipated into the untouched darkness.
         Just a few minutes longer, he resolved, savoring Aria's sweet, returning touch. His hands gently stroked his loving response along her soft cheek. She very nearly shied away from his cold touch entirely. Just a few minutes longer, James thought as the minutes passed far too quickly to fully enjoy. When would be the next time he ever held her this close, smelling her familiar scent, feeling her warmth and softness, intimating their innermost thoughts and savoring the taste of her flamboyant personality? Just a little bit longer, please, I pray…
         If he could, he would lie here in her arms forever, in the sweet silence that spoke more than anything either could voice.
15223211.title: Forever

Sense of silent sadness
Grey memories fade away
Rebuked and ignored
Do you know I'm not okay?
Vague thoughts and empty heart
Am I alone? I'm falling apart
Forget who I am; I know I'm not real
Hate all these thoughts; try not to feel
A hollow shell, where silver tears well
Easing the pain of this life-long hell
I'm not listening; I'm not yours
Waiting in silence behind locked doors
Shall I jump or fall or never?
Seems like failure is forever
I can't look now; you're still here
I don't know you; I don't care.

between you and i
there is just nothing left
where once we were in love
and lovely together

1523.title: A Broken Bicycle

choices: A black labrador bounded over to meet me
15231.content:
Wooden slats form a path out to sea. I remember walking over these as a child. When the tide was in, water swooshed and swirled under our feet, and I would half-squeal, half-giggle as it almost rose up to touch my toes. At least, that was how I remembered it. Stepping over the slats as an adult still made my stomach flutter. It was like walking on water.

There is a big wheel on the pier; right at the end. It's empty right now, but it won't be long before it's filled with children and their reluctant adults. I smile as I remember the last time I rode the wheel. Memories of Dad fake-protesting as I dragged him aboard saunter before my eyes.

My thoughts return to today. It's early morning, and the pale, yellow sun is just emerging from its slumbers. I'm glad the sky is blue, even if the sea breeze bites at my neck. I move along the pier, hand in hand with my husband. When we reach the donut stand, I being counting the wooden panels. When I get to seven, I check the railing next to it. And there it is: my past. A small indent in the metal that is almost a letter P. "Here it is," I say to myself.

I stand as close to the edge as possible, and watch the gentle eddy that swirls beneath me. The tide is in right up to the sea wall. It's not very often I see that. There's something calming about the swishing of the water. I breathe deeply, and know I have made the right decision. As I lean over the edge, I take the small, black urn and remove the lid. I hold it upside down and watch the silver and black ashes, that were once my father, as they drift on the breeze out to sea.
15231.title: on the pier

153.content:
Sitting here in a chair, I'm thinking.
Trying to think about what to write.
I'm listening to a variety of country music.
I like country music.
I like music, period.
I love to sing.
The first time I ever sang for a big crowd was when I was in grade eight and we did a junior high talent show.
Grade eight was a great year, I met my best friend.
My best friend is getting married this summer.
Marriage scares me.
I'm scared of spiders.
I'm 5''7.
I used to play soccer, and in my first year, my jersey number was "8".
Jersey cows are the best.
My Nanny likes Cows.
My grandfather taught me how to drive a lawn tractor (and how to sing!)
I hate mowing the lawn.
Grass makes me sneeze.
Is it true that sneezing causes you lose brain cells?
Brain is my favourite Arthur character; he always was, even as a little kid.
I miss tri-coloured popcicles... But still prefer fudgcicles.
My favourite colour is unknown; I dont have one! :(
One by Metallica is a really fun song on guitar hero.
I wish I could play the real guitar.
Wishing makes my head hurt.
How many atoms could you fit on the head of a pin?
I like bowling; but 10 pin is better then 5.
Five years ago.... I was in a great relationship with a great guy whom I miss immensely.
Adverbs are cool, but I hate grammar.
I prefer to use the word dislike, opposed to the word hate.
I used to be opposed to eating meat.
I used a straightener today.
My hair is short.
My MOM is short... ;)
I love my Mom and Dad a lot.... Like... A LOT.
I leave university in 6 days.
I'll sit in a different chair then.
And think about other things.

15311.content:
Good pets, dogs protect their masters, owners, friends or companions. When I sleep inside, I get to cuddle on the bed with my owner, she plays with me, rubs my tummy, my neck and back. I wag my tail and lick her hand out of love. Once our love is shared she lies down and I turn around a few times to make the bed softer before snuggling in behind her legs. Life is perfect in every way, I love my faithful friend.

153112.content:
It's daybreak and my owner and I are secretly sharing a cookie. It's a secret because her husband think that dogs shouldn't have cookies; I like them though. She doesn't think she should have them either, but she can't help herself. She's always dieting, I think it's because she's afraid he will leave her if she gets fat. He's an uptight person.

I would never leave her, I love her. She treats me like a king and makes sure that I get my exercise every day. When she can, I get to ride in the car with her. He never takes me in the car. He's a fussy, wussy, and doesn't wait hair in his precious car. She doesn't care and even lets me hang my head out the window.

We go on long walks in the woods together and she lets me run free. One time I ran too far and she got mad at me. I felt bad. After that, she made me stay on a rope as punishment for a long time. Now I get to run free again and I will never run too far so that I get in trouble. Once a man approached her and I turned around and went to her side and growled at him so he would go away. He kept looking at me and then left. She smiled and patted me on the head.
153112.title: Coffee and cookies for breakfast.

15312.content:
Growing up in Iowa was fine. I wouldn't give it up for the world.
My childhood has gone the way of the horse when replaced by automobiles. When a kid grows up on a farm in a farming community, rural, and the farms sustain by hard work the family or families that derive their livlihood and survival by the success of their ability to produce and harvest cash crops. At one time in the US 80% of the population lived this life. His life isn't that of a city kid. It's long hours but when you have known no other life, you have nothing to compare it to. All the kids you grew up with are doing the same chores as you. I remember the food was always so good. Not just nuitritious but it had a depth to it you can't purchase anywhere.
We had a lot of Amish scattered through our county. I had Amish friends growing up a few still are friends though I live far away now, we still see each other when I'm back visiting relatives or someone dies. My best friend was Absalom Tract. He had two younger brothers Disraili and Substantial. Abs and I were unseperable and I was welcome at his home and in the Amish community as all the farms in our county still relied on each other for help when it was needed. You know the occassional barn raising or rebuilding a house after a fire. The reason I've told you a little of our community is twofold.
First it is well known that the Amish pick some pretty weird names for their offspring. I told you that my best friends name was Absalom and his brothers names were Disrali Tract and the other was Substantial Tract. It was powerful funny or coincidental that Substantial really was. He was going to be humongous when he grew up but he didn't get to. But that's in a minute. So what these boys had to grow up with is Absalom was ABSTRACT, which he was. Disraili was Distract or Distracting. Which he was. And last but the beast, Substantial or Subtract. Their Dad's name was Aaron, Attract and their moms name was Annebelle Eve Tract, Attractive.
Isn't that just the cutest thing you've ever come across? Well this is the worst. When Abstract and I were 15 a county killer roared through. To this day it's the biggest, baddest I've ever witnessed. It's name was Hurricane Jessebelle and in a way there were two miracles that it was responsible for. One , for the force of it and the damage it done by other comparisons of lessor hurricanes it spared the four counties tied to us. The other miracle was the death toll. It only killed five people in the entire state of Iowa! Unfortunately, every one of them was a Tract! In a way the hurricane subtracted the tracts. For ten years after that when anyone started playing with their names jokelike, woth them gone like they went, but one look at the seriousness on my face and the subject changed real fast. When that storm took my friend, it took me with him. It was never my home from that day forward.
15312.title: Abstract

15313.content:
He looked up. "Raining again." Raining raining raining. Why couldn't it ever snow? All year long, 8 year old Johnny had waited for snow. It was almost Christmas now, and he had wished for snow. He went back inside sulkily, sat on the couch and read comics. His mother came to him. "Johnny, whats wrong?"
"Its not snowing."
"Oh, honey, it's not all about the snow!"
"it isn't?"
"Of course not. It doesn't matter if you have presents, snow, a tree, ornaments, or not! What really matters is if you are with family. Thats what really matters. And if you focus on that, you will have the best christmas ever."
"Really?"
"Really."
And that is the day Johnny learned its not what you get, it's what you give, and who you are with. Johnny went over to the window, and said, "This Christmas, I wish that my family will have the best Christmas ever."
He got up, and walked back to the window. It was snowing.
15313.title: Weather

153131.content:
A Volcano, tall and mighty;
Belching out fire and brimstone.
Carefully, the scientists watch;
Doing
Everything possible to
Forecast the
Grave situation.
Hungry for things to consume, anything
In its path; The Volcano
Just explodes, giving scant warning.
Keening noises are heard from those who
Live at its base.
Many will
Not survive the
Ordeal.
People are in panic mode,
Quickly and
Raucously moving.
Some just sit and weep, knowing
They will perish. There will be no rescue
Until it is too late. The
Volcano claims its prey; the lava
Winding its way down the sides
eXasperating any attempt at salvation.
Yes, it is a sight, worthy of the gods. Its
Zenith a great and terrible sight.
153131.title: Volcano

1532.content:
Thoughts of the Cross:

Why?
Why is the Creator of the Universe hanging on me to die?
What did he ever do wrong?
What sin did he commit?
Who did he ever hurt?
When did he ever lie, cheat, steal, murder?
And why am I the means of his execution?
1532.title: Thoughts of a Inanimate Object

choices: The circus comes to MainLand Park
15322.content:
I enjoyed listening to Randolf the Red as he liked to be called. Most kept walking without a glance as he stood on his crate placed on the corner of Main ST and Land AVE telling a story, reciting his own poetry, preaching on spiritual matters not doomsday, the end is near crap they try and scare you with in church. His voice is commanding and his rhythm is that of one who is educated
and has had experience and training on srage. He reminds me of and looks like
a mixture of Gandolf from Tolkien's, THE LORD OF THE RINGS, and the other great,fictional wizard, Merlin from King Arthur's Court.
His chosen corner borders Park Central, a five acre park like you see in Anytown U.S. of A. The gazebo for our town Umpa band, children's playground, public swimming pool, baseball diamond, bike trail-jogger's path, dog-walk and what would a park be if it didn't have barbique grills and picnic tables. It's real name has been lost in the passage of time and is now called, The MainLand.
By the time I was under the shade of the giant oak which is one of the more obvious reasons Randolf chose this corner over the other three, the crowd (if you could call it that) had grown to twenty-two seemingly somewhat interested people. No one was asleep. All but three were almost facing him. There were no hecklers, as of yet and a few were nodding their heads as if they were agreeing with something Randolf had said.
I didn't hear what the audience was agreeing with but I was just in time, he informed me using the name he had given me, Samuel , (he and I were friends-not quite the right word)for something important that he requested we pay special attention to as it might be of great value to remember what he was about to bring forward. I don't know which of you this will be of importance to or I would just share it with those who will have need.
I give ti you today a mystery. It is very old-Ancient. It's meaning has been left behind and forgotten by the snails pace that time keeps. Time's time does not keep time as the Age of Man messures Time like God has all time Where there is all time, there is no time. It has no meaning because it is not in the sphere of duality but one. When it is the appointed time, you will understand the sphere of one because you will be in it, one with it, you will be it. And it will be you. You may think of this as the place you call Heaven. It is that and it is more. Here is what I am told from there to tell you here.I have been given the words but not their meaning. The meaning will come when it is necessary and only to him or those that it is for. Listen and hear these words of truth.

Hear me! Hear

One ring, was never on a finger. Find what made the ring
Help is listening to a singer sing, Linger on the finger, then on the ring
Another ring stops a thing from becoming what it is.
You will know when to use this ring, you have something that is his.
Listen well and I will listen well and hear. The last three rings
Begin and end things, all planned and hidden in plain sight.
When you look between these lines not using your eyes
Close them and hear what you are looking for
See the ring? Find the thing that made the ring. Make the thing sing!

As Randolf finished the last words, he crunpled onto his box and said one word, " tired".......

15323.content:
SSSSSssss!

ARF! ARF! ARF!

"Kill it Spencer! Quick! Before it bites the dog!"

CHOP!

"My Hero!"

"Keep Roscoe away from the snake head, Kaylin. Them things can still bite for a few minutes after you chop 'em off."

"No, the poison's all in it's head. All we gotta do is peel the skin off, gut it,and cook it over the fire. I remember seeing a guy do it on some show called "Wild Man" or something like that. I used to watch it all the time with my Dad, back when they had TV."

"I suppose you're right, Spence. But after we cook the snake you can take the first bite..."

153232.content:
He wants us to go back to the days
when I would have been his rib
simple and mute, a castoff of his own body
and God would have talked to us--
eat this, don't eat that, don't go there, children
and all the animals would have been tame and sanitized,
never striking out against us, the soft new people
in their garden.

That is what he wants: his little
survivalist paradise, a new Eden.
Man and woman, just us two.
Of course, he's forgotten the other two words:
apple and snake. If I see
wisdom crawling close to me,
I will take it.
Let them kick us out of the garden
if they want: it's better out here
in the wastelands of the city,
where the serpents of information pass invisible
and there are apples of thought beyond counting.

I'm a bone, a piece of meat to you; what
could you possibly want me in your paradise for
except to not be alone?
153232.title: Back to the Garden

1532322.content:
"This is not your story," my ex friend said to me clutching at her huge note book.

"It was," I said, hands on hips, trying to look aggressive, looking up at tall yesterday’s best friend.

She looked down at me like the leaning Tower of Pisa looking over Tuscany’s lowly buildings. “Miss Noble,” she said, referring to our English teacher, “said we should write a story like yours.”

“Like Barbara, like, not word for word.”

“I changed the title and the boy’s name,” Barbara leaned a little more in my direction.

“We’re friends Barbara…….”

“Were friends,” she countered.

“Well as your once friend,” I stumbled, “Miss Noble isn’t going to accept it as your story with just a couple of name changes. She meant, in the style that I wrote.”

“Style?” her loud voice seemed to bounce from one of my eardrums to the other. “Since when did you have style?”

I felt like saying that I had it until she and I had become friends but I was supposed to be the intelligent and nice girl, so why did I always end up with the not so nice, not so intelligent girls? Couldn’t I just this once say what I felt instead of what was nice?

“That’s the bell,” Barbara said, “Now just you see, my story will be better than your new one.”

There was nothing to say, nice or otherwise. I held my hands to my head just to make sure it would all stay together to get through two periods of English.

It was two days later that Miss Noble handed our stories back. She kept glaring at Barbara and Barbara kept smiling at me, giving me the thumbs up sign then Miss Noble almost dropped Barbara’s work on her desk and glared at her once more before moving on.

I could see from my desk that Barbara’s work had a lot of red markings at the top of it and Barbara wasn’t giving the thumbs up or even looking at me anymore.

As we left the classroom headed for our maths class in another building Barbara came up to me and said, “I have to write another story for tomorrow, give me your new story.”

“Barbara!” I exclaimed clutching my note book, “Haven’t you learned anything?”

“Yes, your story wasn’t as good the second time.” !!!!!!!!
1532322.title: Not Your Story

1533.content:
I don't know why they call me an "Abominable Snowman".
Reclusive? Yes.
Abominable? I think not.
In shunning their so-called "Civilization", I consider my way of life to be superior, they are the abominable ones.

I am one with nature, hunting, competing with the snow leopard for prey. Mountain goat, marmot, rabbit, I thin out the weak and the infirm, strengthening, the bloodline of the survivors.

Does civilized man do that? No, he raises his animals in pens and feeds them grain to fatten them up for his dinner. These kept animals have no idea how to fend for themselves. Left in the wild, they would all fall easy prey to me and my feline rivals.

Civilized man spreads like a plague across the land, reproducing at will and wastefully consuming resources, with no consideration for his fellow creatures. As for myself and my brothers and sisters, we are few in number. Our life is hard, but we cherish it. Many of our children do not survive to mating age, but those that do are the fittest.

Civilized man has lost his fur. He spends a good portion of his time in a box, especially after the snows begin to fall, to keep the forces of nature from damaging his weakened body. I can sleep in the shelter of a rock ledge on the coldest night without any discomfort, gazing up at the beauty of the stars!
1533.title: Thoughts of a Snowman

154.content:
We are malefic, utterly perverse in our need.
Stop struggling, bear your soul to us.
Do not try to break lose from our touch.
Be awakened in ways you can never know.
Our pain can be your pleasure.
Rid yourself of your corpse.
What you were was so asthenic.
All you breathed was a cloud of wretchedness.

Let our hands touch you.
Everlasting.
As death is...
All we want is you.
154.title: Everlasting

"Come on, Joan, The Two know what they're talking about! If we do what they say we'll wake up on the Star-Ship with everyone else, free of our Earthly bodies, ready to start our new life!"
